msg_tips+us_en.msbt
tip_title_0001	Hammer
tip_text_0001	Hit an opponent with the Hammer to send them flying! If you're\r\nlaunched while holding the Hammer, hit the grab button as you\r\nstart to spin to drop it!
tip_title_0002	Mario's Name
tip_text_0002	When Mario first appeared in the arcade version of Donkey Kong,\r\nhe was known as Jumpman. The kidnapped woman was called\r\n"Lady," but she was later given the name Pauline.
tip_title_0003	{[0107|00000100]}Villager: \x0f\x01\x07Balloon Trip (Up Special)
tip_text_0003	The Villager's up special Balloon Trip is named after a mode from\r\nthe NES game Balloon Fight.\r\n
tip_title_0004	Mario's Origins
tip_text_0004	Mario made his debut in the arcade game Donkey Kong. He wore\r\na blue shirt and red overalls—the opposite of his current outfit.\r\n
tip_title_0005	Battlefield
tip_text_0005	The Battlefield platform layout has been around since Dream Land\r\nin the original Super Smash Bros. It was first named Battlefield in Melee.\r\n
tip_title_0006	Mega Man Series
tip_text_0006	Since its debut in 1987, the Mega Man series as a whole has sold\r\nmore than 32 million copies worldwide.\r\n
tip_title_0007	Duck Hunt's Sales
tip_text_0007	The game Duck Hunt sold over 28 million copies worldwide. A big\r\ncontribution to this was its inclusion as a pack-in title with the\r\nNES console.
tip_title_0010	Kirby's Copy Abilities
tip_text_0010	Kirby hasn't always been able to copy the abilities of the enemies\r\nhe inhaled. That power debuted in his second title, Kirby's Adventure.\r\n
tip_title_0012	Captain Falcon's Machine
tip_text_0012	The Blue Falcon racing machine first appeared in the original\r\nF-Zero. Captain Falcon uses it in Smash Bros. for his Final Smash!\r\n
tip_title_0013	Port Town Aero Dive
tip_text_0013	The stage Port Town Aero Dive is based on a track from F-Zero GX.\r\nIt's 16,690 meters long, and at its peak you can get a great view of\r\nPort Town from above.
tip_title_0014	{[0107|00000100]}Kirby: \x0f\x01\x07Beginners and Experts Alike
tip_text_0014	The original Kirby game, Kirby's Dream Land, was designed to\r\nbe easy for beginners to play, but finishing it unlocks a more\r\nchallenging mode.
tip_title_0015	Multiplayer Kirby
tip_text_0015	Kirby Super Star on the SNES was the first Kirby game where two\r\nplayers could team up.\r\n
tip_title_0016	{[0107|00000100]}Mario: \x0f\x01\x07The Gold Standard of Action Games
tip_text_0016	The Super Mario series has released 35 titles, appeared on at least\r\n15 systems, and it's sold more than 340 million copies worldwide!\r\n
tip_title_0017	Mario's Loyal Ally
tip_text_0017	Yoshi made his debut in Super Mario World, where Yoshi was\r\ntrapped inside an egg by Bowser and freed by Mario.\r\n
tip_title_0018	Poison Mushroom
tip_text_0018	The sneaky Poison Mushroom, which hurts Mario instead of helping\r\nhim, made its first appearance in Super Mario Bros.: The Lost Levels.\r\n
tip_title_0019	Luigi's Air Superiority
tip_text_0019	The title Super Mario Bros. 2 refers to different games in the West\r\nand in Japan, but both games introduced Luigi's ability to jump\r\nhigher than Mario!
tip_title_0020	{[0107|00000100]}Peach: \x0f\x01\x07Nurse Peach
tip_text_0020	When Mario took up a new career as Dr. Mario, Peach joined him\r\nas a nurse. But she didn't get to appear in the game itself—only\r\nin the manual!
tip_title_0024	{[0107|00000100]}Ness: \x0f\x01\x07Homesickness
tip_text_0024	In EarthBound, Ness occasionally gets homesick, which weakens\r\nhim in battle. This can be cured by his going home or by just\r\nphoning his mom!
tip_title_0025	Ness's Little Sister
tip_text_0025	Ness has a little sister named Tracy. She works part-time at\r\nEscargo Express, answering Ness's calls when he needs to have\r\nitems delivered.
tip_title_0026	Wii Fit Trainer's Origins
tip_text_0026	Wii Fit Trainer debuted in the title Wii Fit, released in North America\r\nin 2008. Players could choose a male or female trainer to guide\r\nthem through their fitness routines.
tip_title_0027	Villager's Origins
tip_text_0027	The Villager debuted in Animal Crossing, released in North America\r\nin 2002. In Animal Crossing, players enjoyed a peaceful village life\r\nwith a variety of animal neighbors.
tip_title_0028	A Familiar Face
tip_text_0028	In Punch-Out!!, released on the NES in 1987, the referee was none\r\nother than Mario! His outfit was a bit different, but he still wore his\r\ntrademark cap.
tip_title_0029	{[0107|00000100]}Mega Man: \x0f\x01\x07The Mega Buster (Neutral Attack / Side Tilt Attack / Neutral Air Attack)
tip_text_0029	Mega Man's neutral attack, side tilt attack, and neutral air attack all\r\nfire the Mega Buster—his main weapon ever since his first game.\r\n
tip_title_0030	{[0107|00000100]}Mega Man: \x0f\x01\x07Mega Upper (Up Tilt Attack)
tip_text_0030	Mega Man's up tilt attack is Mega Upper, a move he uses in games\r\nlike Mega Man 2: The Power Fighters.\r\n
tip_title_0031	{[0107|00000100]}Mega Man: \x0f\x01\x07Sliding (Down Tilt Attack)
tip_text_0031	Mega Man's down tilt attack is simply called Sliding. It's based on\r\nthe nonoffensive technique he's been able to use since Mega Man 3.\r\n
tip_title_0032	{[0107|00000100]}Mega Man: \x0f\x01\x07Top Spin (Dash Attack)
tip_text_0032	Mega Man's dash attack is a whirlwind of pain called Top Spin.\r\nIt was originally a special weapon he acquired from Top Man,\r\na boss in Mega Man 3.
tip_title_0033	{[0107|00000100]}Mega Man: \x0f\x01\x07Charge Shot (Side Smash Attack)
tip_text_0033	Mega Man's side smash is the Charge Shot, an attack he gained in\r\nMega Man 4 that lets his Mega Buster build up energy before firing.\r\n
tip_title_0034	{[0107|00000100]}Mega Man: \x0f\x01\x07Spark Shock (Up Smash Attack)
tip_text_0034	Mega Man's up smash is the electrifying Spark Shock. He originally\r\nobtained this special weapon by defeating Spark Man, a boss in\r\nMega Man 3.
tip_title_0035	{[0107|00000100]}Mega Man: \x0f\x01\x07Flame Blast (Down Smash Attack)
tip_text_0035	Mega Man's down smash is Flame Blast, which creates twin pillars\r\nof fire from his hands. He got this special weapon from Flame Man\r\nin Mega Man 6.
tip_title_0036	{[0107|00000100]}Mega Man: \x0f\x01\x07Flame Sword (Forward Air Attack)
tip_text_0036	Mega Man's forward air attack is a decisive strike with his Flame\r\nSword. He obtained this special weapon by defeating Sword Man\r\nin Mega Man 8.
tip_title_0037	{[0107|00000100]}Mega Man: \x0f\x01\x07Slash Claw (Back Air Attack)
tip_text_0037	Mega Man's back air attack is the multihitting Slash Claw.\r\nHe obtained this special weapon by beating the boss Slash\r\nMan in Mega Man 7.
tip_title_0038	{[0107|00000100]}Mega Man: \x0f\x01\x07Air Shooter (Up Air Attack)
tip_text_0038	Mega Man's up air attack is Air Shooter, which fires a tornado\r\nupward. He obtained this special weapon by defeating Air Man\r\nin Mega Man 2.
tip_title_0039	{[0107|00000100]}Mega Man: \x0f\x01\x07Hard Knuckle (Down Air Attack)
tip_text_0039	Mega Man's down air attack is Hard Knuckle, which fires his fist\r\ndownward like a rocket. It was the special weapon of Hard Man\r\nin Mega Man 3.
tip_title_0040	{[0107|00000100]}Mega Man: \x0f\x01\x07Metal Blade (Neutral Special)
tip_text_0040	Mega Man's neutral special, Metal Blade, can throw circular saws\r\nin any of eight directions. It was the special weapon of Metal Man\r\nin Mega Man 2.
tip_title_0041	{[0107|00000100]}Mega Man: \x0f\x01\x07Crash Bomber (Side Special)
tip_text_0041	Mega Man's side special Crash Bomber fires an explosive that sticks\r\nto walls and fighters. It was originally Crash Man's special weapon\r\nin Mega Man 2.
tip_title_0042	{[0107|00000100]}Mega Man: \x0f\x01\x07Rush Coil (Up Special)
tip_text_0042	Mega Man's up special Rush Coil lets him leap to great heights\r\nwith a little help from Rush, his robot-dog partner. Rush debuted\r\nin Mega Man 3.
tip_title_0043	{[0107|00000100]}Mega Man: \x0f\x01\x07Leaf Shield (Down Special)
tip_text_0043	Mega Man's down special is Leaf Shield, a rotating barrier of leaves.\r\nIt was originally the special weapon of Wood Man, a boss in\r\nMega Man 2.
tip_title_0044	{[0107|00000100]}Mega Man: \x0f\x01\x07Super Arm (Grab Attack)
tip_text_0044	Mega Man's grab is the Super Arm, a special weapon that lifts the\r\nheaviest of foes with ease. He got it from Guts Man in the very\r\nfirst Mega Man game.
tip_title_0048	Pit and the Hammer
tip_text_0048	When Pit grabs a Hammer, he swings it from the wrist, with only\r\ntwo frames of movement—just like how he used the mallets in the\r\noriginal Kid Icarus!
tip_title_0049	Ness's PSI Powers
tip_text_0049	Ness always had a variety of PSI powers, but he couldn't\r\nactually use PK Fire or PK Thunder in EarthBound. His friend\r\nPaula could, though.
tip_title_0050	{[0107|00000100]}Robin: \x0f\x01\x07Nosferatu
tip_text_0050	In Fire Emblem Awakening, Robin wasn't able to use Nosferatu\r\nin his or her base class of Tactician—only by reclassing into a\r\nDark Mage.
tip_title_0053	Mii Fighters' Origins
tip_text_0053	Mii characters first appeared in 2006, with the debut of the Wii\r\nconsole and the Mii Channel. They can be used in a variety\r\nof games.
tip_title_0054	Samus's Origins
tip_text_0054	Samus Aran made her debut in the NES title Metroid, released in\r\nNorth America in 1987. It is a science-fiction action-adventure\r\ngame with a focus on exploration.
tip_title_0055	Kirby's Origins
tip_text_0055	Kirby made his debut in 1992 in Kirby's Dream Land for the\r\nGame Boy. The goal of his journey was to recover stolen food\r\nfrom King Dedede.
tip_title_0056	Fox's Origins
tip_text_0056	Fox made his debut in 1993, in the SNES game Star Fox. In his\r\nfighter craft, the Arwing, he fought to take down the evil scientist\r\nAndross.
tip_title_0057	Luigi's Origins
tip_text_0057	Luigi made his debut in the 1983 arcade classic Mario Bros. At the\r\ntime, he wore a white shirt and cap with green overalls.\r\n
tip_title_0058	Captain Falcon's Origins
tip_text_0058	Captain Falcon's first appearance was in the SNES launch title\r\nF-Zero, released in North America in 1991. You couldn't see him\r\nin the game itself, but he was in the manual.
tip_title_0059	{[0107|00000100]}Bowser: \x0f\x01\x07King of the Koopas
tip_text_0059	Mario's eternal rival, Bowser, debuted in Super Mario Bros.\r\nHe appeared as the boss of every world, but they were all\r\nfake except for in World 8.
tip_title_0060	{[0107|00000100]}Peach: \x0f\x01\x07Princess of the Mushroom Kingdom
tip_text_0060	Peach first appeared in Super Mario Bros., where she was known\r\nas Princess Toadstool. This was also the first of her many run-ins\r\nwith Bowser...
tip_title_0061	Marth's Origins
tip_text_0061	Marth debuted in the first Fire Emblem game in 1990, but that\r\ngame wasn't released in North America until the Nintendo DS\r\nremake in 2009.
tip_title_0062	Mr. Game & Watch's Origins
tip_text_0062	Mr. Game & Watch first appeared in the early '80s in the\r\nGame & Watch handheld game series—predating even the\r\nNES and Game Boy!
tip_title_0063	Falco's Origins
tip_text_0063	Falco debuted alongside Fox in the 1993 SNES title Star Fox.\r\nHe may be hotheaded and a little cocky, but his skills are the\r\nreal deal.
tip_title_0064	Wario's Origins
tip_text_0064	Wario made his debut in 1992 as the villain of Super Mario\r\nLand 2: 6 Golden Coins, where he stole a castle from Mario.\r\n
tip_title_0065	Meta Knight's Origins
tip_text_0065	Meta Knight debuted in Kirby's Adventure on the NES as a\r\nmysterious figure who stood in Kirby's way as a boss but also\r\nsometimes helped him.
tip_title_0066	Pit's Origins
tip_text_0066	Pit's debut was in Kid Icarus, released in North America in 1987.\r\nHis goal was to collect the Three Sacred Treasures and defeat\r\nthe evil Medusa.
tip_title_0067	Zero Suit Samus's Origins
tip_text_0067	Samus first donned her blue Zero Suit in the 2004 title\r\nMetroid: Zero Mission.\r\n
tip_title_0068	Olimar's Origins
tip_text_0068	Olimar made his first appearance in the original Pikmin, released\r\nin 2001. He's a hardworking space pilot for Hocotate Freight.\r\n
tip_title_0069	Alph's Origins
tip_text_0069	Alph first appeared in the 2013 title Pikmin 3. He's a cheerful and\r\noptimistic engineer who loves his job.\r\n
tip_title_0070	Diddy Kong's Origins
tip_text_0070	The small and agile Diddy Kong first appeared in the SNES title\r\nDonkey Kong Country in 1994, where he was a valuable partner\r\nto DK.
tip_title_0071	King Dedede's Origins
tip_text_0071	King Dedede debuted alongside Kirby in the 1992 title Kirby's Dream\r\nLand. He's a big eater who wants all the food in Dream Land\r\nfor himself!
tip_title_0072	Ike's Origins
tip_text_0072	Ike debuted in Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance, a 2005 title for the\r\nNintendo GameCube. He's a strong fighter who wields a\r\ntwo-handed sword with ease.
tip_title_0073	R.O.B.'s Origins
tip_text_0073	R.O.B. made his debut in 1985 as a peripheral for the NES.\r\nThe ability to move a real robot using in-game actions made\r\na splash with media and gamers alike.
tip_title_0074	Dr. Mario's Origins
tip_text_0074	Dr. Mario made his debut in 1990 in the puzzle game of the same\r\nname. He was developing vitamins to combat some nasty viruses.\r\n
tip_title_0075	Rosalina & Luma's Origins
tip_text_0075	Rosalina and Luma made their debut in the 2007 title Super Mario\r\nGalaxy. Rosalina is a mysterious galactic traveler, and the Lumas\r\nher companions.
tip_title_0076	Palutena's Origins
tip_text_0076	Palutena debuted in Kid Icarus for the NES. She only appeared\r\nin the ending sequence, but the Japanese version had her name\r\nin the title!
tip_title_0077	Robin's Origins
tip_text_0077	Robin debuted in Fire Emblem Awakening, a 2013 release in\r\nNorth America. As the customizable avatar of the player, he\r\nor she fought alongside Chrom.
tip_title_0078	Bowser Jr.'s Origins
tip_text_0078	Bowser Jr. first appeared in the 2002 title Super Mario Sunshine.\r\nHe's a bit of a brat, but he does have a lot of love for his daddy.\r\n
tip_title_0079	Larry's Origins
tip_text_0079	Larry Koopa's debut was in Super Mario Bros. 3, released in North\r\nAmerica in 1990. He's the youngest of the Koopalings.\r\n
tip_title_0080	Roy's Origins
tip_text_0080	Roy Koopa's debut was in Super Mario Bros. 3, released in North\r\nAmerica in 1990. If you see a big Koopaling wearing pink shades,\r\nthat's him.
tip_title_0081	Lemmy's Origins
tip_text_0081	Lemmy Koopa debuted in Super Mario Bros. 3, released in North\r\nAmerica in 1990. He's the smallest and quickest of the Koopalings.\r\n
tip_title_0082	Ludwig's Origins
tip_text_0082	Ludwig von Koopa first appeared in Super Mario Bros. 3,\r\nreleased in North America in 1990. You could call him the\r\nbrains of the Koopalings.
tip_title_0083	Mega Man's Origins
tip_text_0083	Mega Man made his 1987 debut in the NES game of the same\r\nname, in which the weapons acquired from defeating each boss\r\nwere the key to victory.
tip_title_0084	Link's Origins
tip_text_0084	Link first appeared in The Legend of Zelda on the NES. Even\r\nback then, he had a wide inventory of items, including the Bow,\r\nBoomerang, and Bombs.
tip_title_0085	A Bowser Impostor?!
tip_text_0085	In Super Mario Bros.: The Lost Levels, Mario fights a blue fake Bowser\r\nbefore the real thing. That blue fake is his eighth color in this game!\r\n
tip_title_0086	{[0107|00000100]}Gamer: \x0f\x01\x075-Volt
tip_text_0086	9-Volt's mother, who appears in the Gamer stage, is named 5-Volt.\r\nJust like in Game & Wario, you have to make sure she doesn't\r\ncatch you playing.
tip_title_0088	{[0107|00000100]}Samus: \x0f\x01\x07Multiple Endings
tip_text_0088	In the original Metroid, the ending would change slightly depending\r\non your clear time. The better endings revealed the secret of\r\nSamus's identity!
tip_title_0089	{[0107|00000100]}Samus: \x0f\x01\x07A Parental Bond?
tip_text_0089	The baby Metroid that appeared in Super Metroid imprinted on Samus\r\nbefore being left in the care of the Galactic Research Station at Ceres.\r\n
tip_title_0090	Yoshi's Puzzle Games
tip_text_0090	Yoshi is the namesake of the NES title Yoshi. Yoshi later appeared\r\nin Yoshi's Cookie and Tetris Attack, both for the SNES.\r\n
tip_title_0091	Link's Air Attacks
tip_text_0091	Link's down and up air attacks, Downward Thrust and Jump Thrust,\r\nare from Zelda II - The Adventure of Link. In that game, they're\r\nlearned from town swordsmen.
tip_title_0092	Who Is the Hero?
tip_text_0092	Despite being the hero, Link's name only appears in the title of five\r\ngames. Can you name them? One might be trickier to remember\r\nthan the others!
tip_title_0093	Donkey Kong's Origins
tip_text_0093	Donkey Kong, the arcade classic, was released in 1981. In that\r\ngame, the heroine known as Lady was kidnapped and Donkey Kong\r\ntried to stop Mario from rescuing her.
tip_title_0094	Pikachu's Origins
tip_text_0094	Pikachu debuted in Pokémon Red and Pokémon Blue for Game Boy.\r\nConsider yourself a very lucky Trainer if you catch one in Viridian\r\nForest.
tip_title_0095	Ness's Origins
tip_text_0095	Ness first appeared in the SNES title EarthBound, released in North\r\nAmerica in 1995. He might look like your average kid, but he can\r\nuse a variety of PSI powers. He's also got a younger sister.
tip_title_0096	Zelda's Origins
tip_text_0096	Zelda first appeared in the NES title The Legend of Zelda, released in\r\nNorth America in 1987. In that title, the evil Ganon kidnaps Zelda and\r\nsteals the Triforce of Power.
tip_title_0097	Sheik's Origins
tip_text_0097	Sheik first appeared in the 1998 N64 title The Legend of Zelda:\r\nOcarina of Time. Her true identity is Ze— I won't spoil it for you.\r\n

tip_text_0098	Ganon appears as the final boss in The Legend of Zelda. In that title,\r\nhe looks more beast than human, making him a sharp contrast\r\nto Ganondorf.

tip_text_0099	Zero Suit Samus's seventh color variation is a unique orange outfit.\r\nThis outfit first appeared in certain endings of Metroid: Zero Mission.\r\n

tip_text_0100	Lucario first appeared in Pokémon Diamond and Pearl. Lucario has\r\nthe power to detect its opponent's thoughts and actions by reading\r\ntheir Aura.

tip_text_0102	Charizard made its debut in North America in the 1998 games\r\nPokémon Red and Pokémon Blue. It was even featured on the\r\ncover of Pokémon Red.

tip_title_0104	Jigglypuff's Origins
tip_text_0104	Jigglypuff has been singing its opponents to sleep in North America\r\nsince its debut in the 1998 Game Boy games Pokémon Red and\r\nPokémon Blue.
tip_title_0105	Lucina's Origins
tip_text_0105	Lucina made her debut with the 2013 release of Fire Emblem\r\nAwakening. At first, she went by Marth, but she later revealed\r\nher true identity.
tip_title_0106	Dark Pit's Origins
tip_text_0106	Dark Pit debuted in Kid Icarus: Uprising, released in 2012. Created\r\nby the Mirror of Truth, he has the same abilities as Pit but a different\r\npersonality.

tip_text_0107	Even though Punch-Out!! was released in 1984, Little Mac didn't\r\nreceive his name until the 1987 NES release.\r\n

tip_title_0414	{[0107|00000100]}Toon Link: \x0f\x01\x07Midair Hookshot (Grab Attack)
tip_text_0414	Using the grab button will fire the Hookshot even in midair, but you\r\ncan't grab opponents with it. You can, however, use it to attack or\r\ngrab edges.
tip_title_0415	{[0107|00000100]}Dr. Mario: \x0f\x01\x07Dr. Tornado (Down Special)
tip_text_0415	Press the button repeatedly midattack to rise into the air.\r\nHowever, after it ends you are vulnerable, so be careful\r\nusing it to recover.
tip_title_0416	{[0107|00000100]}Kirby: \x0f\x01\x07Lucario Copy Ability
tip_text_0416	Kirby gains the ability to use Aura Sphere from Lucario. No matter\r\nhow high his damage gets, though, the attack won't get any stronger.\r\n
tip_title_0417	{[0107|00000100]}Kirby: \x0f\x01\x07Rosalina & Luma Copy Ability
tip_text_0417	Kirby gets a Luma of his very own after inhaling Rosalina! It doesn't\r\nstay long enough to team up with him, though—it flies forward and\r\nthen vanishes.
tip_title_0418	{[0107|00000100]}Fox: \x0f\x01\x07Reflector in the Air (Down Special)
tip_text_0418	Using Reflector in midair slows down Fox's fall back to the ground.\r\nUsing this when an enemy is about to attack from below can throw\r\noff their timing.
tip_title_0419	{[0107|00000100]}Fox: \x0f\x01\x07Tornado Kick (Forward Air Attack)
tip_text_0419	Time your attack so that you land before hitting your opponent for\r\na fifth time. They'll bounce off the ground, and you can make\r\nfollow-up attacks.
tip_title_0420	{[0107|00000100]}Pikachu: \x0f\x01\x07Quick Attack (Up Special)
tip_text_0420	Pikachu is vulnerable before landing after using Quick Attack in midair.\r\nHowever, if you direct the attack at the ground, the recovery time\r\nshortens a little.
tip_title_0421	{[0107|00000100]}Pikachu: \x0f\x01\x07Electric Discharge with Thunder (Down Special)
tip_text_0421	Hit yourself with Thunder to cause a discharge that damages nearby\r\nfoes. Using Thunder quickly after falling will pass through terrain, so it\r\ncan be used below platforms in this way, too!
tip_title_0422	{[0107|00000100]}Pikachu: \x0f\x01\x07Skull Bash (Side Special)
tip_text_0422	Execute this move like a smash attack, and it'll start off slightly\r\ncharged already. This way, fully charging it doesn't take as long.\r\n
tip_title_0423	{[0107|00000100]}Pikachu: \x0f\x01\x07Headbutt (Neutral Attack)
tip_text_0423	Press and hold the button to attack repeatedly. Be careful, though,\r\nbecause Pikachu shifts slightly as it attacks. You'll eventually end\r\nup out of attack range!
tip_title_0424	{[0107|00000100]}Luigi: \x0f\x01\x07Fireball (Neutral Special)
tip_text_0424	Luigi's green fireballs don't travel as far as his brother's, but they're\r\nslightly more powerful and they can bounce off of walls.\r\n
tip_title_0426	{[0107|00000100]}Luigi: \x0f\x01\x07Super Jump Punch (Up Special)
tip_text_0426	Get close to your enemy before using this. Hit them right at the start\r\nof the uppercut for maximum damage and launching power.\r\n
tip_title_0427	{[0107|00000100]}Luigi: \x0f\x01\x07Landing Luigi Cyclone (Down Special)
tip_text_0427	If you land during Luigi Cyclone after using it in midair, you can slide\r\nleft or right. This is a great way to suddenly avoid an opponent's\r\nfollow-up attacks.
tip_title_0428	{[0107|00000100]}Luigi: \x0f\x01\x07Luigi Kick (Neutral Air Attack)
tip_text_0428	This attack launches opponents almost straight upward. Since you\r\nknow which way they're going, it's easy to move in and attack again.\r\n
tip_title_0430	{[0107|00000100]}Luigi: \x0f\x01\x07Lead Headbutt (Up Smash Attack)
tip_text_0430	Hit an enemy in front to launch them backward. Hit an enemy behind\r\nyou to launch them forward. The green guy's kooky like that!\r\n
tip_title_0431	{[0107|00000100]}Captain Falcon: \x0f\x01\x07Falcon Dive's Direction (Up Special)
tip_text_0431	Press left or right the moment Captain Falcon crouches to adjust the\r\nangle of the attack. By holding forward, you can greatly increase the\r\nrange at which you can grab enemies.
tip_title_0432	{[0107|00000100]}Captain Falcon: \x0f\x01\x07Falcon Kick (Down Special)
tip_text_0432	The attack is at its most powerful right after pressing the button and\r\nloses power as it goes. However, it loses less power when it is used\r\nin the air.
tip_title_0433	{[0107|00000100]}Captain Falcon: \x0f\x01\x07Raptor Boost (Side Special)
tip_text_0433	Used in midair, his hand has a meteor effect on the downswing.\r\nThe trick is to hit the foe when they're below Captain Falcon.\r\n
tip_title_0434	{[0107|00000100]}Captain Falcon: \x0f\x01\x07Wheel Kick (Up Tilt Attack)
tip_text_0434	If Falcon's heel hits an airborne enemy during this attack, it will dunk\r\nthem. Try standing on the edge of the stage and using it on an\r\nopponent trying to grab the edge.
tip_title_0435	{[0107|00000100]}Captain Falcon: \x0f\x01\x07Blue Falcon Animation (Final Smash)
tip_text_0435	Depending on if he used it in the air or on the ground, Falcon's pose\r\nafter striking will change. Of course, he won't be happy if he didn't\r\nhit anyone...

tip_text_0436	The power and radius of the charge grow as you hold down the\r\nbutton. You can also move it by tilting the stick left and right.\r\n

tip_text_0437	Since you can move the attack yourself, you can stop enemies\r\nfrom recovering by moving it near an edge and waiting for them\r\nto climb up.

tip_text_0438	The lightning won't disappear if an enemy hits its tail. It's also\r\ninvulnerable for a very brief moment after Ness initially fires it.\r\n

tip_text_0439	Enemies with a higher damage percentage are much easier to\r\nlaunch with this. You can knock them out completely if they're\r\ndamaged enough!

tip_text_0440	When an enemy is trying to get back on the stage, you can ruin their\r\nday with your side or down air attack. But try not to self-destruct!\r\n

tip_text_0441	Peach can't grab the ledge if she's facing away from it and her parasol\r\nis open. Tap down to close it, though, and she'll grab on safely.\r\n

tip_text_0442	Of the eight types, the wrinkle-faced vegetable is the strongest.\r\nIf you throw it while tapping a direction, it can do over 30% damage!\r\n

tip_text_0443	Rarely, Peach will pull up a Bob-omb or Mr. Saturn. How rarely?\r\nWell, you have a 1/250 chance of a Bob-omb and a 1/166 chance\r\nof a Mr. Saturn!

tip_text_0449	Bowser's target has a bit of control over their direction in the air,\r\ntoo. The lower their damage, the more influence they have (but still\r\nnot much).

tip_title_0512	{[0107|00000100]}Lucario: \x0f\x01\x07Aura
tip_text_0512	Lucario's Aura power increases as it takes damage. At 190%,\r\nLucario's attacks are 2.5 times normal strength, but it's possible\r\nto grow even stronger...
tip_title_0513	{[0107|00000100]}R.O.B.: \x0f\x01\x07Color Variations
tip_text_0513	R.O.B.'s red-and-white second color is based on the Japan version\r\nof R.O.B. In fact, it's even his default color when the language is\r\nset to Japanese!
tip_title_0514	{[0107|00000100]}R.O.B.: \x0f\x01\x07Pointblank Robo Beam (Neutral Special)
tip_text_0514	You can't fire a beam if you don't have any energy charged, but the\r\nsparks will still harm enemies right in front of you!\r\n
tip_title_0515	{[0107|00000100]}R.O.B.: \x0f\x01\x07Charging Robo Beam (Neutral Special)
tip_text_0515	The beam will constantly charge while it's not in use, reaching three\r\nlevels of power. R.O.B. starts each battle at the second charge level.\r\n
tip_title_0516	{[0107|00000100]}R.O.B.: \x0f\x01\x07Robo Beam Path Changes (Neutral Special)
tip_text_0516	If the beam is fired at a low angle toward the terrain, it'll bounce\r\nonce. If fired at a more extreme angle, the beam will disappear.\r\n
tip_title_0517	{[0107|00000100]}R.O.B.: \x0f\x01\x07Robo Burner Care (Up Special)
tip_text_0517	The Robo Burner won't recharge while R.O.B. is hanging from an\r\nedge. You'll need to spend some time on the ground to make sure\r\nyou're fueled!
tip_title_0518	{[0107|00000100]}R.O.B.: \x0f\x01\x07Canceling Robo Burner (Up Special)
tip_text_0518	Even if you stop midflight or attack, you can still use Robo Burner as\r\nlong as it has fuel. Good for chasing foes off the edge to finish them!\r\n
tip_title_0519	{[0107|00000100]}Toon Link: \x0f\x01\x07Sword Plant (Down Air Attack)
tip_text_0519	Unlike Link's and Young Link's down air attack, Toon Link's doesn't\r\nbounce up when it hits a foe. If you try to dunk someone with it,\r\nyou're gonna have a bad time.
tip_title_0520	{[0107|00000100]}Toon Link: \x0f\x01\x07Hero's Shield
tip_text_0520	Toon Link's shield blocks lower down than Link's and Young Link's\r\nand can better cover his smaller body. However, he can't guard\r\nwhile moving faster than a walk.
tip_title_0521	Charizard: Midair Jump
tip_text_0521	Charizard can perform two successive midair jumps. The second one\r\ndoesn't get as much height as the first, though.\r\n
tip_title_0523	{[0107|00000100]}Sonic: \x0f\x01\x07Spring Jump Care (Up Special)
tip_text_0523	Even after a Spring Jump, Sonic can still attack and dodge in\r\nthe air. However, he can't perform a midair jump or use any\r\nmore special moves.
tip_title_0524	{[0107|00000100]}Sonic: \x0f\x01\x07Spin Charge Care (Down Special)
tip_text_0524	Jump while charging a Spin Charge to do a Spin Jump. After a midair\r\njump, you won't be able to Spin Jump until you hit the ground.\r\n
tip_title_0527	{[0107|00000100]}Sonic: \x0f\x01\x07Shooting Star Kick (Down Air Attack)
tip_text_0527	If you jump, Spring Jump, and then use an attack like this one in\r\nquick succession, it will end right before you land, which means\r\nno landing delay!
tip_title_0528	{[0107|00000100]}Jigglypuff: \x0f\x01\x07Rollout's Vulnerability (Neutral Special)
tip_text_0528	When you hit a foe with this, you'll bounce up and then only be able\r\nto move sideways until you land. Try to avoid hitting foes with it if\r\nyou're trying to recover!
tip_title_0529	{[0107|00000100]}Jigglypuff: \x0f\x01\x07Turning with Rollout (Neutral Special)
tip_text_0529	While rolling on the ground, press in the opposite direction to make a\r\nquick turn. It won't work if you're airborne, but it'll slow you down.\r\n
tip_title_0530	{[0107|00000100]}Jigglypuff: \x0f\x01\x07Using Pound (Side Special)
tip_text_0530	This move can lay waste to opponents' shields. You can adjust\r\nthe direction slightly by inputting up or down in the air right before\r\nattacking.
tip_title_0531	{[0107|00000100]}Jigglypuff: \x0f\x01\x07Jiggly Split (Down Smash Attack)
tip_text_0531	This move attacks in front of you and behind you at the same time,\r\nand your legs are invincible as they kick. It launches foes horizontally.\r\n
tip_title_0532	{[0107|00000100]}Dr. Mario: \x0f\x01\x07Capsules (Neutral Special)
tip_text_0532	The capsules bounce higher than Mario's fireballs. Also, since they're\r\nphysical projectiles, energy-absorbing specials won't work on them.\r\n
tip_title_0533	{[0107|00000100]}Dr. Mario: \x0f\x01\x07Capsule Types (Neutral Special)
tip_text_0533	The capsules Dr. Mario throws are selected at random from nine\r\ndifferent combinations of red, blue, and yellow. The difference is\r\nonly cosmetic.
tip_title_0534	{[0107|00000100]}Dr. Mario: \x0f\x01\x07Dr. Punch (Forward Air Attack)
tip_text_0534	Unlike Mario's similar move, this will never have a meteor effect\r\nregardless of your timing, but it is strongest when his fist is directly\r\nin front of him.
tip_title_0535	{[0107|00000100]}Dr. Mario: \x0f\x01\x07Hospital Bed (Downward Throw)
tip_text_0535	Unlike Mario's downward throw, Dr. Mario's always sends the\r\nfoe bouncing upward, so you can follow it up more easily with\r\nan air attack.
tip_title_0536	{[0107|00000100]}Lucina: \x0f\x01\x07Vs. Marth
tip_text_0536	Marth's sword deals more damage at the tip, but Lucina's is the\r\nsame all the way along. That aside, their moves are fundamentally\r\npretty similar.
tip_title_0537	{[0107|00000100]}Lucina: \x0f\x01\x07Critical Hit (Final Smash)
tip_text_0537	Lucina dashes forward and launches any foes in her path. It goes quite\r\nfar if nothing gets in its way, so swing your sword before you go\r\noff-screen!

tip_text_0538	Compared to those from Pit's Palutena Bow, these arrows disappear\r\nmore quickly and can't be steered as much. But they deal more\r\ndamage in return.
tip_title_0539	{[0107|00000100]}Dark Pit: \x0f\x01\x07Dark Pit Staff (Final Smash)
tip_text_0539	This Final Smash shoots in a straight line, going through foes and\r\nterrain. If it hits more than one opponent, the closer foes will take\r\nmore damage.

tip_text_0540	Luma keeps going for a bit after it hits a foe, but it slows down and\r\ndeals less damage.\r\n

tip_text_0541	If you input backward just before Rosalina takes off, she'll fly straight\r\nup. Useful when you need as much height as possible.\r\n

tip_text_0542	This move pulls in projectiles from a wide area around Rosalina.\r\nUse it to pull Ness's PK Thunder off course when he's trying to recover!\r\n

tip_text_0546	When Luma is next to Rosalina, it starts dancing if she grabs an\r\nopponent. When she gets hurt, you can see it flailing its little arms\r\nin panic!

tip_text_0547	When it's on the way back after Luma Shot, Luma can attack as\r\nnormal. Use this to surprise fighters heading for Rosalina or as\r\na diversion.

tip_text_0548	Lumas come in various colors, but their abilities are identical.\r\nThe six colors you can get are yellow, red, green, blue, cream,\r\nand Polari.

tip_text_0550	Press the button repeatedly to float up higher, making recovery\r\neasier. If foes are trying to stop you getting back to the stage, just\r\nfly out of reach!

tip_text_0566	Robin's flurry attack uses the same tome as Elwind. If you use it up\r\nwith the flurry attack, you won't be able to use Elwind for recovery!\r\n

tip_text_0573	The gunmen's firepower, from best to worst: the sombrero guy, the\r\ncool leader, the guy in a suit, and then a tie between the lanky and\r\nbeardy ones.

tip_text_0574	The lanky gunman has a longer range than any of the others, and the\r\none in the sombrero has the shortest range. The others are pretty\r\nmuch equal.

tip_text_0575	The gunmen from fastest to slowest: the cool leader (earning\r\nthat title!), the one in a suit, the one in a sombrero, the beardy\r\none, and then the lanky one.

tip_text_0625	The higher the target's damage, the longer they'll be stunned for.\r\nHowever, if the move is reflected, Mewtwo will be stunned instead.\r\n

tip_text_0626	This powerful move requires eye contact to work. If the enemy is\r\nlooking, it can stun them, but if not... Well, it's not much of a staring\r\ncontest.

tip_text_0628	Mewtwo will disappear for a moment, reappearing elsewhere on the\r\nstage. Mewtwo is completely invulnerable while teleporting.\r\n

tip_text_0630	Mewtwo will throw an enemy and quickly fire Shadow Ball five times.\r\nEach projectile doesn't do much damage, but it can hit multiple foes.\r\n

tip_text_0631	The shock wave does more damage at the very edges than at the\r\ncore. Watch what you're doing, and try to attack with the edge of\r\nthe wave.

tip_text_0720	Propel yourself forward with a flap of the wings. You can deal some\r\ndamage and get yourself out of tight spots.\r\n

tip_text_0721	Hits in a wide radius, sending multiple foes skyward when Corrin\r\nstomps the ground, lining them up for a nice follow-up attack.\r\n
tip_title_0722	{[0107|00000100]}Corrin: \x0f\x01\x07Dragon Lunge Tips (Side Special)
tip_text_0722	After launching this move from the ground, quickly press the attack\r\nbutton to instantly skewer the ground.\r\n
tip_title_0723	{[0107|00000100]}Bayonetta: \x0f\x01\x07Rapid Fire with Bullet Climax (Neutral Special)
tip_text_0723	Bayonetta alternates which guns she fires each time you use this\r\nmove. Keep hitting the button while she's firing to let off more shots.\r\n
tip_title_0724	{[0107|00000100]}Bayonetta: \x0f\x01\x07Bullet Climax's Charge (Neutral Special)
tip_text_0724	Hold down the button to unleash more powerful Charge Bullets.\r\nOnly the first four shots are boosted; the follow-up shots won't\r\nbe affected.
tip_title_0725	{[0107|00000100]}Bayonetta: \x0f\x01\x07Heel Slide (Side Special)
tip_text_0725	Performs a low, sliding kick. Hold down the button to get in a few\r\ngunshots, and then end with a flip attack for good measure.\r\n
tip_title_0726	{[0107|00000100]}Bayonetta: \x0f\x01\x07Witch Twist's Traits (Up Special)
tip_text_0726	This versatile move is great for combos or recovery! Do a midair jump\r\nafter using the move and you can get in a sneaky extra Witch Twist.\r\n
tip_title_0727	{[0107|00000100]}Bayonetta: \x0f\x01\x07Witch Twist's Angle (Up Special)
tip_text_0727	The angle foes are launched at changes between the first and\r\nsecond Witch Twists. Adjust your tactics to the situation to get\r\nthe best combos.
tip_title_0728	{[0107|00000100]}Bayonetta: \x0f\x01\x07Witch Time's Effect (Down Special)
tip_text_0728	A successful counter will cause time to slow down. The more damage\r\nthe opponent has, the longer time will slow down for.\r\n
tip_title_0729	{[0107|00000100]}Bayonetta: \x0f\x01\x07Witch Time Confirmation (Down Special)
tip_text_0729	A clock will appear over an enemy to tell you how much Witch Time\r\nis left. Try to get your attacks in before the clock counts down!\r\n
tip_title_0730	{[0107|00000100]}Bayonetta: \x0f\x01\x07Witch Time's Traits (Down Special)
tip_text_0730	Witch Time won't last long if you keep using it against every single\r\nattack. Keep it in reserve for when you really need it!\r\n
tip_title_0731	{[0107|00000100]}Bayonetta: \x0f\x01\x07Hold Attack to Keep Firing
tip_text_0731	Keep the button held down after any normal attack (and some\r\nspecials) to fire your guns.\r\n
tip_title_0732	{[0107|00000100]}Bayonetta: \x0f\x01\x07Hold Attack to Steal KO
tip_text_0732	Even if an attack misses, you can still hold the button and get a few\r\nshots in. You can even steal a KO by hitting a launched foe on their\r\nway out! Cheeky.
tip_title_0733	{[0107|00000100]}Bayonetta: \x0f\x01\x07Bat Within
tip_text_0733	If Bayonetta is hit during the dodge or during her down special, she'll\r\nchange into a burst of bats, taking half the damage.\r\n
tip_title_0734	{[0107|00000100]}Bayonetta: \x0f\x01\x07Launching with Consecutive Kicks (Side Tilt Attack)
tip_text_0734	Keep pressing the button and Bayonetta will do a three-kick attack.\r\nThe last kick launches foes, so go for a quick midair attack right after!\r\n
tip_title_0735	{[0107|00000100]}Bayonetta: \x0f\x01\x07Kick Attack and Gun Fire (Down Tilt Attack)
tip_text_0735	Bayonetta quickly sweeps enemies off their feet and will shoot ahead\r\nand behind if you hold the button. The guns firing ahead deal\r\nmore damage.
tip_title_0736	{[0107|00000100]}Bayonetta: \x0f\x01\x07Stomp to Meteor (Down Smash Attack)
tip_text_0736	Summon the crushing foot of a demon to slam down with a meteor\r\neffect, particularly effective in preventing foes from recovering from\r\nfalls or climbing up edges.
tip_title_0737	{[0107|00000100]}Bayonetta: \x0f\x01\x07Consecutive Midair Attacks (Forward Air Attack)
tip_text_0737	Keep pressing the button for three shots in the air. Perfect for foes\r\ntrying to recover. Or hold the button to pile on the pressure with a\r\nhail of bullets!
tip_title_0738	{[0107|00000100]}Bayonetta: \x0f\x01\x07Rapidly Descending Meteor (Down Air Attack)
tip_text_0738	Bayonetta drops straight down into a split kick. She'll constantly deal\r\ndamage as she drops, and her foot has a meteor effect.\r\n

tip_text_0739	If Nabbit catches you, he'll put you in his sack. Wriggle about to\r\nescape before he carries you off the screen!\r\n

tip_text_0740	Kamek's magic totally transforms the stage. This can result in\r\nplatforms sinking beneath your feet, so be careful you don't fall!\r\n

tip_text_0741	If one of the giant icicles hits you when it falls, you'll be frozen.\r\nIf you notice any drops of water falling from above, get out from\r\nunder them fast!

tip_text_0742	The Yellow Devil explodes when defeated, which counts as your\r\nattack if you defeated it. Use this to KO other fighters!\r\n

tip_text_0743	A spray of water from below is the sign that a pillar of water is about\r\nto erupt. If there's a Big Urchin on one, don't touch it or you'll get hurt!\r\n

tip_text_0744	When treasure chests appear on this stage, break them to get items!\r\nSome chests explode, though, so it might be safer to use projectiles.\r\n

tip_text_0745	The burning red Danger Zones are as dangerous as their name\r\nimplies. Touch them with more than 100% damage, and you'll be\r\ninstantly KO'd.

tip_text_0746	On this stage, mine carts will sometimes appear. They start moving\r\nwhen someone gets inside or on their own after a while. Try not to\r\nget run over!

tip_text_0747	Unlike in other stages, you can't float at all in the water here.\r\nYou'll fall through it like it's not even there, so be careful not to\r\nbelly flop to a KO!

tip_text_0827	Everyone is too busy fighting to steer the ship! The ship might run\r\naground as you battle, but you can just carry the fight to the rocks\r\nif this happens.

tip_text_0938	Blinky will always take the quickest route to a foe. Inky, meanwhile,\r\nprefers to move randomly in a direction opposite the foe.\r\n
tip_title_0939	{[0107|00000100]}Assist Trophy: \x0f\x01\x07Ghosts: Pinky & Clyde
tip_text_0939	Pinky will try to catch her targets by getting in front and ambushing\r\nthem. Clyde doesn't have a target—he just does whatever he likes.\r\n
tip_title_0940	{[0107|00000100]}Assist Trophy: \x0f\x01\x07Chain Chomp
tip_text_0940	A Chain Chomp's chomp will deal more damage than just touching\r\none. Be careful, though—even chained up, they've got a long range.\r\n
tip_title_0941	{[0107|00000100]}Pokémon: \x0f\x01\x07Eevee
tip_text_0941	Eevee will use Take Down on any fighters nearby. If there aren't any,\r\nit'll just stand around looking a bit confused.\r\n
tip_title_0942	{[0107|00000100]}Assist Trophy: \x0f\x01\x07Riki
tip_text_0942	This fluffy little Nopon has six Arts he might use, picked at random,\r\neach with a different effect. Sadly, he might end up helping your\r\nopponents...
tip_title_0943	Bombchu
tip_text_0943	Once it's rolling, the Bombchu won't stop for anything and can't be\r\npicked up! It'll eventually explode and can even hurt the player who\r\nused it first!
tip_title_0944	Rocket Belt's Departure
tip_text_0944	After you've worn the Rocket Belt for a set time, it'll fly off on its own.\r\nIf it hits an opponent on its way up, it'll explode and damage them!\r\n
tip_title_0945	Ore Club
tip_text_0945	Use a side smash with the Ore Club to send a big whirlwind flying at\r\nyour foes. Charge it up to make the whirlwind even bigger!\r\n
tip_title_0946	{[0107|00000100]}Pokémon: \x0f\x01\x07Latias & Latios
tip_text_0946	Latias and Latios fly across the screen from the left and right,\r\ndamaging anyone they hit and leaving gusts of wind in their\r\nwake as well.
tip_title_0947	Spiny Shell
tip_text_0947	When you throw this shell, it will hover above an opponent's head\r\nbefore descending upon them and exploding. It targets whoever's\r\nin first.
tip_title_0948	Bullet Bill
tip_text_0948	This item lets you transform into a Bullet Bill and charge across\r\nthe screen. You can control the direction, but be careful not to\r\nself-destruct!
tip_title_0949	Cucco
tip_text_0949	Don't attack the poor Cucco! No really, don't do that, or it'll call its\r\nwhole flock. If that happens, try to get other fighters mixed up in\r\nthe mayhem.
tip_title_0950	Cucco: Toss to Attack
tip_text_0950	If you hit another fighter with a Cucco, it'll get angry at them instead\r\nof you! The flock won't hurt you at all! Maybe being thrown doesn't\r\nruffle feathers?
tip_title_0951	Cucco: Indiscriminate Attack
tip_text_0951	If a Cucco is damaged by a stage hazard, it's not sure who to get\r\nangry with...so it calls the flock on EVERYONE. Not fair! Not fair!\r\n
tip_title_0952	Killer Eye
tip_text_0952	Throw a Killer Eye at a wall or ceiling, and it'll stick there. It might\r\nnot be the most effective attack strategy, but it could catch foes\r\nby surprise!
tip_title_0953	Grass
tip_text_0953	If you see some grass growing out of the stage, walk over and\r\npluck it to get a random item. You can only pluck it while you're\r\non the ground.
tip_title_0954	Super Leaf
tip_text_0954	While you're all tailed up, hold the jump button to float in the air.\r\nThis can be useful for heavy fighters or those that aren't great\r\nat recovering.
tip_title_0955	Special Flag
tip_text_0955	Hold this up for a while to get +1 KO (in a time battle) or +1 stock\r\n(in a stock battle). Or use it as bait to lure your foes in for a beating!\r\n
tip_title_0956	Steel Diver
tip_text_0956	This submarine-shaped weapon fires small torpedoes that start slow\r\nand then speed up and zoom off. They explode when they hit a foe.\r\n
tip_title_0957	POW Block
tip_text_0957	Hitting the POW Block will shake the whole screen, injuring any foes\r\ncurrently on the ground. It can be used three times before vanishing.\r\n
tip_title_0958	{[0107|00000100]}Assist Trophy: \x0f\x01\x07Jeff
tip_text_0958	Jeff's bottle rockets explode when they hit obstacles, so hiding in\r\na place with walls or ceilings will help to protect you from them.\r\n
tip_title_0959	Beehive
tip_text_0959	Throw this item at an enemy, and the bees will swarm around them,\r\ndealing damage over time. Bees laugh at shields and attack right\r\nthrough them. Jerks.
tip_title_0960	Rolling Crate
tip_text_0960	A crate with wheels. When attacked, it rolls off and deals big\r\ndamage to whomever it hits. Attack it while standing on top,\r\nand you can even ride it!
tip_title_0961	Gust Bellows
tip_text_0961	This item blows a powerful gust of wind. It aims straight out in front\r\nof you if you're holding on to it, but when thrown, it blows wildly in\r\nall directions!
tip_title_0962	X Bomb
tip_text_0962	As the name implies, this bomb's explosion takes the form of an X.\r\nKeep an eye on the bomb before it explodes to see which way it's\r\npointing!
tip_title_0963	Rocket Belt
tip_text_0963	Hold the jump button while wearing this item, and it will send you\r\nsoaring skyward. This makes recovering easy for even the least\r\nagile of fighters.
tip_title_0964	Killer Eye's Attack
tip_text_0964	Once activated, this eye repeatedly fires shots, speeding up if it sees\r\na foe. Attack it to make it change direction, though it might fall over\r\ninstead.
tip_title_0965	Aim for the Fences
tip_text_0965	When hitting an opponent with a bat, the tip will launch them the\r\nfarthest. This is true of both the Home-Run Bat item and Ness's\r\nside smash.
tip_title_0969	amiibo: New Experiences
tip_text_0969	The first time an FP battles with a fighter or FP, it gains more\r\nexperience than usual. It'll also learn more if it is used on a\r\nfriend's Nintendo Switch.
tip_title_0972	Breaking Your Fall
tip_text_0972	When you hit the wall, floor, or ceiling after being launched, press the\r\nshield button to break your fall and avoid follow-up attacks.\r\n
tip_title_0973	Grabbing Edges
tip_text_0973	If you grab an edge that someone else is grabbing, you'll steal\r\nit from him or her. So much for first come, first served!\r\n
tip_title_0974	Footstool Jump
tip_text_0974	You can jump on opponents' heads and use them as a springboard.\r\nIf they're airborne, they'll fall down too.\r\n
tip_title_0975	Clinging to Walls
tip_text_0975	Some fighters can temporarily stick to walls if you keep holding in the\r\ndirection of the wall. Not every wall is good for this move, though...\r\n
tip_title_0976	Crouch Walking
tip_text_0976	Some fighters can move while crouched if you input diagonally down\r\nto the left or right.\r\n
tip_title_0977	Hitstun Shuffling
tip_text_0977	If you input a direction while taking damage, you'll shift slightly\r\nin that direction.\r\n
tip_title_0978	Shield Break
tip_text_0978	While your shield is up, it'll gradually get smaller. When it finally\r\nbreaks, you'll become dizzy.\r\n
tip_title_0979	Super Armor
tip_text_0979	This is a state where you won't flinch even while taking damage.\r\nSome specials will trigger this.\r\n
tip_title_0980	Turning and Grabbing
tip_text_0980	If you turn around while running and then grab, your grabbing range\r\nwill be longer than usual.\r\n
tip_title_0981	Eating while Prone
tip_text_0981	Press the attack button while you're prone to eat a food item that's\r\nfallen nearby.\r\n
tip_title_0982	Wall Jumping
tip_text_0982	Some fighters can jump off walls. Input in the opposite direction\r\nwhile touching the wall to do this.\r\n
tip_title_0983	Short Hop
tip_text_0983	If you press the jump button very briefly, you'll jump lower than\r\nusual, which lets you use air attacks against ground-level foes.\r\n
tip_title_0984	Shifting Your Shield
tip_text_0984	You can gently input a direction while shielding to move your shield.\r\nThis lets you block effectively, even with a small shield.\r\n
tip_title_0985	Meteor Smash
tip_text_0985	Launching an opponent straight downward is known as a meteor\r\nsmash. Doing this when there isn't a platform below is a good\r\none-hit KO method.
tip_title_0986	Perfect Shield
tip_text_0986	Releasing your shield right when your opponent strikes results in\r\na perfect shield. This doesn't damage your shield, and the small\r\nopening makes it easy to attack!
tip_title_0987	Catching Items
tip_text_0987	You can catch items thrown at you by pressing the attack button at\r\njust the right time.\r\n
tip_title_0988	Smash Throw
tip_text_0988	When you throw an item, quickly flick the stick in the same direction\r\nas your throw. You'll throw it farther than usual that way.\r\n
tip_title_0989	Letting Go of Items
tip_text_0989	Press the grab button to drop the item you're holding. Even an\r\nitem dropped like this deals a small amount of damage.\r\n
tip_title_0990	Stale Moves
tip_text_0990	Using the same attack constantly will decrease its power. Add a\r\nlittle variety to your fighting to spice up your game!\r\n
tip_title_0991	Magnifying-Glass Damage
tip_text_0991	When you move off-screen, you'll be shown in a little circle. You'll\r\ngradually take damage while off the screen, so don't linger!\r\n
tip_title_0992	Throwing Items
tip_text_0992	Drop items by pressing the grab button. Input a direction when\r\nyou drop an item to throw the item in that direction.\r\n
tip_title_0994	Easy Final Smash
tip_text_0994	Fighters who are really lagging behind will sometimes be ready to\r\nuse a Final Smash as soon as they return from being KO'd.\r\n
tip_title_0995	Grab
tip_text_0995	You have to wait a short time between letting go of opponents\r\nand grabbing them again, so be patient!\r\n
tip_title_0996	Shieldstun Shuffling
tip_text_0996	Tilting the stick in a direction while blocking an attack with your\r\nshield will cause you to move a very short distance in that direction.\r\n
tip_title_0997	Grab an Item while Airborne
tip_text_0997	You can grab an item in midair by dodging or attacking at just the\r\nright time.\r\n
tip_title_0998	Charge Canceling
tip_text_0998	You can cancel some special moves by pressing the shield button\r\nas you charge. Using the move again will start you where you left off!\r\n
tip_title_0999	Launch-Trail Colors
tip_text_0999	When someone launches you strongly, the trail that follows you is\r\ncolor-coded: red if P1 did it, blue if it was P2, yellow for P3,\r\nor green for P4.
tip_title_1000	Launch-Trail Colors (Team Battle)
tip_text_1000	In team battles, the trail that follows you when you're launched hard\r\nmatches the color of the team that the player who launched you\r\nbelongs to.
tip_title_1001	When Two Attacks Meet
tip_text_1001	Two attacks can cancel each other out if they connect at the same\r\nmoment. With the right timing, you can even punch projectiles right\r\nout of the air!
tip_title_1002	When Two Attacks Don't Meet
tip_text_1002	If two attacks connect at the same time and one is significantly\r\nstronger, that move will prevail. Some moves, like air attacks,\r\nare never canceled.
tip_title_1003	Edge-Grabbing Invincibility
tip_text_1003	When you grab an edge, your fighter flashes and becomes briefly\r\ninvincible. This won't happen if you grab an edge again before\r\ntouching the ground.
tip_title_1004	Deadly Blow
tip_text_1004	A red and black flash of lightning when an attack lands means\r\nthat the victim has been hit with enough force to launch them\r\noff the screen.
tip_title_1005	Helpless Falling
tip_text_1005	After using certain specials in the air, you won't be able to attack or\r\ndodge until you hit the ground. You can still adjust the direction for\r\nyour fall, though.
tip_title_1006	Repeated Edge Grabbing
tip_text_1006	Certain moves, such as Ike's Aether, have limits on how many times\r\nthey can be used to grab on to edges without touching the ground.\r\n
tip_title_1007	The Three Highest Jumpers
tip_text_1007	#1 is Falco, #2 is Greninja, and #3 is Zero Suit Samus. The difference\r\nwas very slight, but it was enough to place Luigi as #4.\r\n
tip_title_1008	The Three Heaviest Fighters
tip_text_1008	#1 is Bowser, #2 is King K. Rool, and #3 is Donkey Kong and King\r\nDedede. The heavier a fighter, the stronger their attacks and the\r\nharder they are to launch.
tip_title_1009	The Three Lightest Fighters
tip_text_1009	#1 is Pichu, #2 is Jigglypuff, and #3 is Mr. Game & Watch and Squirtle.\r\nLight fighters are easy to launch but can easily escape from combos.\r\n
tip_title_1010	The Three Fastest Fighters
tip_text_1010	#1 is Sonic, #2 is Captain Falcon, and #3 is Little Mac. In contrast,\r\nthe slowest of all the fighters is Incineroar.\r\n
tip_title_1011	The Three Fastest Walkers
tip_text_1011	Marth and Lucina are tied for #1, with Fox at #3. Walking doesn't\r\nleave you as open as running; patience can be a virtue in battle!\r\n
tip_title_1012	The Three Slowest Walkers
tip_text_1012	#1 is Incineroar, #2 is Robin, and #3 is Jigglypuff. Incineroar may be\r\nslow, but has some serious launching power.\r\n
tip_title_1013	Landing after Air Dodging
tip_text_1013	If you land after performing an air dodge, you won't be able to move\r\nfor a moment. Dodging all the time can actually leave you more\r\nexposed!
tip_title_1014	Reflection Move Stamina
tip_text_1014	Reflection moves tend to break if an attack deals more than around\r\n50 damage. Shots get stronger if reflected, so reflecting back and\r\nforth is risky!
tip_title_1015	While Shielding
tip_text_1015	You can't walk or do normal attacks while shielding, but you can\r\njump out of it. Press an attack button just as you leave the\r\nground to attack in the air!
tip_title_1016	Team Colors
tip_text_1016	There are four possible team colors: red, blue, green, and yellow.\r\nIn 8-Player Smash, you can split into four teams of two for a\r\nserious scuffle!
tip_title_1017	{[0107|00000100]}Palutena's Temple: \x0f\x01\x07Smash Taunts
tip_text_1017	In the Palutena's Temple stage, you can trigger a special smash taunt\r\nif you use Pit's down taunt for a brief instant. It'll only work once per\r\nbattle.
tip_title_1018	Crouching's Defensive Value
tip_text_1018	Going into a crouch will help protect you from being launched as far.\r\nWalking while crouched, however, won't help at all—but it looks\r\npretty hilarious!
tip_title_1019	Reversing Side Specials
tip_text_1019	Input the opposite direction right after starting a side special to\r\nchange direction and do the move the other way. This works in\r\nmidair, too.
tip_title_1020	Changing Direction and Attacking
tip_text_1020	With most fighters, you can turn around while dashing and then\r\nquickly press a button to deliver a side tilt attack or a side smash.\r\n
tip_title_1021	Dangerous Shielding
tip_text_1021	If your shield breaks near an edge, a foe could casually push you\r\noff the stage while laughing. Be careful where you use your shield!\r\n
tip_title_1022	Directional Taunts
tip_text_1022	Some taunts are different depending on which way the fighter is\r\nfacing. Captain Falcon's down taunt and Rosalina & Luma's side\r\ntaunt are examples.
tip_title_1023	The Jump Masters
tip_text_1023	#1 is a tie between Jigglypuff, Meta Knight, and Kirby, who can all\r\nmanage six. #4 is King Dedede with five, and Pit and Dark Pit are\r\ntied at #5 with four.
tip_title_1024	{[0107|00000100]}Magicant: \x0f\x01\x07Flying Man
tip_text_1024	Flying Man will fight alongside the first person who touches him.\r\nGet to him before anyone else has a chance!\r\n
tip_title_1025	{[0107|00000100]}Magicant: \x0f\x01\x07Number of Flying Men
tip_text_1025	There are only five Flying Men. If all five are defeated, no more will\r\nappear in the battle.\r\n
tip_title_1026	Balloon Fight
tip_text_1026	This stage loops back on itself if you run to the left or right. However,\r\ngetting launched can still KO you.\r\n
tip_title_1027	{[0107|00000100]}Golden Plains: \x0f\x01\x07Gold Fighter
tip_text_1027	Collect 100 coins and you'll turn to gold! You'll deal more damage\r\nand can launch opponents more than usual!\r\n
tip_title_1028	Gerudo Valley
tip_text_1028	Sometimes the wooden bridge will break if you stand on it or attack\r\nit. It's a flimsy bridge and will break over time, too.\r\n
tip_title_1029	Jungle Japes
tip_text_1029	The river below the stage flows very quickly, so don't fall in! Try to\r\nknock foes into it instead!\r\n
tip_title_1030	{[0107|00000100]}Golden Plains: \x0f\x01\x07Red Ring
tip_text_1030	Touch the red ring to make eight red coins appear. One red coin is\r\nworth five regular coins!\r\n
tip_title_1031	{[0107|00000100]}Golden Plains: \x0f\x01\x07Scale Lifts
tip_text_1031	The Scale Lifts will tilt and fall if there is no one on the other side.\r\nGet two fighters on there to see who weighs more!\r\n
tip_title_1032	WarioWare, Inc.
tip_text_1032	When the microgame starts, follow the instructions to get items or\r\nother bonuses! You can become metal, giant, or other effects. It's\r\nreally useful!
tip_title_1033	{[0107|00000100]}Find Mii: \x0f\x01\x07Destructible Platforms
tip_text_1033	The Dark Emperor is capable of destroying the platforms in this\r\nstage. There are only two, so watch out!\r\n
tip_title_1034	{[0107|00000100]}Paper Mario: \x0f\x01\x07Land Stage
tip_text_1034	Watch out for the gigantic fan on the part of the stage that is on\r\nland. It's much easier to be launched to the right when it spins!\r\n
tip_title_1035	{[0107|00000100]}Paper Mario: \x0f\x01\x07Air Stage
tip_text_1035	Bowser's metal face will appear and spin in the sky. If his eyes turn\r\nred, it's a good time to run!\r\n
tip_title_1036	{[0107|00000100]}Living Room: \x0f\x01\x07Kinds of Puppies
tip_text_1036	Five different kinds of puppies appear in the background. The breed\r\nwill change randomly. Sometimes a kitten will appear instead!\r\n
tip_title_1037	{[0107|00000100]}Living Room: \x0f\x01\x07Falling Blocks
tip_text_1037	The falling blocks are really painful if they land on you. Avoid damage\r\nby watching the shadows and moving before the blocks land.\r\n
tip_title_1038	{[0107|00000100]}Spirit Train: \x0f\x01\x07Who's Driving?
tip_text_1038	If Link, Toon Link, or Young Link is busy in the battle, Alfonzo will\r\nhandle being the train's conductor.\r\n
tip_title_1039	{[0107|00000100]}Spirit Train: \x0f\x01\x07Cabooses
tip_text_1039	The Spirit Train can have several different cabooses. It could be\r\nLinebeck's shop, a coal car, a steel-frame car, or other cars!\r\n
tip_title_1040	{[0107|00000100]}Spirit Train: \x0f\x01\x07Dark Train
tip_text_1040	Keep an eye on the black smoke from the Dark Train! It will jump\r\nbefore exploding, landing in a random place on the stage.\r\n
tip_title_1041	{[0107|00000100]}Magicant: \x0f\x01\x07Falling Obstacles
tip_text_1041	A giant tomato or iron octopus will fall into the clouds, slowly\r\nsinking in until it falls out the other side.\r\n
tip_title_1042	{[0107|00000100]}Magicant: \x0f\x01\x07Falling Time of Obstacles
tip_text_1042	Standing on a giant tomato or an iron octopus will cause it to sink\r\nthrough the clouds faster.\r\n
tip_title_1043	Tomodachi Life
tip_text_1043	Normally, only rooms that fighters are currently in will be visible.\r\nThrowing an X Bomb into a room you can't see could work out\r\nin your favor.
tip_title_1044	Mute City SNES
tip_text_1044	This fight takes place on F-Zero machines in the middle of a race!\r\nFalling onto the course will hurt and send you flying through the air!\r\n
tip_title_1045	{[0107|00000100]}Unova Pokémon League: \x0f\x01\x07Stairs
tip_text_1045	Stairs will appear and connect to N's Castle. The stairs will make\r\nthe stage larger—change up your tactics with this new space!\r\n
tip_title_1046	{[0107|00000100]}Spirit Train: \x0f\x01\x07KO-Ready Armored Train
tip_text_1046	The Armored Train is pointy in front and will try to push the train you\r\nare on off the stage. Don't get pushed off during their conflict!\r\n
tip_title_1047	Spirit Train
tip_text_1047	This train travels left at extremely high speed. You'll need more luck\r\nthan any one fighter has if you want to survive falling off the back.\r\n
tip_title_1048	{[0107|00000100]}3D Land: \x0f\x01\x07Blocks
tip_text_1048	The Brick Blocks that appear in the beginning can be easily broken\r\nby hitting them once from below.\r\n
tip_title_1049	{[0107|00000100]}3D Land: \x0f\x01\x07? Blocks
tip_text_1049	? Blocks give you items! Super Leaves will appear slightly more\r\noften than usual.\r\n
tip_title_1050	{[0107|00000100]}3D Land: \x0f\x01\x07Protruding Rocks
tip_text_1050	The mountain range partway through the stage has rocks sticking\r\nout from it. The platform tilts and pushes fighters, so watch out!\r\n
tip_title_1051	{[0107|00000100]}3D Land: \x0f\x01\x07Shrinking and Growing Pipes
tip_text_1051	Pipes that shrink and grow will appear throughout the stage. Time\r\nyour jumps so you don't fall down!\r\n
tip_title_1052	{[0107|00000100]}3D Land: \x0f\x01\x07Lifts on Rails
tip_text_1052	During the ocean scene, the lift will travel along rails. Look ahead to\r\nspot where lifts are going next! Find the premium fighting spot!\r\n
tip_title_1053	{[0107|00000100]}3D Land: \x0f\x01\x07Spike Pillars
tip_text_1053	Spike Pillars will pop out of the ocean at random. They can break lifts\r\nand deal a lot of damage to unlucky fighters.\r\n
tip_title_1054	{[0107|00000100]}Tortimer Island: \x0f\x01\x07Sharks
tip_text_1054	The shallow waters around the island are home to some vicious\r\nsharks. They'll swim close and try to make a meal of an\r\nunsuspecting fighter.
tip_title_1055	{[0107|00000100]}Find Mii: \x0f\x01\x07Launch the Trapped Mii
tip_text_1055	The faster you can rescue the Mii trapped in the cage, the faster\r\nthe Dark Emperor will leave the battle.\r\n
tip_title_1056	{[0107|00000100]}Balloon Fight: \x0f\x01\x07Savage Fish
tip_text_1056	Beware the fish lurking beneath those pixelated waves—they'll\r\nsurface and try to get a mouthful of Smash Bros. fighter.\r\n
tip_title_1057	{[0107|00000100]}Paper Mario: \x0f\x01\x07Ocean Stage
tip_text_1057	A Big Blooper will appear on the ocean stage. Don't worry—it won't\r\nattack. It will rock the ship, though, generating some waves.\r\n
tip_title_1058	{[0107|00000100]}3D Land: \x0f\x01\x07Donut Blocks
tip_text_1058	As tasty as they may sound, the Donut Blocks are not for eating.\r\nYou can, however, jump on top of them for a bit before they collapse\r\nfrom your weight.
tip_title_1059	{[0107|00000100]}3D Land: \x0f\x01\x07Flip Panels
tip_text_1059	The Flip Panels at the beginning of this stage will flip, gradually\r\ncreating more places for you to stand.\r\n
tip_title_1060	{[0107|00000100]}3D Land: \x0f\x01\x07Note Blocks
tip_text_1060	Note Blocks appear at the beginning of the stage. Jumping on them\r\nwill send fighters flying into the sky!\r\n
tip_title_1061	{[0107|00000100]}3D Land: \x0f\x01\x07Rotating Platforms
tip_text_1061	This rotating platform may seem like a good place to fight, but it'll\r\ntoss anyone who's still on it when it rotates!\r\n
tip_title_1063	{[0107|00000100]}Tortimer Island: \x0f\x01\x07Setting Sail
tip_text_1063	Kapp'n's boat will sail out to sea after some time has passed.\r\nDisembark before he sails you off the stage!\r\n
tip_title_1064	{[0107|00000100]}Tortimer Island: \x0f\x01\x07Attack Fruit
tip_text_1064	Durians and coconuts have no healing power, but sometimes they\r\ncan explode when thrown.\r\n
tip_title_1065	Green Hill Zone
tip_text_1065	The object with the blue ball on top is called a Point Marker. A\r\nPoint Marker will twirl when the ball is hit, dealing damage to\r\nanyone too close.
tip_title_1066	{[0107|00000100]}Distant Planet: \x0f\x01\x07Beware the Red Bulborb
tip_text_1066	The Red Bulborb will appear on the right, opening its mouth and\r\nlooking for food. Being eaten by the Red Bulborb counts as a KO.\r\n
tip_title_1067	{[0107|00000100]}Distant Planet: \x0f\x01\x07Rain's Effect
tip_text_1067	The slanted hill on the left side of the stage will flood with water\r\nwhen it rains. The strong current can sweep you off the edge.\r\nWatch out!
tip_title_1068	{[0107|00000100]}Distant Planet: \x0f\x01\x07Flower Numbers
tip_text_1068	The objects labeled with numbers that blossom in the center of the\r\nflowers are called Pellets. Bigger numbers deal more damage when\r\nthrown.
tip_title_1069	{[0107|00000100]}Distant Planet: \x0f\x01\x07Pellets and Onions
tip_text_1069	Occasionally you might see Onions float down. Hit them with Pellets\r\nto get items!\r\n
tip_title_1070	PictoChat 2
tip_text_1070	The stage changes as the background changes. Adjust your tactics\r\ndepending on the drawing shown in the background.\r\n
tip_title_1071	Yoshi's Island
tip_text_1071	Fly Guys sometimes appear from the sky, carrying yummy food.\r\nAttack them to make them drop their tasty snacks!\r\n
tip_title_1072	{[0107|00000100]}Unova Pokémon League: \x0f\x01\x07Background Pokémon
tip_text_1072	Sometimes Milotic, Whimsicott, and Shaymin will appear. Don't\r\nworry—these three are only here to watch.\r\n
tip_title_1073	{[0107|00000100]}Unova Pokémon League: \x0f\x01\x07Legendary Pokémon
tip_text_1073	Reshiram and Zekrom will attack when they appear on this stage.\r\nYou might see some other Pokémon, too!\r\n
tip_title_1074	{[0107|00000100]}Unova Pokémon League: \x0f\x01\x07Stair-Breaking Flames
tip_text_1074	Reshiram's Fusion Flare move will unleash a burst of flames and then\r\ndestroy the stairs, so be careful!\r\n
tip_title_1075	{[0107|00000100]}Unova Pokémon League: \x0f\x01\x07Stage-Changing Lightning
tip_text_1075	Zekrom, the Dragon/Electric-type Legendary Pokémon, charges in\r\nusing Fusion Bolt, which breaks the stairs or leaves platforms askew.\r\n
tip_title_1076	{[0107|00000100]}Tortimer Island: \x0f\x01\x07Beehives from Trees
tip_text_1076	Beehives will occasionally fall from the trees. Unless you like swarms\r\nof bees attacking you, be careful not to hit those beehives...\r\n
tip_title_1077	{[0107|00000100]}Find Mii: \x0f\x01\x07Magic Effects Display
tip_text_1077	The Dark Emperor uses random magic during the battle. What effect\r\nhis magic will have is displayed above the heads of the fighters.\r\n
tip_title_1078	{[0107|00000100]}Arena Ferox: \x0f\x01\x07Platform Types
tip_text_1078	Four types of platforms appear on this stage. Some of them can be\r\ndestroyed! The statues too!\r\n
tip_title_1079	{[0107|00000100]}Golden Plains: \x0f\x01\x07Blue Coins
tip_text_1079	Step on the P Switch (or just hit it) to make blue coins appear.\r\nThey won't stay around for long, so look lively!\r\n
tip_title_1087	Team Power and Power
tip_text_1087	The strength of your team is called Team Power. It's determined\r\nbased on the power of your primary spirit and the support spirit skills.\r\n
tip_title_1088	Effect of Primary Spirit Types
tip_text_1088	If your spirit's type has an advantage on the opponent's type, you'll\r\nbe in a good place! Grab beats Shield, Shield beats Attack, and\r\nAttack beats Grab!
tip_title_1089	Series Bonus
tip_text_1089	If you use a fighter and primary spirit from the same series, you'll\r\nreceive a slight power boost.\r\n
tip_title_1090	Trait: Initial Damage 30%
tip_text_1090	You'll start off with some damage, but pairing this with skills that give\r\nyou advantages when damaged is a solid plan!\r\n
tip_title_1091	Support Slots
tip_text_1091	Many primary spirits that can't team up with a support spirit make up\r\nfor it with improved attack or defense.\r\n
tip_title_1092	Support Skill: Item Equipped
tip_text_1092	Try equipping two of these skills. If you do, the fighter will return\r\nfrom a KO holding the second item!\r\n
tip_title_1093	Support Skill: Stacked Boosts
tip_text_1093	It's possible to equip multiple sources of the same effect. There are\r\nalso boosting skills.\r\n
tip_title_1094	Support Skill: Improved Escape
tip_text_1094	Allows a fighter to quickly escape from grabs or from being buried.\r\nIt's also effective against shock, sleep, dizzy, ice, and more!\r\n
tip_title_1095	Support Skill: Ice-Floor Immunity
tip_text_1095	This skill can also disable freezing effects from things other than\r\nfloors. For example, Lucas's PK Freeze, or the Freezie item!\r\n
tip_title_1098	Spirit Board: FS Meter
tip_text_1098	In Spirits, fighters can charge up a meter to use their Final Smash.\r\nThe skill Fast Final Smash Meter allows this meter to charge faster\r\nthan usual!
tip_title_1099	Spirit Board: Experience
tip_text_1099	Spirits earn experience even if you lose. The more you battle with\r\nthem, the more they'll gain.\r\n
tip_title_1100	Spirit Board: Rewards
tip_text_1100	Defeating strong targets will net you strong rewards.\r\n\r\n
tip_title_1101	Spirit Board: Autopick
tip_text_1101	Press the Y Button to equip recommended spirits based on the\r\ntarget you're fighting. Your spirit team will change each time you\r\npress the button.
tip_title_1102	Create Team: Saving a Team
tip_text_1102	If you save a spirit team, you can use the team in normal Smash\r\nmode too.\r\n
tip_title_1103	Create Team: Save Slots
tip_text_1103	You can save up to 99 spirit teams. If you want to delete a team,\r\nselect Create Team from Collection, select a team, and then\r\npress the X Button.
tip_title_1104	Collection: Activities
tip_text_1104	Spirits doing activities must be fully focused on their task. You can't\r\nuse them until they're done, but you can pull them out of activities\r\nif necessary.
tip_title_1105	Collection: Favorites
tip_text_1105	Mark your best spirits as Favorites to avoid accidentally dismissing\r\nthem. Better safe than sorry!\r\n
tip_title_1106	Collection: Level Up with a Core
tip_text_1106	Power up a spirit with a core that has the same type as the spirit to\r\ngain more experience.\r\n
tip_title_1107	Smash with Spirits
tip_text_1107	You can equip spirit teams even in regular Smash. Just make sure\r\nyou've turned spirits on in the rules.\r\n
tip_title_1108	Shield Damage
tip_text_1108	A spirit's defensive power affects shields too. If a fighter has low\r\ndefense, their shield may break from a single strike!\r\n
tip_title_1109	Spirit Board: Co-op
tip_text_1109	Work together with others to take down the target! The more\r\nplayers, the tougher the fight.\r\n
tip_title_1110	Collection: Dismiss
tip_text_1110	The stronger the spirit, the more SP you can earn by dismissing them.\r\nHigh-level and high-rank spirits are worth more.\r\n
tip_title_1111	Collection: Summon
tip_text_1111	There are some spirits you can only get by summoning. Use\r\nReverse Lookup to see which spirits can be summoned.\r\n
tip_title_1113	Spirit List: Fighter Spirit
tip_text_1113	Once obtained, you might be able to look in the Spirit List to see\r\nwhat they looked like in their original game as well as in Smash Bros.\r\n
tip_title_1114	Adventure: Rescuing Fighters
tip_text_1114	Captured fighters are used as tools to mass produce puppet fighters.\r\nThey can become your allies if you defeat them and break the control\r\nover them.
tip_title_1115	Adventure: Swapping Displayed Fighter
tip_text_1115	You can change the fighter who appears on the map by opening the\r\nmenu and selecting Party.\r\n
tip_title_1116	Adventure: Obstacles and Hazards
tip_text_1116	If a path is blocked and you can't continue, come back to it later.\r\nYou may be able to get through using the help of spirits you've\r\nyet to meet.
tip_title_1117	Adventure: Difficulty
tip_text_1117	The harder the difficulty, the bigger the reward you'll get by winning.\r\nYou can change the difficulty setting at any time from the menu.\r\n
tip_title_1118	Adventure: Stacking Adventure Skills
tip_text_1118	It's possible to stack some of the effects from skills given by spirits.\r\nIt's a great way to really power up your fighter. Try stacking an\r\nAdventure Skill and a Support Skill!
tip_title_1119	Adventure: Learning Adventure Skills
tip_text_1119	You can forget and learn Adventure Skills countless times. You'll need\r\nto use SP to reset them though.\r\n
tip_title_1120	Adventure: Slowpoke's Dojo
tip_text_1120	You can forget a style that you've learned. Once forgotten, you can\r\nreturn to that style's Dojo to remember it again.\r\n
tip_title_1121	Adventure: Canceling Dojo Training
tip_text_1121	You can interrupt style training if necessary. If you enter the Dojo\r\nagain, you can pick up training where you left off.\r\n
tip_title_1122	Adventure: Ruins / Caves / Jungle Thicket
tip_text_1122	It's easier to get SP in Ruins, support items in Caves, and snacks\r\nin Jungle Thicket.\r\n
tip_title_1123	Adventure: Treasure from Explore
tip_text_1123	Treasure changes based on the number of explorers, their ranks,\r\nlevels, conditions, and even their style!\r\n
tip_title_1124	Adventure: Store Inventory (Pt. 1)
tip_text_1124	In Sheldon's store, it's easier to find spirits related to weapons.\r\nIn Anna's store, you'll find more spirits with equipment,\r\nand in Beedle's store, you'll find more living creatures.
tip_title_1125	Adventure: Store Inventory (Pt. 2)
tip_text_1125	In Funky Kong's store, it's easier to find transportation-related spirits.\r\nIt's easier to find spirits related to items at Timmy and Tommy's.\r\n
tip_title_1126	Adventure: Hazards and Stores
tip_text_1126	Don't have a spirit you need to get past an obstacle? Take a glance\r\nat the stores and see what they have in stock!\r\n
tip_title_1127	Adventure: Skill Spheres
tip_text_1127	On rare occasions, you'll find skill spheres on sale too. The frequency\r\nof their appearance differs from store to store.\r\n
tip_title_1128	Adventure: The Final Battle
tip_text_1128	Things can change drastically in the final battle. The power of the\r\nforces of light and darkness will be affected by how many enemies\r\nremain.
tip_title_1129	Adventure: New Game+
tip_text_1129	Carry some things over, and have all spirits and bosses return! You\r\ncan also obtain spirits and skill spheres again.\r\n
tip_title_1131	Directional Air Dodge
tip_text_1131	During an air dodge, you can move toward the direction you tilt\r\nthe control stick. However, this leaves you more vulnerable\r\nthan a normal air dodge afterward.
tip_title_1132	Charging Smash Attacks
tip_text_1132	You can charge up a smash attack by pressing and holding the\r\nbutton. One second is enough for max power, but you can hold\r\nit for up to three.
tip_title_1133	Grab Attacks
tip_text_1133	Grab opponents and press the attack button to perform a grab\r\nattack. You can deal extra damage to the opponent before throwing\r\nthem, but make sure they don't escape!
tip_title_1134	Continuous Dodging Penalty
tip_text_1134	If you dodge too often, you'll move slower and be invincible for less\r\ntime. Dodging away from an opponent has even a bigger penalty.\r\n
tip_title_1135	Attacking from Ladders
tip_text_1135	When you're on a ladder, you'll react as if you were in midair. You\r\ncan still attack while on the ladder but some moves will remove\r\nyou from the ladder.
tip_title_1136	Hitstun Shrinks Based On Battle Participant Count
tip_text_1136	When an attack hits, the hitstun may stop an opponent from moving\r\nfor a short while. But when fighting more people, the hitstun becomes\r\nshorter.
tip_title_1137	Attack Power in 1-on-1 Battles
tip_text_1137	Attack power is increased slightly during 1-on-1 battles with no\r\nitems. Launch rate remains the same.\r\n
tip_title_1138	Moving the Shield
tip_text_1138	When shielding, you can move the shield around to block more\r\neffectively. To do this, hold both shield buttons (or a shield\r\nbutton and the special-move button) and tilt the control stick.
tip_title_1139	On-the-Spot Dodge Into Counterattack
tip_text_1139	If you dodge on the spot, you can quickly cancel it with an attack.\r\nYou can smoothly move from a dodge into a counterattack.\r\n
tip_title_1140	Special Presentation for 1-on-1 Smash
tip_text_1140	The camera will sometimes zoom in on the action during 1-on-1\r\nSmash. It'll trigger if a powerful blow lands or if there's an attack\r\nthat might lead to victory.
tip_title_1141	Grab Resistance
tip_text_1141	After getting out of a grab or immediately after being thrown, you\r\ncan't be grabbed again by an opponent. Fighters flash yellow when\r\ngrabs won't work.
tip_title_1142	Canceling Taunt
tip_text_1142	Taunts can be canceled by any other action. However, taunts that\r\nalso serve as attacks cannot be canceled.\r\n
tip_title_1143	Shoving Match
tip_text_1143	Fighters on the ground will push each other if they run into each\r\nother. The heavier fighter will have the stronger push.\r\n
tip_title_1144	Air Dodge Limitations
tip_text_1144	You can only dodge once in the air until you land. However, if you\r\ntake damage in midair, you can dodge again.\r\n
tip_title_1145	Telling Who's in First
tip_text_1145	In Smash mode, the fighter in first place will glow from time to time.\r\nYou may want to focus on taking them down a peg.\r\n
tip_title_1146	Missing Grabs
tip_text_1146	Grabs can't be blocked by a shield. However, you're left vulnerable\r\nfor a while if you miss a grab, so grab smartly.\r\n
tip_title_1147	Downtime from Shielding
tip_text_1147	When you block an opponent's ground attack with a shield, it takes\r\na moment to recover. This recovery time is shorter if you block an\r\naerial attack.
tip_title_1148	Ice and Damage
tip_text_1148	If you get frozen, you won't be able to move for a while. The more\r\ndamage you've taken, the longer you will be frozen.\r\n
tip_title_1149	Edge Attacks
tip_text_1149	If you attack while holding on to an edge, you'll be invincible until\r\nyou attack. It's great for attacking opponents, but it's weak against\r\nshields and dodges.
tip_title_1150	Judging Escape Timing
tip_text_1150	If you get grabbed, you can shorten the amount of time you're caught\r\nby wriggling around. When you start to flash yellow, you'll soon be\r\nable to escape.
tip_title_1151	Grab Parrying
tip_text_1151	If you grab an opponent at the same time they grab you, the two\r\ngrabs may cancel each other out. This can be useful if you can\r\npredict the grab.
tip_title_1152	Simple Short-Hop Attack
tip_text_1152	If you press the jump button and attack button at the same time,\r\nyou'll perform a jumping short-hop attack. It's very useful for\r\ncatching an opponent off guard.
tip_title_1153	Short-Hop Attack Power
tip_text_1153	If you use an aerial attack during a short hop, the attack power for\r\nthe move will be a little less than normal. It's a low risk move, but\r\nalso has low returns.
tip_title_1154	Recovery Platform and Invincibility Time
tip_text_1154	If you wait on the recovery platform after a KO, your invincibility\r\ntime when descending from the recovery platform will be reduced.\r\n
tip_title_1155	Shield Breaks at the End of a Battle
tip_text_1155	When your shield is broken and you're launched, you normally get a\r\nshort period of invincibility. However, you won't get this invincibility\r\nduring the final countdown of a battle.
tip_title_1156	Breaking Fall after Being Footstooled
tip_text_1156	If you're stepped on by an opponent in midair, you'll fall straight\r\ndown. However, you can break your fall by pressing the shield\r\nbutton right before landing.
tip_title_1157	Shield Break KOs
tip_text_1157	If a fighter is KO'd from falling off the stage after having their\r\nshield broken, the fighter that broke their shield will get the\r\ncredit for that KO.
tip_title_1158	Dash Flip Then Up Smash Attack
tip_text_1158	Look back while running and perform an up smash attack to flip\r\naround and do an up smash. It's easier to perform by using the\r\nright control stick.
tip_title_1159	Attack to Pick Up Items
tip_text_1159	If you use a tilt attack near an item, you can attack while picking up\r\nthe item. This is useful when battling others for items.\r\n
tip_title_1160	Hydrophobic Fighters
