tip_text_1160	Don't talk to Charizard or Inkling about swimming. They'll take\r\ngradual damage while they're in the water.\r\n
tip_title_1161	Ice Climbers' Origins
tip_text_1161	Ice Climbers first appeared in the 1985 release Ice Climber. The boy\r\nis Popo and the girl is Nana. They jump with hammers in hand as\r\nthey aim for the summit.
tip_title_1162	{[0107|00000100]}Ice Climbers: \x0f\x01\x07In Their Series
tip_text_1162	In Ice Climber, Popo and Nana are identical outside of their clothing.\r\nTwo players can play at the same time, and the game can be\r\ncooperative or competitive depending on how you play.
tip_title_1163	{[0107|00000100]}Ice Climbers: \x0f\x01\x07Ice from Ice Shot (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1163	Popo and Nana both shoot ice from their hammers. If both climbers\r\nare present, there are two hunks of ice, but only one hunk if only\r\none of them is present.
tip_title_1164	{[0107|00000100]}Ice Climbers: \x0f\x01\x07Ice Shot Reflected (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1164	Ice Shot will be sent back at you if hit by an opponent or blocked by\r\ntheir shield. If an opponent's attack sends it back your way, it can\r\ndamage you, so stay alert.
tip_title_1165	{[0107|00000100]}Ice Climbers: \x0f\x01\x07Squall Hammer (Side Special)
tip_text_1165	Move left and right with the control stick and rise into the air by\r\nrepeatedly pressing the button. When both Popo and Nana are\r\npresent, you can launch opponents with the final hit.
tip_title_1166	{[0107|00000100]}Ice Climbers: \x0f\x01\x07Belay (Up Special)
tip_text_1166	Popo tosses Nana upward, and Nana then pulls Popo up with a rope.\r\nThe rope is a lifeline that connects the two climbers.\r\n
tip_title_1167	{[0107|00000100]}Ice Climbers: \x0f\x01\x07Blizzard (Down Special)
tip_text_1167	The Ice Climbers unleash a snowstorm from their hands that freezes\r\nopponents. If this move is used on opponents that are already frozen,\r\nthey will stay frozen longer.
tip_title_1168	{[0107|00000100]}Ice Climbers: \x0f\x01\x07Iceberg (Final Smash)
tip_text_1168	A Final Smash where the Ice Climbers summon an iceberg from the\r\nbottom of the screen. The iceberg can be spun left and right, but you\r\nwill move as well, so be smart.
tip_title_1169	{[0107|00000100]}Ice Climbers: \x0f\x01\x07Iceberg's Condor (Final Smash)
tip_text_1169	A condor will appear along with the iceberg. Only the Ice Climbers\r\ncan grab on to its legs.\r\n
tip_title_1170	{[0107|00000100]}Ice Climbers: \x0f\x01\x07Polar Bear in Iceberg (Final Smash)
tip_text_1170	The Polar Bear will be in the middle area of the iceberg trying to\r\nmaintain its balance. If you touch the Polar Bear, it will launch you\r\nfarther than the iceberg. Quite dangerous.
tip_title_1171	{[0107|00000100]}Ice Climbers: \x0f\x01\x07Grabbing Popo
tip_text_1171	If Popo is grabbed, Nana will panic and be unable to move. Once\r\nPopo is freed, Nana will begin moving again.\r\n
tip_title_1172	{[0107|00000100]}Ice Climbers: \x0f\x01\x07Nana
tip_text_1172	Nana is slightly easier to launch than Popo. When Nana is gone, the\r\nSpecial moves and normal attacks will become weaker and Belay\r\nwon't be as effective for recoveries.
tip_title_1173	{[0107|00000100]}Ice Climbers: \x0f\x01\x07Hammer Sweep (Down Smash)
tip_text_1173	Popo attacks in front of himself and Nana attacks behind. When Popo\r\nis alone, his attack range will become smaller.\r\n
tip_title_1174	{[0107|00000100]}Ice Climbers: \x0f\x01\x07Hammer Slam (Forward Air Attack)
tip_text_1174	Roll forward in the air and slam down the hammer. Popo's attack\r\ncan launch opponents far, and Nana's attack has a meteor effect\r\nif it hits just right.
tip_title_1175	{[0107|00000100]}Ice Climbers: \x0f\x01\x07Grab
tip_text_1175	Popo will be the only one that grabs. When throwing an opponent,\r\nNana will raise her arms and cheer!\r\n
tip_title_1176	Inkling's Origins
tip_text_1176	Inkling first appeared in Splatoon released in 2015. Inklings can\r\nchange between human form and squid form. They battle by using\r\nweapons that shoot ink to cover the ground and walls.
tip_title_1177	{[0107|00000100]}Inkling: \x0f\x01\x07In Their Series
tip_text_1177	In the Splatoon series, Inklings cover the ground and walls in ink, and\r\nthen swim through that ink as a squid. But if they fall into water, the\r\nink in their bodies will diffuse and they'll dissolve.
tip_title_1178	{[0107|00000100]}Inkling: \x0f\x01\x07Splattershot (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1178	Hold down the button to shoot ink. Adjust the angle with up or\r\ndown. The attack lacks power, but it can quickly ink opponents.\r\n
tip_title_1179	{[0107|00000100]}Inkling: \x0f\x01\x07Splat Roller (Side Special)
tip_text_1179	Run your Splat Roller along the ground to ink it. If you run into an\r\nopponent while rolling, they'll be buried.\r\n
tip_title_1180	{[0107|00000100]}Inkling: \x0f\x01\x07Super Jump (Up Special)
tip_text_1180	Squirt ink to rocket into the air. It's great for returning to the stage.\r\nNearby opponents will be launched if hit by the ink spray during\r\ntakeoff and landing.
tip_title_1181	{[0107|00000100]}Inkling: \x0f\x01\x07Splat Bomb (Down Special)
tip_text_1181	Charge the attack to throw farther, deal more damage, and have\r\nmore ink in general. If the move is not charged, the bomb will land\r\ndirectly in front of you, which can be useful.
tip_title_1182	{[0107|00000100]}Inkling: \x0f\x01\x07Killer Wail (Final Smash)
tip_text_1182	Unleashes a laser that penetrates the landscape. While it's wailing,\r\nyou can control the Inkling freely and adjust the angle of the laser.\r\nIt can be set up on the ground or in the air!
tip_title_1183	{[0107|00000100]}Inkling: \x0f\x01\x07Killer Wail after Being KO'd (Final Smash)
tip_text_1183	Even if the Inkling is KO'd during the Final Smash, the laser will remain\r\nand can still be controlled.\r\n
tip_title_1184	{[0107|00000100]}Inkling: \x0f\x01\x07Refilling Ink
tip_text_1184	Shield and press the special-move button to refill your ink tank. If\r\nyou're totally empty, you can use neutral special or down special\r\non the ground to refill your ink tank.
tip_title_1185	{[0107|00000100]}Inkling: \x0f\x01\x07Running Out of Ink
tip_text_1185	When you don't have enough ink, special moves and smash attacks\r\nwill become less effective. Replenish ink by holding down the\r\nspecial-move button while shielding.
tip_title_1186	{[0107|00000100]}Inkling: \x0f\x01\x07Slosher (Down Smash)
tip_text_1186	A down smash attack that splashes ink left and right with a Slosher.\r\nIt's very effective at covering opponents with ink.\r\n
tip_title_1188	{[0107|00000100]}Inkling: \x0f\x01\x07"C'mon!" and "Booyah!" 
tip_text_1188	The up taunt is the same as the "C'mon!" gesture used in the original\r\nSplatoon game. The down taunt, "Booyah!" is also from the original\r\ngame.
tip_title_1189	Wolf's Origins
tip_text_1189	Wolf's debut was in Star Fox 64, released in 1997. His first\r\nappearance would have been in Star Fox 2, but that title\r\nwas delayed a bit.
tip_title_1190	{[0107|00000100]}Wolf: \x0f\x01\x07In His Series
tip_text_1190	Wolf is an ace pilot and leader of the elite team Star Wolf. He's been\r\nknown to work for the evil Andross. Wolf not only has a connection\r\nto Fox, but also to Fox's father James.
tip_title_1191	{[0107|00000100]}Wolf: \x0f\x01\x07Blaster (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1191	A two-part attack where you first attack with the blade on the\r\nBlaster and then fire a shot. Use it near an opponent to hit with\r\nboth. The attack is powerful, but you cannot continuously fire.
tip_title_1192	{[0107|00000100]}Wolf: \x0f\x01\x07Wolf Flash (Side Special)
tip_text_1192	Input up or down with the control stick to slightly change the\r\ndirection you dash forward. If the claw makes contact,\r\nit hits hard. The center area has a powerful meteor effect!
tip_title_1193	{[0107|00000100]}Wolf: \x0f\x01\x07Fire Wolf (Up Special)
tip_text_1193	Input a direction to make Wolf move in that direction while attacking.\r\nHe doesn't go far, but it has great launching power, making it great\r\nfor KOs.
tip_title_1194	{[0107|00000100]}Wolf: \x0f\x01\x07Reflector (Down Special)
tip_text_1194	Projectiles opponents fire will be reflected back at them with more\r\nspeed and power. Opponents directly hit with the Reflector will be\r\nthrown slightly upward.
tip_title_1195	{[0107|00000100]}Wolf: \x0f\x01\x07Team Star Wolf (Final Smash)
tip_text_1195	Team Star Wolf launch a coordinated attack on the targeted fighters.\r\nWolf's dialogue changes if Fox or Falco have been targeted.\r\n
tip_title_1196	Incineroar's Origins
tip_text_1196	Incineroar's debut was in Pokémon Sun and Moon released in 2016.\r\nIncineroar has a pro-wrestler vibe going on, and can use the powerful\r\nBlaze ability.
tip_title_1197	{[0107|00000100]}Incineroar: \x0f\x01\x07In Its Series
tip_text_1197	Incineroar is the final form of Litten, one of the three Pokémon you\r\ncan choose at the beginning of Pokémon Sun and Moon. It's a\r\nwell-balanced Pokémon with very high attack and defense.
tip_title_1198	{[0107|00000100]}Incineroar: \x0f\x01\x07Darkest Lariat (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1198	Become invincible right after using the move and deal big damage.\r\nWhen Incineroar is swinging its arms, you can make it go forward\r\nor backward with the control stick.
tip_title_1199	{[0107|00000100]}Incineroar: \x0f\x01\x07Alolan Whip (Side Special)
tip_text_1199	Grab an opponent and throw them into the ropes before following\r\nup with an attack. The follow-up attack will change depending on\r\nthe timing you press the button when the opponent comes back.
tip_title_1200	{[0107|00000100]}Incineroar: \x0f\x01\x07Controls during Cross Chop (Up Special)
tip_text_1200	When falling down, tilt the control stick left or right to slightly change\r\nyour landing location. Also, you can go through platforms by tilting\r\nthe control stick downward.
tip_title_1201	{[0107|00000100]}Incineroar: \x0f\x01\x07Recovery after Cross Chop (Up Special)
tip_text_1201	Even after diving downward with Cross Chop, you can use your\r\nmidair jump and side special. You might get lucky and make it\r\nback to the stage!
tip_title_1202	{[0107|00000100]}Incineroar: \x0f\x01\x07Revenge (Down Special)
tip_text_1202	If hit shortly after using Revenge, the attack power of Incineroar's next\r\nmove will increase and Incineroar will glow red. However, if\r\nIncineroar is thrown or gets hit hard, the effect will vanish.
tip_title_1203	{[0107|00000100]}Incineroar: \x0f\x01\x07Max Malicious Moonsault (Final Smash)
tip_text_1203	Incineroar charges forward, grabs an opponent, and hits them with a\r\nseries of attacks. It's easier to land the attack right after the\r\nopponent breaks free from a grab.
tip_title_1204	{[0107|00000100]}Incineroar: \x0f\x01\x07Taunting after an Attack Hits
tip_text_1204	After certain attacks hit, Incineroar will pose and taunt like a pro\r\nwrestler. You can move during these taunts, so they don't actually\r\nleave you vulnerable.
tip_title_1205	King K. Rool's Origins
tip_text_1205	King K. Rool made his debut in 1994 in Donkey Kong Country. He is\r\nthe leader of the Kremlings and his favorite hobby is stealing\r\nDonkey Kong's bananas.
tip_title_1206	{[0107|00000100]}King K. Rool: \x0f\x01\x07In His Series
tip_text_1206	King K. Rool appears as the last boss in Donkey Kong Country. He will\r\npretend to be defeated during the fight. After the fake ending and\r\n"THE END?" shows up, he will get up and attack again.
tip_title_1207	{[0107|00000100]}King K. Rool: \x0f\x01\x07Blunderbuss (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1207	Shoots a slow but powerful iron ball from a pirate-themed firearm.\r\nIf you continue to hold the special-move button, you can suck the\r\niron ball back in and then shoot it back out.
tip_title_1208	{[0107|00000100]}King K. Rool: \x0f\x01\x07Blunderbuss Suck Up (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1208	Suck up not only fighters, but the iron ball that was shot out. After\r\nsucking something up, you can aim the shot forward, above, or\r\nbackward with the control stick.
tip_title_1209	{[0107|00000100]}King K. Rool: \x0f\x01\x07Slipping through Platforms while Vacuuming (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1209	If you press down on the control stick while holding the special-move\r\nbutton to suck things up with the gun, you can fall through platforms.\r\n
tip_title_1210	{[0107|00000100]}King K. Rool: \x0f\x01\x07Crownerang (Side Special)
tip_text_1210	Throw the crown like a boomerang. While you're throwing it, you'll\r\nhave super armor and can withstand weak attacks. If you don't\r\ncatch the crown, you can't attack with it again until you retrieve it.
tip_title_1211	{[0107|00000100]}King K. Rool: \x0f\x01\x07The Crown as an Item (Side Special)
tip_text_1211	If your crown falls to the ground, it can be picked up by other fighters\r\nand used as an item. If your crown falls off the stage, it will reappear\r\nafter a while.
tip_title_1212	{[0107|00000100]}King K. Rool: \x0f\x01\x07Propellerpack (Up Special)
tip_text_1212	Tilt the control stick to fly in that direction. You can travel pretty far,\r\nand you can also attack with the propeller.\r\n
tip_title_1213	{[0107|00000100]}King K. Rool: \x0f\x01\x07Gut Check (Down Special)
tip_text_1213	A counter move where King K. Rool sticks out his belly. If his belly\r\nis hit during this time, he'll counterattack not only direct attacks,\r\nbut projectiles as well.
tip_title_1214	{[0107|00000100]}King K. Rool: \x0f\x01\x07Gut Check Behind (Down Special)
tip_text_1214	If you enter an input toward King K. Rool's backside right after\r\nsuccessfully using this counter, he can quickly look back\r\nand counter.
tip_title_1215	{[0107|00000100]}King K. Rool: \x0f\x01\x07Blast-o-Matic (Final Smash)
tip_text_1215	Shoot Donkey Kong Island with the Blast-o-Matic from the island\r\nfortress. All opponents hit by King K. Rool's initial attack will\r\nbe blasted.
tip_title_1216	{[0107|00000100]}King K. Rool: \x0f\x01\x07Belly Super Armor
tip_text_1216	Some attacks, like side tilt attacks and neutral air attacks, cause\r\nKing K. Rool's belly to have super armor. This allows you to land\r\nattacks even when getting hit by incoming attacks.
tip_title_1217	{[0107|00000100]}King K. Rool: \x0f\x01\x07Belly Crack
tip_text_1217	His belly's super armor is very reliable, but once it takes damage,\r\na crack will appear. The crack will grow as it takes more damage,\r\nuntil finally King K. Rool becomes stunned while his belly heals.
tip_title_1218	{[0107|00000100]}King K. Rool: \x0f\x01\x07Piledriver (Downward Throw)
tip_text_1218	Throw a grabbed opponent downward to bury them in the ground.\r\nThe more damage an opponent has, the longer they will stay buried.\r\n
tip_title_1219	Chrom's Origins
tip_text_1219	Chrom made his debut in Fire Emblem Awakening released in 2013.\r\nHe wields the Falchion that belongs to the royal family and has the\r\nBrand that proves he is a descendant of the Hero-King Marth.
tip_title_1220	{[0107|00000100]}Chrom: \x0f\x01\x07In His Series
tip_text_1220	The prince of the Halidom of Ylisse can be clumsy at times, but\r\nhe cares deeply for his comrades. With Falchion in hand, he fights\r\noff the neighboring country of Plegia. Lucina is his daughter.
tip_title_1221	{[0107|00000100]}Chrom: \x0f\x01\x07Flare Blade (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1221	Slashes opponents with a sword. You can change direction while\r\ncharging up the attack, but if you overcharge it, you will receive\r\ndamage.
tip_title_1222	{[0107|00000100]}Chrom: \x0f\x01\x07Double-Edge Dance (Side Special)
tip_text_1222	Repeatedly attack up to four times, with additional input. The\r\nrepeated attacks will change if you input up, sideways, or down\r\non the control stick.
tip_title_1223	{[0107|00000100]}Chrom: \x0f\x01\x07Soaring Slash (Up Special)
tip_text_1223	Slash upward and then slam down into the ground. You can't cancel\r\nthe move until you land, so be careful to use it near edges.\r\n
tip_title_1224	{[0107|00000100]}Chrom: \x0f\x01\x07Counter (Down Special)
tip_text_1224	Use this move right before an opponent's attack hits you to launch\r\na quick and powerful counterattack. \r\n
tip_title_1225	{[0107|00000100]}Chrom: \x0f\x01\x07Awakening Aether (Final Smash)
tip_text_1225	Get close to an opponent and hit them with a technique called Sol.\r\nThen, follow up with the piercing Luna technique for a perfect\r\ncombination.
tip_title_1226	Ken's Origins
tip_text_1226	Ken first debuted in 1987 in the arcade version of Street Fighter.\r\nHe showed up as the P2 character. He was exactly the same\r\nas Ryu besides his looks.
tip_title_1227	{[0107|00000100]}Ken: \x0f\x01\x07In His Series
tip_text_1227	Ken is friends with Ryu and also trained with him. He considers\r\nRyu as his rival. He is the son of the well-known Masters family.\r\n
tip_title_1228	{[0107|00000100]}Ken: \x0f\x01\x07Hadoken (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1228	Press the button longer to increase the speed, distance, and power.\r\nThe Hadoken's shape is a bit different than Ryu's, and you can see\r\nthe shape of Ken's hands within the Hadoken.
tip_title_1229	{[0107|00000100]}Ken: \x0f\x01\x07Tatsumaki Senpukyaku (Side Special)
tip_text_1229	It can hit multiple times, so get all the hits in to do a lot of damage.\r\nInput ↓← + special-move button to increase the attack's power\r\neven more.
tip_title_1230	{[0107|00000100]}Ken: \x0f\x01\x07Shoryuken (Up Special / Command-Input Move)
tip_text_1230	This version of the attack increases invincibility time at the start, and\r\nboosts attack power. The light version leaves you less vulnerable when\r\nyou land, and the medium version hits foes twice.
tip_title_1231	{[0107|00000100]}Ken: \x0f\x01\x07Flaming Shoryuken (Up Special - Heavy)
tip_text_1231	Press and hold the button to unleash a Shoryuken engulfed in flames.\r\nIt can hit three times and does big damage, and it launches\r\nopponents farther horizontally than Ryu's Shoryuken.
tip_title_1232	{[0107|00000100]}Ken: \x0f\x01\x07Focus Attack (Down Special)
tip_text_1232	Ken can take one hit without flinching while charging this spinning\r\nkick. If it lands at max charge, the opponent will fall slowly to\r\nthe ground.
tip_title_1233	{[0107|00000100]}Ken: \x0f\x01\x07Nata Otoshi Geri (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_1233	Input →↓+ attack button while facing right to unleash a high spin\r\nkick. You can perform this immediately after canceling a\r\nneutral attack.
tip_title_1234	{[0107|00000100]}Ken: \x0f\x01\x07Oosoto Mawashi Geri (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_1234	Input ←↓→ + attack button while facing right to execute\r\nthis move. You can perform this immediately after canceling\r\na neutral attack.
tip_title_1235	{[0107|00000100]}Ken: \x0f\x01\x07Inazuma Kick (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_1235	Hold down the button after entering →↓ + attack button or\r\n←↓→ + attack button while facing right to execute this\r\nmove. It does major damage to shields.
tip_title_1236	{[0107|00000100]}Ken: \x0f\x01\x07Shippu Jinraikyaku (Final Smash)
tip_text_1236	If an opponent is nearby when you activate your Final Smash, you'll\r\nexecute this flashy kick, rising into the air and hitting your opponent\r\nmultiple times before launching them.
tip_title_1237	{[0107|00000100]}Ken: \x0f\x01\x07Shinryuken (Final Smash)
tip_text_1237	If your opponent is far away, your Final Smash becomes Shinryuken.\r\nIt does good damage and can hit opponents in front of you and\r\naround you.
tip_title_1238	{[0107|00000100]}Ken: \x0f\x01\x07Hell Wheel (Backward Throw)
tip_text_1238	Unlike Ryu's Somersault Throw, Ken rolls backward once and then\r\nthrows his opponent with Hell Wheel. Ken gains the distance he\r\nmoved during the throw, making it easy to follow up quickly.
tip_title_1239	Young Link's Origins
tip_text_1239	Young Link debuted in The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time released \r\nin 1998. He lived in the Kokiri Forest, until the Great Deku Tree,\r\nguardian of the forest, informs him of danger approaching Hyrule.
tip_title_1240	{[0107|00000100]}Young Link: \x0f\x01\x07In His Series
tip_text_1240	To stop Ganondorf, the Great King of Evil, Young Link travels with\r\nhis fairy companion Navi. He pulls out the Master Sword, and after\r\na seven-year slumber, emerges as the Hero of Time.
tip_title_1241	{[0107|00000100]}Young Link: \x0f\x01\x07Differences from Other Links
tip_text_1241	Young Link's launch power is the weakest of the Links, but that\r\nmakes it easier to perform combos. He's quicker in the air, can\r\nunleash moves faster, and is less vulnerable when landing.
tip_title_1242	{[0107|00000100]}Young Link: \x0f\x01\x07Fire Arrow (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1242	Young Link's arrows will burn anything they hit. They can be used to\r\ndetonate explosives from far away.\r\n
tip_title_1243	{[0107|00000100]}Young Link: \x0f\x01\x07Boomerang's Flight Distance (Side Special)
tip_text_1243	The distance the Boomerang flies depends on how far you tilt the\r\ncontrol stick, but it can't fly as far as the other Links' boomerangs.\r\nHowever, it deals heavy damage the moment it's thrown.
tip_title_1244	{[0107|00000100]}Young Link: \x0f\x01\x07Boomerang (Side Special)
tip_text_1244	The Boomerang will also hit when returning, making it useful to keep\r\nopponents at bay. The Boomerang Young Link uses is the one from\r\nThe Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time.
tip_title_1245	{[0107|00000100]}Young Link: \x0f\x01\x07Spin Attack (Up Special)
tip_text_1245	Spins around and hits opponents repeatedly. Hold down the button\r\nwhile on the ground to increase the power. The launching power\r\nis low, but you can get combos with an air attack.
tip_title_1246	{[0107|00000100]}Young Link: \x0f\x01\x07Bomb (Down Special)
tip_text_1246	Fighters caught in the bomb's explosion can be hit a maximum of\r\nfour times. Since it hits multiple times, the damage it deals is higher\r\nthan Link's or Toon Link's bombs.
tip_title_1247	{[0107|00000100]}Young Link: \x0f\x01\x07Triforce Slash (Final Smash)
tip_text_1247	If the Triforce hits an opponent, the opponent will be bound and\r\nhit with the sword multiple times. The final blow can hit multiple\r\nenemies.
tip_title_1248	{[0107|00000100]}Young Link: \x0f\x01\x07Down Taunt
tip_text_1248	Young Link drinks the famous product of Lon Lon Ranch, Lon Lon Milk.\r\nDrinking it won't heal any damage, but it sure is delicious!\r\n
tip_title_1249	Isabelle's Origins
tip_text_1249	Isabelle first appeared in Animal Crossing: New Leaf in 2013. She is\r\na secretary that supports the main character, who happens to\r\nbecome the mayor of the town.
tip_title_1250	{[0107|00000100]}Isabelle: \x0f\x01\x07In Her Series
tip_text_1250	Isabelle is loved by all the residents and is always happy to help.\r\nShe loves festivals and changes her outfit depending on the\r\nseason and event.
tip_title_1251	{[0107|00000100]}Isabelle: \x0f\x01\x07Pocket (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1251	Use this move to put items or incoming projectiles into Isabelle's\r\npocket. Press the button again to take the item or projectile back\r\nout of her pocket.
tip_title_1252	{[0107|00000100]}Isabelle: \x0f\x01\x07Toss with Fishing Rod (Side Special)
tip_text_1252	Cast the fishing hook to catch opponents, then reel them in and\r\nlaunch them forward, backward, up, or down. Opponents and even\r\nitems can be caught while reeling in the line as well!
tip_title_1253	{[0107|00000100]}Isabelle: \x0f\x01\x07Fishing Rod's Hook (Side Special)
tip_text_1253	If the fishing hook catches the edge of the stage, you can pull yourself\r\nup with it. You can also catch nearby opponents with the hook and\r\nbring them down with you.
tip_title_1254	{[0107|00000100]}Isabelle: \x0f\x01\x07Lloid Trap (Down Special)
tip_text_1254	If someone walks over the buried Lloid, it will rise up and deal\r\ndamage. After burying Lloid, you can do another down special\r\nto make Lloid rise on command.
tip_title_1255	{[0107|00000100]}Isabelle: \x0f\x01\x07Dream Town Hall (Final Smash)
tip_text_1255	Tom Nook and his gang will show up and build the town hall from\r\nAnimal Crossing: New Leaf on top of an opponent. At the end, it\r\nwill explode, launching anyone nearby.
tip_title_1256	{[0107|00000100]}Isabelle: \x0f\x01\x07Balloon Trip (Up Special)
tip_text_1256	Unlike the Villager, Isabelle will float up sitting on a swing-like\r\nseat attached to bunny-shaped balloons. The move is pretty\r\nmuch the same as the Villager's, but it's, like, super cute.
tip_title_1257	Simon's Origins
tip_text_1257	Simon made his debut in Castlevania, released in North America\r\nin 1987. Armed with nothing but his legendary whip, he enters\r\nDracula's Castle alone to slay all manner of foul beasts.
tip_title_1258	{[0107|00000100]}Simon: \x0f\x01\x07In His Series
tip_text_1258	Simon is a vampire hunter of House Belmont. He uses not only whips,\r\nbut also daggers, axes, Holy Water, crosses, and even stopwatches\r\nas weapons.
tip_title_1259	{[0107|00000100]}Simon: \x0f\x01\x07Holding the Whip
tip_text_1259	Press and hold the attack button to make the whip dangle. Rotate\r\nthe control stick in a circular motion to swing the whip around.\r\n
tip_title_1260	{[0107|00000100]}Simon: \x0f\x01\x07Axe (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1260	A projectile that curves through the air when thrown. You can adjust\r\nthe angle of the throw by moving the stick left or right. It can pass\r\nthrough the stage, hitting unsuspecting opponents!
tip_title_1261	{[0107|00000100]}Simon: \x0f\x01\x07Cross (Side Special)
tip_text_1261	You can increase the distance and power by quickly moving the\r\nstick as you press the special-move button. It can hit while flying\r\nout and when flying back, but it's more powerful when flying out.
tip_title_1262	{[0107|00000100]}Simon: \x0f\x01\x07Uppercut (Up Special)
tip_text_1262	A jumping punch that can hit repeatedly. The final hit has the most\r\nlaunch power.\r\n
tip_title_1263	{[0107|00000100]}Simon: \x0f\x01\x07Holy Water (Down Special)
tip_text_1263	Throw a bottle of Holy Water forward. If it hits an opponent or\r\nthe landscape, a red flaming pillar will appear, stopping the\r\nopponent's movements. Try following up with a whip attack!
tip_title_1264	{[0107|00000100]}Simon: \x0f\x01\x07Sliding (Down Tilt Attack)
tip_text_1264	Press the attack button again while sliding to perform an additional\r\njump kick. Use it to catch your opponent off guard or as part of\r\na combo.
tip_title_1265	{[0107|00000100]}Simon: \x0f\x01\x07Grand Cross (Final Smash)
tip_text_1265	Summon a coffin that traps opponents who touch it. Using this\r\non an opponent who is trapped in your Holy Water's fire or an\r\nopponent who's fallen down is a good strategy.
tip_title_1266	Snake's Origins
tip_text_1266	Snake made his debut in Metal Gear, released in North America\r\nin 1988. It's a stealth-based game that has Snake acquiring\r\nweapons and equipment while on various missions.
tip_title_1267	{[0107|00000100]}Snake: \x0f\x01\x07In His Series
tip_text_1267	Snake's job is to infiltrate enemy bases alone to stop terrorist\r\norganizations. The player has the option to stay quiet and sneak\r\naround, or go loud with guns and bombs.
tip_title_1268	{[0107|00000100]}Snake: \x0f\x01\x07Hand Grenade (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1268	The hand grenade explodes 2.5 seconds after the pin is pulled out.\r\nOpponents won't flinch even if the grenade hits when thrown.\r\nYou can get caught in the explosion as well, so be smart.
tip_title_1269	{[0107|00000100]}Snake: \x0f\x01\x07Holding Hand Grenade (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1269	Pressing and holding the special-move button will allow you to\r\nmove around while holding the grenade. You can move forward,\r\nbackward, jump, and even perform midair jumps.
tip_title_1270	{[0107|00000100]}Snake: \x0f\x01\x07Throwing the Hand Grenade (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1270	Depending on the direction you tilt the control stick, you can throw\r\nthe grenade near, medium, or far. Press the shield button to drop\r\nit at your feet.
tip_title_1271	{[0107|00000100]}Snake: \x0f\x01\x07Remote Missile (Side Special)
tip_text_1271	You can control the missile freely, but you cannot move around.\r\nIf opponents try to attack you, press the shield button to cancel.\r\n
tip_title_1272	{[0107|00000100]}Snake: \x0f\x01\x07Cypher (Up Special)
tip_text_1272	Attack or dodge while rising up in the air to let go of the Cypher.\r\nIf you take damage while airborne, you can use this move again.\r\n
tip_title_1273	{[0107|00000100]}Snake: \x0f\x01\x07C4 (Down Special)
tip_text_1273	The C4 bombs that you've set can be detonated by using your down\r\nspecial again. When trying to recover, you can detonate it in midair\r\nto blast yourself back to the stage.
tip_title_1274	{[0107|00000100]}Snake: \x0f\x01\x07C4 - Butterfly Form (Down Special)
tip_text_1274	Sometimes Snake will use a butterfly-shaped C3 explosive instead\r\nof a C4 bomb. They may look different, but both bombs behave\r\nidentically.
tip_title_1275	{[0107|00000100]}Snake: \x0f\x01\x07C4 Placement (Down Special)
tip_text_1275	You can attach C4 bombs to not only the ground, but to walls and\r\nopponents as well. The bomb will detonate automatically once\r\nenough time has passed. Don't blow yourself up!
tip_title_1276	{[0107|00000100]}Snake: \x0f\x01\x07Covering Fire (Final Smash)
tip_text_1276	Snake's Final Smash allows him to lock on to opponents and shoot\r\nfive missiles at them. The missiles will fire even if you are unable\r\nto lock on.
tip_title_1277	{[0107|00000100]}Snake: \x0f\x01\x07Silent Takedown (Downward Throw)
tip_text_1277	Snake's unique downward throw lays opponents flat on the ground.\r\nIf the opponent has high damage, this can be a great setup for a KO.\r\n
tip_title_1278	{[0107|00000100]}Snake: \x0f\x01\x07Cardboard Box
tip_text_1278	Snake's taunt involves him hiding in his beloved cardboard box. When\r\nan opponent gets near and picks up the cardboard box...well...you'll\r\njust have to see for yourself.
tip_title_1279	{[0107|00000100]}Snake: \x0f\x01\x07Attack with the Cardboard Box
tip_text_1279	The cardboard box you use during your taunt can also be used to\r\ndeal damage to opponents when cast off. The box falls off of Snake's\r\nback, so be mindful of the direction you use it.
tip_title_1280	Squirtle's Origins
tip_text_1280	Squirtle debuted in Pokémon Red and Blue, released in North America\r\nin 1998. It's a Tiny Turtle Pokémon that excels at Water-type moves.\r\n
tip_title_1281	Squirtle: In Its Series
tip_text_1281	Squirtle is one of three Pokémon you can get from Professor Oak\r\nin Pokémon Red and Blue. Squirtle was one of the few Water-type\r\nPokémon you could get until you got a Fishing Rod.
tip_title_1282	Squirtle: Water Gun (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1282	Squirtle shoots water from its mouth to push opponents away. It\r\ndoesn't do any damage, but it's great for interfering with opponents\r\ntrying to return to the stage.
tip_title_1283	Squirtle: Withdraw (Side Special)
tip_text_1283	Spin across the ground quickly to tackle opponents. Squirtle won't\r\ntake damage while it is in its shell.\r\n
tip_title_1284	Squirtle: Advancing with Withdraw (Side Special)
tip_text_1284	Tilt the control stick in the opposite direction of the movement to\r\nshorten the distance you slide. If you hit an opponent or their shield,\r\nyou will be reflected.
tip_title_1285	Squirtle: Withdraw's Weakness (Side Special)
tip_text_1285	If Squirtle gets stepped on from above, it will flip over and become\r\ncompletely vulnerable. Squirtle can't move until it gets back up,\r\nleaving you wide open to attack.
tip_title_1286	Squirtle: Waterfall (Up Special)
tip_text_1286	Tilt the control stick forward or backward while rising up to slightly\r\nchange the angle you rise. It can be used as a recovery move, but\r\nit can also be used to attack opponents above.
tip_title_1287	Dark Samus's Origins
tip_text_1287	Dark Samus made her debut in 2002 in Metroid Prime. She was born\r\nfrom Metroid Prime cells merged with Samus Aran's DNA. She is\r\nhighly intelligent.
tip_title_1288	{[0107|00000100]}Dark Samus: \x0f\x01\x07In Her Series
tip_text_1288	Dark Samus is a living Phazon entity with the radioactive substance\r\nPhazon as her energy supply. She has a wide range of abilities, like\r\nbeing able to teleport, cloak herself, and attack with an arm cannon.
tip_title_1289	{[0107|00000100]}Dark Samus: \x0f\x01\x07Charge Shot (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1289	Devastating when fully charged, it can be unleashed instantly and\r\nfired repeatedly. You can also charge it in midair.\r\n
tip_title_1290	{[0107|00000100]}Dark Samus: \x0f\x01\x07Missile (Side Special)
tip_text_1290	Holding a direction when you press the special-move button will fire\r\na homing missile, and quickly inputting a direction as you press the\r\nspecial-move button will fire a Super Missile!
tip_title_1291	{[0107|00000100]}Dark Samus: \x0f\x01\x07Screw Attack (Up Special)
tip_text_1291	When recovering with the Screw Attack, you can't grab edges behind\r\nyou until you've finished rising. Make sure to face the right way when\r\nyou use it!
tip_title_1292	{[0107|00000100]}Dark Samus: \x0f\x01\x07Bomb (Down Special)
tip_text_1292	Dark Samus morphs into a ball and drops a bomb. You can use the\r\nexplosion to gain a little height.\r\n
tip_title_1293	{[0107|00000100]}Dark Samus: \x0f\x01\x07Phazon Laser (Final Smash)
tip_text_1293	Unleash an enormous laser beam that goes through the stage.\r\nYou can change the angle of the beam with the control stick.\r\nThe beam will repeatedly hit opponents caught in its blast.
tip_title_1294	Daisy's Origins
tip_text_1294	Daisy debuted in Super Mario Land released in 1989. Mario saved\r\nher from a space alien named Tatanga, and the two escaped\r\nriding the Sky Pop.
tip_title_1295	{[0107|00000100]}Daisy: \x0f\x01\x07In Her Series
tip_text_1295	Sarasaland's Princess. She's more down-to-earth and energetic than\r\nPeach. She gives it her all at sporting events and parties, but tries\r\nto keep the mood friendly.
tip_title_1296	{[0107|00000100]}Daisy: \x0f\x01\x07Toad (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1296	A Toad will risk its life to protect Daisy. If an attack hits the Toad, it will\r\nunleash a counter and launch opponents in front of Daisy.\r\n
tip_title_1297	{[0107|00000100]}Daisy: \x0f\x01\x07Daisy Bomber (Side Special)
tip_text_1297	Attack an opponent with a powerful hip bash. You can use it as many\r\ntimes as you want in the air, so it's helpful for returning to the stage.\r\n
tip_title_1298	{[0107|00000100]}Daisy: \x0f\x01\x07Daisy Parasol (Up Special)
tip_text_1298	Jump up, open the parasol, and slowly float down. It's great to use\r\nfor returning to the stage, but the parasol can hit opponents too,\r\nso you can use it for attacks.
tip_title_1299	{[0107|00000100]}Daisy: \x0f\x01\x07Vegetable (Down Special)
tip_text_1299	Of the eight types, the vegetable with the wrinkly face is the\r\nstrongest. If you throw it while tapping the control stick in a\r\ndirection, it can do over 30% damage!
tip_title_1300	{[0107|00000100]}Daisy: \x0f\x01\x07Daisy Blossom (Final Smash)
tip_text_1300	Daisy's Final Smash puts opponents to sleep with a hypnotic dance.\r\nPick up the daisies that appear to recover some health.\r\n
tip_title_1301	Pichu's Origins
tip_text_1301	Pichu debuted in Pokémon Gold and Silver, released in North America\r\nin 2000. If you leave two Pikachu or two Raichu of the opposite sex\r\nat the Daycare, Pichu can hatch from the Egg that is found.
tip_title_1302	{[0107|00000100]}Pichu: \x0f\x01\x07In Its Series
tip_text_1302	Pichu isn't a professional at charging electricity like Pikachu. The\r\nslightest touch can make Pichu discharge its electricity and\r\nshock itself.
tip_title_1303	{[0107|00000100]}Pichu: \x0f\x01\x07Thunder Jolt (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1303	Pichu's Thunder Jolt is smaller, faster, and stronger than Pikachu's,\r\nbut it also does damage to Pichu.\r\n
tip_title_1304	{[0107|00000100]}Pichu: \x0f\x01\x07Skull Bash (Side Special)
tip_text_1304	It takes a while to charge up to the max, but the power unleashed at\r\nmax is incredibly powerful. This comes at a risk of self-destructing\r\nfrom the force.
tip_title_1305	{[0107|00000100]}Pichu: \x0f\x01\x07Agility (Up Special)
tip_text_1305	Pichu's up special travels farther than Pikachu's, but it causes Pichu\r\nto take damage, and it doesn't deal damage to opponents on contact.\r\n
tip_title_1306	{[0107|00000100]}Pichu: \x0f\x01\x07Thunder (Down Special)
tip_text_1306	A lightning strike from above that unleashes a bolt of electricity.\r\nIf the bolt hits Pichu, Pichu will take damage.\r\n
tip_title_1307	{[0107|00000100]}Pichu: \x0f\x01\x07Volt Tackle (Final Smash)
tip_text_1307	Become an electric ball and bounce around the screen. It does more\r\ndamage and has more launch power than Pikachu's Final Smash,\r\nbut it also does a lot of damage to Pichu.
tip_title_1308	{[0107|00000100]}Pichu: \x0f\x01\x07Damage from Electricity
tip_text_1308	Any move where Pichu is engulfed in electricity will deal damage\r\nto Pichu. However, Pichu's moves also have significant power and\r\nare great for launching opponents.
tip_title_1309	Ivysaur's Origins
tip_text_1309	Ivysaur debuted in Pokémon Red and Blue, released in North America\r\nin 1998. Due to the favorable matchups, Ivysaur was very useful\r\nagainst Rock-type and Water-type opponents in beginning Gyms.
tip_title_1310	Ivysaur: In Its Series
tip_text_1310	Ivysaur is the evolved form of Bulbasaur, one of the three Pokémon\r\nyou can choose in the beginning. Compared to the other two\r\nPokémon, you can reach the third form, Venusaur, quickest.
tip_title_1311	Ivysaur: Bullet Seed (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1311	Ivysaur's Bullet Seed move not only shoots seeds, but if an opponent\r\ntouches its body while it's using the move, that opponent can\r\nget launched!
tip_title_1312	Ivysaur: Bullet Seed Firing Time (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1312	Holding the special-move button will make Bullet Seed last longer.\r\nYou'll be open to attack from the side, but if it hits, it deals a lot\r\nof damage.
tip_title_1313	Ivysaur: Razor Leaf (Side Special)
tip_text_1313	Quickly flick the control stick to the side as you press the button\r\nto shoot leaves farther. The trajectory of the leaves is random.\r\nThey may fly diagonally instead of straight to the side.
tip_title_1314	Ivysaur: Vine Whip (Up Special)
tip_text_1314	Vine Whip can be used as many times as you want in midair and the\r\ndirection it shoots out can be changed slightly. It can be used to\r\ngrab the edge when falling off the stage. 
tip_title_1316	Ivysaur: Exploding Flower (Up Smash)
tip_text_1316	It has very high launch power, but the move is slow to activate. Use\r\nthis move a bit early and try to predict where the opponent will land\r\nor where they will go after dodging.
tip_title_1317	Ivysaur: Pollen from Bloom
tip_text_1317	Ivysaur's up smash, up air, and down air attacks all release pollen\r\nfrom the bud on its back. These moves excel at launching opponents.\r\n
tip_title_1318	Pokémon Trainer
tip_text_1318	The Pokémon Trainer stands in the background and instructs Squirtle,\r\nIvysaur, and Charizard. You can play as a female Pokémon Trainer by\r\nchanging Pokémon Trainer's costume when choosing your fighter.
tip_title_1319	Pokémon Trainer: Mannerisms
tip_text_1319	Pokémon Trainer will react when taunting or when a Pokémon takes\r\ndamage. The girl and boy Pokémon Trainer have different reactions.\r\n
tip_title_1320	Pokémon Trainer: Pokémon Change (Down Special)
tip_text_1320	You can cycle through Pokémon from Squirtle → Ivysaur → Charizard. \r\nYou can switch them as many times as you like, so choose your \r\nfavorite Pokémon and get to Smashin'!
tip_title_1321	Squirtle: Triple Finish (Final Smash)
tip_text_1321	The three Pokémon combine their powers for this Final Smash.\r\nSquirtle's Hydro Pump is wide, covering the top and the bottom,\r\nand can draw in opponents.
tip_title_1322	Ivysaur: Triple Finish (Final Smash)
tip_text_1322	The three Pokémon combine their powers for this Final Smash.\r\nIvysaur's Solar Beam has a long range and traps opponents\r\nhit by the attack.
tip_title_1324	Pokémon Trainer: Triple Finish (Final Smash)
tip_text_1324	The three Pokémon combine their powers for this Final Smash.\r\nThe effect of the attack is the same for all three Pokémon.\r\n
tip_title_1325	Ridley's Origins
tip_text_1325	Ridley debuted in Metroid, released in North America in 1987. Ridley\r\nappeared as the boss in the depths of Norfair. He only attacked with\r\na bouncing fireball, but he was still a fierce foe.
tip_title_1326	{[0107|00000100]}Ridley: \x0f\x01\x07In His Series
tip_text_1326	Ridley has taken many different forms as Samus's archnemesis.\r\nYou can check out Ridley's transformation over time in \r\nMetroid: Other M.
tip_title_1327	{[0107|00000100]}Ridley: \x0f\x01\x07Plasma Breath (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1327	Charge up energy and spit out balls of plasma. The longer you\r\ncharge, the more plasma balls you'll spit. However, if you get hit\r\nin the mouth while charging, you'll take a lot of damage.
tip_title_1328	{[0107|00000100]}Ridley: \x0f\x01\x07Space Pirate Rush (Side Special)
tip_text_1328	Rush forward and grab an opponent, then drag them across the\r\nground while moving forward. Press the button while charging\r\nforward or reach the edge of the platform to toss the opponent.
tip_title_1329	{[0107|00000100]}Ridley: \x0f\x01\x07Airborne Space Pirate Rush (Side Special)
tip_text_1329	If performed in the air, Ridley lunges forward and grabs an airborne\r\nopponent before diving downward with them still in his clutches.\r\nPress the button again to release the opponent.
tip_title_1330	{[0107|00000100]}Ridley: \x0f\x01\x07Escaping from Space Pirate Rush (Side Special)
tip_text_1330	The opponent can move their control stick back and forth to escape\r\nfrom the move. The more damage the opponent has compared to\r\nRidley, the harder it is to escape.
tip_title_1331	{[0107|00000100]}Ridley: \x0f\x01\x07Wing Blitz (Up Special)
tip_text_1331	Tilt the control stick up, down, left, or right to charge in that\r\ndirection. When charging downward, Ridley can unleash a\r\nkick with a meteor effect.
tip_title_1332	{[0107|00000100]}Ridley: \x0f\x01\x07Skewer (Down Special)
tip_text_1332	Hit an opponent with the tip of the tail to land a critical hit that deals\r\nimmense damage. It's easier to use when fighters are clustered\r\ntogether. It's super effective in stamina mode.
tip_title_1333	{[0107|00000100]}Ridley: \x0f\x01\x07Plasma Scream (Final Smash)
tip_text_1333	Throw opponents against Samus's Gunship and fire a plasma beam.\r\nYou can hit up to two fighters with this move. When it's finished,\r\nopponents with more than 100% damage will explode on the spot.

tip_text_1334	Richter debuted in Castlevania: Rondo of Blood in 1993. He heads\r\nto the castle to defeat Count Dracula and rescue his kidnapped\r\ngirlfriend, Annette.

tip_text_1336	A projectile that curves through the air when thrown. You can adjust\r\nthe angle of the throw by moving the stick left or right. It can pass\r\nthrough the stage, hitting unsuspecting opponents!
tip_title_1337	{[0107|00000100]}Richter: \x0f\x01\x07Cross (Side Special)
tip_text_1337	You can increase the distance and power by quickly flicking the\r\ncontrol stick as you press the special-move button. It can hit\r\nwhile flying out and back, but it's more powerful when flying out.
tip_title_1338	{[0107|00000100]}Richter: \x0f\x01\x07Uppercut (Up Special)
tip_text_1338	A jumping punch that can hit repeatedly. The final hit has the most\r\nlaunch power.\r\n
tip_title_1339	{[0107|00000100]}Richter: \x0f\x01\x07Holy Water (Down Special)
tip_text_1339	Throw a bottle of Holy Water forward. If it hits an opponent or\r\nthe landscape, a blue flaming pillar will appear, stopping the\r\nopponent's movements. Try following up with a whip attack!
tip_title_1340	{[0107|00000100]}Richter: \x0f\x01\x07Grand Cross (Final Smash)
tip_text_1340	Summon a coffin that traps opponents who touch it. Using this\r\non an opponent who is trapped in your Holy Water's fire or an\r\nopponent who's fallen down is a good strategy.

tip_text_1341	Unleash a wave of fire that damages and pushes opponents. Hit\r\nopponents when they are close to deal big damage. It's perfect\r\nfor stopping opponents from returning to the stage.

tip_text_1353	Four of Donkey Kong's moves have a meteor effect—his forward\r\nair attack, down air attack, midair side special, and the second\r\nhit of his midair down special.

tip_text_1354	Headbutt grants super armor at the beginning of the move, allowing\r\nyou to fight through incoming attacks. It's also useful when returning\r\nto the stage, landing, and against opponents waiting for you to land.
tip_title_1355	{[0107|00000100]}Donkey Kong: \x0f\x01\x07Comboing with Kong Karry (Forward Throw)
tip_text_1355	You'll toss opponents diagonally upward when throwing forward,\r\ntoss them high when throwing backward, and launch them low when\r\ntossed down. Throwing them up is a great start to a combo.

tip_text_1356	Hit an opponent that doesn't have much damage to make them fall\r\nover. Follow up with a dash attack or dash grab!\r\n

tip_text_1357	When the move is activated, things that push fighters (like water)\r\nwill have no effect on Donkey Kong. When used on the ground,\r\nyou'll get super armor at the beginning of the move.

tip_text_1358	Link shoots a powerful, blue glowing arrow that explodes on contact\r\nand launches opponents. The arrow will still explode if it hits a wall\r\nor the ground, and it can hit multiple opponents.

tip_text_1359	Link is the main protagonist of the series The Legend of Zelda. He has\r\npointy ears and wields a sword and shield. In the Zelda games, Link\r\nuses items like bombs and arrows to defeat enemies and solve puzzles.
tip_title_1360	{[0107|00000100]}Link: \x0f\x01\x07Clothing "of the Wild"

tip_text_1361	The power and distance of the arrow increases as it's charged.\r\nArrows can stick in the ground or walls, and if you pick one up and\r\nuse this move again, you can fire off two arrows at once.
tip_title_1362	{[0107|00000100]}Link: \x0f\x01\x07Sword Slice (Side Smash Attack)
tip_text_1362	If Link's damage is at 0% or he has full stamina in a stamina battle,\r\nhe can shoot a sword beam by using his side smash attack.\r\n
tip_title_1363	{[0107|00000100]}Link: \x0f\x01\x07Remote Bomb Recovery (Down Special)
tip_text_1363	If you are launched off the stage, you can use the Remote Bomb\r\nto blast yourself back toward the stage. It's very hard to pull off,\r\nbut it might work as a last resort!
tip_title_1364	{[0107|00000100]}Link: \x0f\x01\x07Remote Bomb's Traits (Down Special)
tip_text_1364	You can detonate whenever you want, but keep in mind that Link will\r\nbe damaged by the explosion too. The bomb will explode after a\r\ncertain period or when hit with a fire attack.
tip_title_1365	{[0107|00000100]}Link: \x0f\x01\x07Boomerang (Side Special)
tip_text_1365	The Boomerang is the strongest the moment it's thrown. Flick the\r\ncontrol stick quickly when you press the button to increase distance\r\nand power. If you don't catch the returning Boomerang, it will fly off.

tip_text_1366	Before the laser fires, it'll pull in nearby fighters a little bit. While the\r\nlaser is firing, you can change the firing angle by tilting the control\r\nstick up or down.

tip_title_1372	{[0107|00000100]}Yoshi: \x0f\x01\x07Egg Shield
tip_text_1372	Unlike other fighters, Yoshi's shield is an all-protecting egg. Even if the\r\nshield blocks attacks, it won't get smaller and Yoshi's body won't\r\npoke out from the shield.

tip_title_1375	{[0107|00000100]}Kirby: \x0f\x01\x07In His Series
tip_text_1375	Kirby is a big eater who inhales any and everything. If he inhales an\r\nenemy, he can copy and use one of their abilities. He's also good at\r\nhovering by flapping his arms and puffing up like a balloon.
tip_title_1376	{[0107|00000100]}Kirby: \x0f\x01\x07Squish Kick (Down Tilt Attack)
tip_text_1376	This attack can sometimes cause an opponent to take a tumble.\r\nWatch your opponent carefully. If they start to fall over, follow\r\nup with a grab or smash attack.
tip_title_1377	{[0107|00000100]}Kirby: \x0f\x01\x07Burning (Dash Attack)
tip_text_1377	Kirby twists through the air like a flaming screw as he charges into\r\nan opponent. He's not a reckless fellow, so he'll automatically stop\r\nat edges instead of going over them.
tip_title_1378	{[0107|00000100]}Kirby: \x0f\x01\x07Inhale's Projectiles (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1378	After Kirby inhales a fighter, he'll spit them out as a star-shaped\r\nprojectile. The heavier the fighter, the more attack power\r\nthe projectile will have.
tip_title_1379	{[0107|00000100]}Kirby: \x0f\x01\x07Copying Another Kirby
tip_text_1379	If Kirby inhales another Kirby that doesn't have a Copy Ability, nothing\r\nwill happen. However, if Kirby inhales another Kirby that does have a\r\nCopy Ability, Kirby can steal the inhaled Kirby's ability.
tip_title_1380	{[0107|00000100]}Fox: \x0f\x01\x07Team Star Fox (Final Smash)
tip_text_1380	The full force of Team Star Fox engages the targeted opponents.\r\nIf Wolf is one of the opponents, Fox will deliver a special line.\r\n
tip_title_1381	{[0107|00000100]}Fox: \x0f\x01\x07In His Series

tip_title_1382	{[0107|00000100]}Fox: \x0f\x01\x07Launching with Reflector (Down Special)
tip_text_1382	A direct hit from Reflector will launch opponents at a low angle. You\r\ncan use this to disrupt an opponent trying to make their way back\r\nto the stage.
tip_title_1383	{[0107|00000100]}Fox: \x0f\x01\x07Using Fox Illusion Effectively (Side Special)
tip_text_1383	A shielded opponent will stop Fox in his tracks, leaving him open\r\nto counterattack. Try to use this move when your opponent\r\ncan't anticipate it.
tip_title_1384	{[0107|00000100]}Fox: \x0f\x01\x07McCloud Flip (Up Air)
tip_text_1384	A two-part attack where Fox kicks and swats opponents with his tail.\r\nIt's great for doing damage and launching opponents.\r\n

tip_text_1475	This game character is older than Mario, coming from a series\r\nof handheld Nintendo games with LCD screens. Within the\r\nGame & Watch games, he took on various shapes and roles.

tip_text_1476	This move can reflect items and physical projectiles that can't be\r\nabsorbed. If something comes flying at you, give it a try!\r\n
tip_title_1477	{[0107|00000100]}Mr. Game & Watch: \x0f\x01\x07Spitball Sparky (Up Air Attack)
tip_text_1477	Release a puff of air right above you to push opponents. You can\r\neven try to KO an opponent with this if you can hit them from a\r\nhigh position onstage.
tip_title_1478	{[0107|00000100]}Mr. Game & Watch: \x0f\x01\x07Judge (Side Special)
tip_text_1478	Three apples appear if the number seven shows up. You can eat\r\nthese to heal up, but if you're not careful, an opponent might\r\nsnap them up.
tip_title_1479	{[0107|00000100]}Mr. Game & Watch: \x0f\x01\x07Octopus and Obstacles (Final Smash)
tip_text_1479	An opponent caught in the giant octopus's tentacles will be dragged\r\noff-screen. If it seems like they might escape, you could purposefully\r\nhit a floor or wall to flick them away.
tip_title_1480	{[0107|00000100]}Mr. Game & Watch: \x0f\x01\x07Octopus Tentacles (Final Smash)
tip_text_1480	You can extend the giant octopus tentacles farther by pressing the\r\nspecial-move button. They'll extend and retract even if you don't\r\ndo anything, but pressing the button speeds up the movement.
tip_title_1481	{[0107|00000100]}Mr. Game & Watch: \x0f\x01\x07Move Names
tip_text_1481	Mr. Game & Watch's moves Chef, Judge, Fire, Oil Panic, and Octopus\r\nare all named after games released in the Game & Watch series.\r\n

tip_text_1482	Lightning strikes and catches nearby opponents for a multi-hit attack.\r\nIt wraps up with a side slice that sends opponents flying.\r\n

tip_text_1483	Meta Knight first appeared in Kirby's Adventure. He leads the\r\nMeta-Knights. He wears a mask, but when he loses to Kirby,\r\nyou can see a glimpse of his true face when his mask cracks.

tip_text_1492	A two-part kick that sends an opponent into the air. It'll send them\r\nup even if they haven't taken a lot of damage, so try to follow up\r\nwith another attack afterward.

tip_text_1570	When Luma has only a little bit of health it will look down and act\r\ntired. In this state, Luma will travel back slower to Rosalina when\r\nshe uses a neutral special.

tip_text_1571	Rosalina and Luma's down special draws in items so Rosalina can\r\npick them up. It can be used to nullify a number of projectiles, but it's\r\nespecially useful for gaining ownership of items thrown at you.

tip_text_1572	It's harder to launch Luma when it's sent out with Luma Shot than it is\r\nwhen Luma is near Rosalina. Try sending Luma away occasionally.\r\n

tip_text_1573	Luma sent out with Luma Shot will automatically face a nearby\r\nopponent and attack them when using moves such as neutral attack.\r\n

tip_text_1574	If Luma is KO'd, the time it takes for Luma to regenerate depends\r\non how many opponents are in the match. It takes longer when\r\nit's 1 vs. 1, and shorter when it's a four-player battle.

tip_text_1651	Some assist trophies can be KO'd. If you KO one, it will count\r\ntoward your KO score.\r\n

tip_text_1652	If an assist trophy is emitting an aura, they can be easily KO'd!\r\nIn this state, the owner of the assist trophy can also KO them.\r\n

tip_title_1655	{[0107|00000100]}Assist Trophy: \x0f\x01\x07Black Knight
tip_text_1655	A knight in black armor. The Black Knight will slowly walk toward\r\nopponents and attack them. He can only be launched by very\r\npowerful attacks.
tip_title_1656	{[0107|00000100]}Assist Trophy: \x0f\x01\x07Rodin
tip_text_1656	Rodin can summon a giant arm that unleashes a devastating blow.\r\nHe'll sometimes give you a powerful weapon when he leaves.\r\n
tip_title_1657	{[0107|00000100]}Assist Trophy: \x0f\x01\x07Kapp'n
tip_text_1657	Even if you are forced to board the bus, you can wiggle the control\r\nstick to get out. However, Kapp'n will reappear multiple times.\r\n
tip_title_1658	{[0107|00000100]}Assist Trophy: \x0f\x01\x07Spring Man
tip_text_1658	Spring Man unleashes punches from his springy arms while jumping\r\nand dashing around the stage. When he's in a pinch, he'll unleash a\r\npowerful rush attack.
tip_title_1659	{[0107|00000100]}Assist Trophy: \x0f\x01\x07Prince of Sablé
tip_text_1659	The Prince of Sablé changes into a frog or snake and attacks\r\nopponents. When he transforms back into a prince, he\r\ncan be KO'd.
tip_title_1660	{[0107|00000100]}Pokémon: \x0f\x01\x07Ditto
tip_text_1660	Ditto transforms into the fighter who used the Poké Ball, copying\r\ntheir special moves to fight as much like them as it can. Ditto\r\ncan be KO'd after it transforms, though...
tip_title_1661	{[0107|00000100]}Pokémon: \x0f\x01\x07Mimikyu
tip_text_1661	Mimikyu drags a nearby opponent into its body and attacks them.\r\nWhile inside Mimikyu, the opponent cannot move. If the opponent has\r\nmore than 90% damage after the attack, they will be instantly KO'd.
tip_title_1662	{[0107|00000100]}Pokémon: \x0f\x01\x07Pyukumuku
tip_text_1662	If a fighter steps on Pyukumuku, it will unleash a punch with a\r\nlaunching effect. It will do this every time it's stepped on. You\r\ncan pick it up too, so throw it at opponents!
tip_title_1663	{[0107|00000100]}Pokémon: \x0f\x01\x07Abra
tip_text_1663	Abra teleports opponents to areas that don't have platforms below\r\nthem. Depending on how Abra is feeling, it may teleport repeatedly\r\nand change the place it drops the opponent.
tip_title_1664	{[0107|00000100]}Pokémon: \x0f\x01\x07Marshadow
tip_text_1664	If you're targeted, Marshadow will emerge from the shadows\r\nto deal a powerful punch. When there are multiple opponents,\r\nit may change its target between punches.
tip_title_1665	Killing Edge
tip_text_1665	When the blade is glowing, it deals critical hits with high power.\r\nIt will glow about every three seconds, so time your attacks well.\r\n
tip_title_1666	Staff
tip_text_1666	The power of this item increases the farther you are from your target.\r\nAt maximum power, a dramatic zoom effect will occur.\r\n
tip_title_1667	Bomber
tip_text_1667	The power of the Bomber decreases the farther you are from the\r\ncenter. Even if it’s just about to go off, you’re better off trying to\r\nget as far away as possible.
tip_title_1668	Fake Smash Ball
tip_text_1668	This item looks dangerously similar to a Smash Ball, but it explodes\r\nwhen broken. If you look closely, you'll notice that vertical and\r\nhorizontal lines are switched.
tip_title_1669	Super Launch Star
tip_text_1669	The Super Launch Star launches fighters in the direction the star was\r\nthrown from. If you jump off the side and toss it toward the stage,\r\nyou can use it to interfere with people trying to recover from offstage.
tip_title_1670	Black Hole
tip_text_1670	The Black Hole pulls items and fighters to its center. You can escape\r\nits pull if you use a move that causes you to move quickly.\r\n
tip_title_1671	Rage Blaster
tip_text_1671	The Rage Blaster becomes more powerful the more damage you’ve\r\ntaken. Once the muzzle opens and the aura blast is let loose,\r\nopponents better watch themselves!
tip_title_1672	Death's Scythe
tip_text_1672	You can KO opponents with high damage by hitting them with the tip\r\nof the scythe. If you use a smash attack from the correct distance, a\r\nblack aura will surround your opponent, signaling an instant KO.
tip_title_1673	Healing Sprout
tip_text_1673	Just holding this will slowly heal you. Be careful though, because\r\nopponents can take it from you if they throw you or attack you.\r\n
tip_title_1674	Healing Field
tip_text_1674	Set this on a floor, ceiling, or wall, and it will heal anyone who stands\r\nin it. It heals less if you are shielding. Due to the effect's size, more\r\nthan one fighter can benefit at a time.
tip_title_1675	Beastball
tip_text_1675	If you hit a target before the ball disappears, it’ll suddenly change\r\npositions and fly toward the target. If it lands a direct hit, it’ll hit\r\nmultiple times after appearing again!
tip_title_1676	Food
tip_text_1676	You can eat food even when you're lying on the ground. It's not\r\nconsidered the best table manners, but at least it'll heal you.\r\n
tip_title_1677	Timer
tip_text_1677	Collect this to make opponents move slowly. Every once in a while,\r\nit’ll make everyone move slowly, including you!\r\n
tip_title_1678	Lightning
tip_text_1678	Touch this to shrink your opponents. But every once in a while,\r\nit’ll shrink you instead while making your opponents bigger!\r\n
tip_title_1679	Warp Star
tip_text_1679	While ascending, you can adjust the speed that you'll later descend.\r\nPress the attack button or tilt the control stick down to go faster.\r\nPress the shield button or tilt the control stick up to go slower.
tip_title_1680	Ray Gun
tip_text_1680	The Ray Gun fires semi-automatic blasts of energy. The shape of\r\nthe barrel is a reversed Smash Bros. symbol. The idea is that you\r\ncan burn the symbol into your opponents.
tip_title_1681	Gooey Bomb
tip_text_1681	The Gooey Bomb sticks to fighters. If the fighter it's stuck to passes\r\nanother fighter, it'll rub off and stick to them instead.\r\n
tip_title_1682	Smart Bomb
tip_text_1682	Once thrown, it'll fly a short distance, exploding when it hits terrain.\r\nOccasionally, it'll misfire and explode a bit later.\r\n
tip_title_1683	Deku Nut
tip_text_1683	Hit an opponent with this item to stun them. If it hits an opponent\r\nthat's taken a lot of damage, it'll launch them instead\r\nof stunning them.
tip_title_1684	Pitfall
tip_text_1684	If a Pitfall hits a fighter on the ground, it will bury the fighter in\r\nthe ground. If it hits a fighter in the air or on a platform, they'll\r\nbe launched straight down.
tip_title_1685	Mr. Saturn
tip_text_1685	This item only does a little damage when thrown. However, if it hits\r\nan opponent who's shielding, it'll instantly break their shield.\r\n
tip_title_1686	Green Shell
tip_text_1686	Throwing this isn't your only option. You can also send it flying\r\nby attacking it or stomping on it. Sometimes it won't pass through\r\nopponents though, instead bouncing back in the other direction.
tip_title_1687	Bumper
tip_text_1687	After throwing this item, it'll fly a short distance and then position\r\nitself in the air or on the ground. If you place it on the edge of a\r\nstage, it does a great job of getting in the way of fighters' recovery.
tip_title_1688	Back Shield
tip_text_1688	The Back Shield protects you from attacks from behind. It will block\r\nattacks from battering items and projectiles, but it won't protect\r\nagainst throws. Its durability decreases each time it blocks an attack.
tip_title_1689	Smash: Radar
tip_text_1689	When fighters go off-screen, a radar map will appear in the upper\r\ncorner of the screen. This allows you to easily spot opponents who\r\nare hiding off of the screen.
tip_title_1690	Rule Settings: Stage Morph
tip_text_1690	During battle, the stage will suddenly morph into another one!\r\nYou can find the Stage Morph option under Advanced\r\nin Rule Settings.
tip_title_1692	Classic Mode: Rewards
tip_text_1692	The higher the intensity, the stronger the opponents...and the better\r\nthe rewards for winning!\r\n
tip_title_1693	Classic Mode: Nice Play!
tip_text_1693	If you win a battle fairly quickly without taking much damage, you'll\r\nreceive a "Nice Play!" compliment. This will cause the intensity\r\nto greatly increase.
tip_title_1694	Classic Mode: Classic Ticket
tip_text_1694	Classic Tickets are very rare and extremely useful! They can increase\r\nyour rewards or allow you to continue in Classic Mode without\r\nspending gold!
tip_title_1695	Classic Mode: The Mural
tip_text_1695	A mural representing the intensity. The farther right you go, the more\r\nintense the battles will be...\r\n
tip_title_1696	Classic Mode: Did You Lose? No Problem!
tip_text_1696	Losing in Classic Mode isn't the end of the world. You can jump back\r\ninto the action by spending gold or a Classic Ticket.\r\n
tip_title_1697	Classic Mode: Challengers
tip_text_1697	When you get to the end of your route, an intimidating challenger will\r\nappear! The challenger changes depending on the route.\r\n
tip_title_1698	amiibo: FP - Figure Player
tip_text_1698	A fighter will appear when you use an amiibo. This fighter is called a\r\nFigure Player or "FP" for short.\r\n
tip_title_1699	amiibo: Initial State
tip_text_1699	New Figure Players have low attack power and defense. However,\r\nthey can become stronger than your average fighter by raising\r\ntheir level.
tip_title_1700	amiibo: Learning during Battle
tip_text_1700	Figure Players can learn as they watch how their opponents move.\r\nIf you want your FP to stay as they are, you can set “Learn” to off.\r\n
tip_title_1701	amiibo: Learning from Defeat
tip_text_1701	Figure Players earn more experience from losing a battle than from\r\nwinning. Have them keep fighting, and they’ll keep growing stronger.\r\n
tip_title_1703	amiibo: Inheriting from Spirits
tip_text_1703	Figure Players can learn skills from support spirits. When gaining\r\npower from primary spirits, FPs not only grow stronger—they'll\r\nalso inherit the spirit's type.
tip_title_1704	Training: Special Training Stage
tip_text_1704	This stage was designed for battle practice. The right side of the\r\nstage is flat, while the left side has the same shape as the\r\nBattlefield stage.
tip_title_1705	Training: Launch Prediction Lines
tip_text_1705	Lines appear when you strike your opponent in Training. These lines\r\nshow how far that fighter would be launched if their damage was\r\nat 0%, 50%, or 100%.
tip_title_1706	Mob Smash: Timing for Items
tip_text_1706	Items will appear in Century Smash and All-Star Smash. They’ll\r\nappear faster if you use many different attacks and you move\r\naround a lot.
tip_title_1707	Century Smash
tip_text_1707	A new, powerful opponent will appear after defeating 25 fighters.\r\nIf you get through all 100, the fighter you used to win the battle\r\nwill be marked.
tip_title_1708	All-Star Smash
tip_text_1708	All of the fighters appear one after another to face you. The order\r\nthe fighters appear is based on the Japanese release date of their\r\nsource game.
tip_title_1709	Mii Fighters: Purchase Outfits
tip_text_1709	The Shop contains outfits and headgear for Mii Fighters. However,\r\nthey won't always be available there, so check what's available\r\nfrequently.
tip_title_1710	Mii Fighters: Color Settings
tip_text_1710	The color setting of Mii characters can affect the coloring of some of\r\ntheir Mii Fighters' outfits.\r\n
tip_title_1711	Challenger's Approach
tip_text_1711	Head to Games & More if a challenger defeats you. Go through the\r\ndoor in the lower right to take them on again.\r\n
tip_title_1712	Challenger's Approach: Meeting Challengers
tip_text_1712	New fighters join the fray when you play a lot in Smash mode or\r\nother parts of the game. Defeat them to unlock and play as them.\r\nIt might be easier to meet them if you play with more people...
tip_title_1716	Sounds
tip_text_1716	There are over 800 songs! There's also an option just to play your\r\nfavorite songs.\r\n
tip_title_1717	Sounds: Playback with Screen Off
tip_text_1717	It's possible to turn off the screen but still listen to the music.\r\nThis allows you to carry the Nintendo Switch around and use\r\nit like a music player.
tip_title_1718	My Music
tip_text_1718	You can set the playback ratio for the songs used during battle on a\r\nstage-by-stage basis. Maybe there's one song you feel really suits\r\na specific stage, or maybe you want many different songs to play.
tip_title_1719	My Music: Return to Normal
tip_text_1719	There's a "Reset to Default" button at the bottom of the list. Press this\r\nto reset the usage rates of all the songs.\r\n
tip_title_1720	Challenges
tip_text_1720	The more difficult the panel is, the more likely it is you'll get a rare\r\nitem. The Golden Hammer can be used once to open up an\r\nunfinished panel.
tip_title_1721	Movies
tip_text_1721	In the Movies section, you can rewatch various cutscenes, like those\r\nfrom Adventure. You can also pause the cutscenes to take a closer\r\nlook.
tip_title_1722	Shop
tip_text_1722	The more items you buy, the better the quality of the items will be.\r\nSometimes they have discount sales, so be sure to visit the Shop\r\nfrequently.
tip_title_1723	Menu: Dashboard
tip_text_1723	The thin vertical menu along the right side of the screen is the\r\nDashboard. You can press the ZR Button to bring it up and go to\r\ndifferent modes at any time.
tip_title_1724	Menu: Help
tip_text_1724	Check out the "?" icon in the lower-right corner of the menu screen\r\nto see explanations of how to play, review rules, and learn about\r\nvarious modes.
tip_title_1725	Options: Brightness
tip_text_1725	Go to the options menu to change your screen brightness. You can\r\nhave separate settings for handheld mode and TV mode.\r\n
tip_title_1726	Taunt Messages
tip_text_1726	Use the taunt buttons to broadcast short messages to other players\r\nboth before and after battle. If you don't want to see messages from\r\npeople you aren't friends with, there's a setting for that.
tip_title_1727	Earning Gold
tip_text_1727	You can earn a good amount of gold in Mob Smash. If you want even\r\nmore gold, play Classic Mode with the intensity increased!\r\n
tip_title_1728	What's Global Smash Power?
tip_text_1728	Your Global Smash Power is the number of players you outrank\r\nglobally. As the total number of players increases, the Global\r\nSmash Power limit will increase as well.
tip_title_1729	Boss: Master Hand's Iron Ball
tip_text_1729	You can launch the iron balls with a powerful attack! If you time it\r\nright, you can pick the iron balls up.\r\n
tip_title_1730	Boss: Master Hand's Spikes
tip_text_1730	When spikes grow from the ground while fighting Master Hand, that's\r\na good time to deal a lot of damage! If you can get Master Hand to\r\nhit the spikes, he'll be rendered immobile for a while.
tip_title_1731	Boss: When Crazy Hand Glares at You
tip_text_1731	When Crazy Hand makes eye shapes, you won't be attacked if you\r\naren't seen. Dodge at the right time to avoid the searchlight!\r\n
tip_title_1732	Boss: Crazy Hand's Gravity Balls
tip_text_1732	Crazy Hand's Gravity Balls suck in fighters and launch them down.\r\nBe careful—they'll launch you off of the stage if there's no platform\r\nbeneath you.
tip_title_1734	Boss: Rathalos
tip_text_1734	You can damage Rathalos's tail! Succeed and an item will appear.\r\n\r\n
tip_title_1735	Boss: Ganon, The Demon King
tip_text_1735	His tail is his weak point, and damaging it will make him flinch. Hit\r\nhim in the head while he's flinching to do a lot of damage.\r\n
tip_title_1736	Boss: Marx
tip_text_1736	When you get near him, he'll teleport far away, but he can't teleport\r\nwhile attacking, so get in there and launch a counterattack!\r\n
tip_title_1737	Boss: Marx's Ice Bomb and Cutter
tip_text_1737	Marx's Ice Bombs and Cutter can be eaten or reflected.\r\n\r\n
tip_title_1738	Boss: Galeem & Dharkon's Time Bombs
tip_text_1738	The time bombs explode after a set amount of time. Attacking the\r\ntime bombs before they explode can break them.\r\n
tip_title_1739	{[0107|00000100]}Kongo Falls: \x0f\x01\x07Barrel Cannon
tip_text_1739	Kongo Falls features a barrel cannon you can use to recover from \r\noff the stage. It goes back and forth under the platforms. The rotation\r\nand movement of the barrel stops occasionally, so pay attention.
tip_title_1740	{[0107|00000100]}Kongo Falls: \x0f\x01\x07Floating Objects
tip_text_1740	Sometimes floating objects are carried down the rapids and wash\r\nup on the stage. Not only floating logs and wooden boxes,\r\nbut Klaptraps!
tip_title_1741	{[0107|00000100]}Kongo Falls: \x0f\x01\x07Floating Logs
tip_text_1741	The floating logs being carried by the water sometimes get stuck in\r\nthe waterfall! When that happens, you can use the logs as platforms\r\nfor a short time.
tip_title_1742	{[0107|00000100]}Kongo Falls: \x0f\x01\x07Klaptrap
tip_text_1742	Take care: if you touch a Klaptrap (the red crocodile), you'll take\r\ndamage. Attack them to send them flying into your opponents!\r\n
tip_title_1743	{[0107|00000100]}Kongo Falls: \x0f\x01\x07Klaptrap and Barrel Cannon
tip_text_1743	When a Klaptrap enters the barrel cannon, the cannon can't be used\r\nuntil the Klaptrap is fired out. Try not to get hit by the Klaptrap!\r\n
tip_title_1744	Mushroomy Kingdom
tip_text_1744	This stage is based on World 1-1 from Super Mario Bros. The\r\nplacement of the blocks and pipes is the same as the original\r\ngame, but unlike the original, this stage scrolls automatically.
tip_title_1745	{[0107|00000100]}Mushroomy Kingdom: \x0f\x01\x07Block Types
tip_text_1745	Attack the brick blocks to break them, or attack the ? Blocks to\r\nmake items appear. Also, there's a block hidden where a\r\n1-Up Mushroom was hidden in the original game. Can you find it?
tip_title_1746	{[0107|00000100]}Mushroomy Kingdom: \x0f\x01\x07Pipes and Pole
tip_text_1746	This stage features the familiar pipes and goal pole from the original\r\ngame, but you can't enter the pipes or grab the pole. Sorry.\r\n
tip_title_1747	{[0107|00000100]}Mushroom Kingdom: \x0f\x01\x07Pipes
tip_text_1747	The three pipes located throughout the stage warp to one another.\r\nYou can even enter the pipe at the edge of the cliff.\r\n
tip_title_1748	{[0107|00000100]}Mushroom Kingdom: \x0f\x01\x07Piranha Plant
tip_text_1748	A piranha plant sometimes sticks its head out of the pipe. You'll get\r\nhurt if you touch it, but you can send it flying by attacking it.\r\n
tip_title_1749	{[0107|00000100]}Mushroom Kingdom: \x0f\x01\x07POW Blocks
tip_text_1749	Attack the POW Block that appears on the stage to launch all\r\nfighters on the ground. Once it's been depleted, it will reappear\r\nin one of four places on the stage a short time later.
tip_title_1750	Mushroom Kingdom II
tip_text_1750	The original Super Mario Bros. 2 also appeared in Super Mario All-Stars,\r\nreleased for the SNES. This stage re-creates that game's art style.\r\n
tip_title_1751	{[0107|00000100]}Mushroom Kingdom II: \x0f\x01\x07Birdo
tip_text_1751	Birdo will show up periodically to spit eggs and get in the way. If this\r\nannoys you, you can attack Birdo.\r\n
tip_title_1752	{[0107|00000100]}Mushroom Kingdom II: \x0f\x01\x07Pidgit
tip_text_1752	On this stage, Pidgits float through the air on flying carpets. You can\r\nride on the flying carpet, but don't let the carpet take you off the\r\nscreen!
tip_title_1753	{[0107|00000100]}Mushroom Kingdom II: \x0f\x01\x07Floating Logs
tip_text_1753	The logs that drift down the waterfall can be used as platforms. Just\r\nmake sure that you don't stay on them too long or you'll be\r\nswallowed by the waterfall.
tip_title_1754	{[0107|00000100]}Hanenbow: \x0f\x01\x07The Hanenbows
tip_text_1754	This stage features Hanenbows that jump around the screen. When\r\nthey hit a leaf, they make a sound, bounce off, and change the leaf's\r\ncolor.
tip_title_1755	{[0107|00000100]}Hanenbow: \x0f\x01\x07Leaves
tip_text_1755	The leaves serving as the stage's platforms change directions when\r\nattacked. This also changes the trajectory of the Hanenbows' jumps.\r\n
tip_title_1756	{[0107|00000100]}Hanenbow: \x0f\x01\x07Trees and Flowers
tip_text_1756	The leaves redden when attacked by fighters or jumped on by\r\nHanenbows. If you turn the leaves of the tree on the right side\r\nof the screen red, a white flower will bloom.
tip_title_1757	{[0107|00000100]}Hanenbow: \x0f\x01\x07Water
tip_text_1757	You cannot swim in the water at the bottom of the screen, but the\r\nedge of the large leaf at the bottom can be grabbed, so make use\r\nof it.
tip_title_1758	Hanenbow
tip_text_1758	A stage based on Electroplankton for the Nintendo DS. The\r\nHanenbows that jump from the water's surface change\r\nthe leaves' colors and make a distinct sound.
tip_title_1759	{[0107|00000100]}Green Greens: \x0f\x01\x07Whispy Woods
tip_text_1759	Whispy Woods blows wind right and left to interfere with the fighters.\r\nYou can eat the apples that fall from the tree to recover damage,\r\nor throw the apples at other fighters.
tip_title_1760	Green Greens
tip_text_1760	A stage based on Green Greens from Kirby's Dream Land. The tree in\r\nthe center (Whispy Woods) was the boss of Stage 1. He cried when\r\nhe was defeated.
tip_title_1761	Great Bay
tip_text_1761	A stage based on Great Bay from The Legend of Zelda: Majora's Mask.\r\nAs time passes, the Moon floating in the sky inches ever closer to\r\nthe ground.
tip_title_1762	{[0107|00000100]}Great Bay: \x0f\x01\x07Tingle
tip_text_1762	You can ride and grab the balloon attached to Tingle's back. If you\r\nstay on the balloon, it'll fall slowly until it pops. Attacks can also\r\nbreak it.
tip_title_1763	{[0107|00000100]}Great Bay: \x0f\x01\x07Turtle
tip_text_1763	You can fight on the back of the turtle that emerges from the water\r\nwith a great splash. He dives back under the water after a set\r\namount of time.
tip_title_1764	{[0107|00000100]}Great Bay: \x0f\x01\x07Platforms
tip_text_1764	You can't drop through the Marine Research Lab platform or the\r\nplatforms floating on the water. The stone platform floating on\r\nthe left side tilts depending on weight distribution.
tip_title_1765	{[0107|00000100]}Great Bay: \x0f\x01\x07Moon
tip_text_1765	In the background, the Moon falls slowly as time passes. You can see\r\nthe Four Giants rally to stop it right before it hits the surface.\r\n
tip_title_1766	Shadow Moses Island
tip_text_1766	This stage is based on Shadow Moses Island from Metal Gear Solid.\r\nIf you're spotted by the searchlight sweeping the stage, an "!" will\r\nappear and an alarm will sound.
tip_title_1767	{[0107|00000100]}Shadow Moses Island: \x0f\x01\x07Watchtowers
tip_text_1767	Watchtowers stand tall on both sides of the stage. Break the\r\nwatchtowers to open up new areas.\r\n
tip_title_1768	{[0107|00000100]}Shadow Moses Island: \x0f\x01\x07Codec
tip_text_1768	While playing as Snake on this stage, it's possible to open codec\r\ncommunications by inputting a down taunt quickly. When you do,\r\nSnake's support team will share advice about a current enemy.
tip_title_1769	{[0107|00000100]}Shadow Moses Island: \x0f\x01\x07Smash Taunt
tip_text_1769	On this stage, Snake has smash taunts that open codec communications\r\nwith Colonel Campbell, Otacon, and Mei Ling. These conversations\r\nmay reveal a side to these characters you don't normally see...
tip_title_1770	Final Destination
tip_text_1770	When you start a battle with five or more fighters, the length of\r\nFinal Destination's platform will increase by 1.5 times. The same\r\nis true of each stage's Omega form.
tip_title_1771	Super Happy Tree
tip_text_1771	A stage based on the Super Happy Tree stolen by Baby Bowser in\r\nYoshi's Story. Without the tree, the Yoshis are powerless.\r\n
tip_title_1772	{[0107|00000100]}Super Happy Tree: \x0f\x01\x07Clouds
tip_text_1772	The clouds on either side of the stage disappear if you ride them\r\nfor too long. You can also fall through to the bottom of the clouds,\r\nso be careful with down inputs.
tip_title_1773	Moray Towers
tip_text_1773	This stage is based on the Splatoon multiplayer map Moray Towers.\r\nJust as with the original map, battles play out on the diagonal\r\nplatforms linking each floor of the parking garage.
tip_title_1774	{[0107|00000100]}Moray Towers: \x0f\x01\x07Splatfests
tip_text_1774	When the music is Ink Me Up, Ebb & Flow, Muck Warfare, or\r\nAcid Hues, the stage will appear as it does during Splatfests.\r\n
tip_title_1775	{[0107|00000100]}Moray Towers: \x0f\x01\x07Ink
tip_text_1775	Before the fighting starts, ink will fly from off-screen toward the stage.\r\nThere are several colors of ink, with special colors appearing during\r\nSplatfests.
tip_title_1776	{[0107|00000100]}Moray Towers: \x0f\x01\x07Slopes
tip_text_1776	Most of the sloping paths on this stage are connected. The places\r\nsplit by platforms will definitely lead to a descending path.\r\n
tip_title_1777	{[0107|00000100]}Moray Towers: \x0f\x01\x07Judd
tip_text_1777	You may notice Judd and Li'l Judd relaxing near the center of the\r\nstage. When certain conditions are met, they'll raise flags matching\r\nthe color of the fighter in first place.
tip_title_1778	{[0107|00000100]}Moray Towers: \x0f\x01\x07Judd's Decisions
tip_text_1778	Judd determines the fighter in first by raising a flag of their color.\r\nWhen he's raising two flags, two fighters are tied for first, and\r\nwhen he isn't raising a flag at all, three or more are tied.
tip_title_1779	Spear Pillar
tip_text_1779	A stage based on the ruins atop Mt. Coronet in the Sinnoh Region\r\nof Pokémon Diamond and Pearl.\r\n
tip_title_1780	{[0107|00000100]}Spear Pillar: \x0f\x01\x07Pokémon
tip_text_1780	Pokémon appear in the throne area at the center of the ruins. Either\r\nDialga, Palkia, or Cresselia will appear.\r\n
tip_title_1781	{[0107|00000100]}Spear Pillar: \x0f\x01\x07Three Common Attacks
tip_text_1781	Dialga and Palkia share three attack methods: tilting the screen,\r\nbreaking the floor with an earthquake, and using laser attacks.\r\n
tip_title_1782	{[0107|00000100]}Spear Pillar: \x0f\x01\x07Dialga
tip_text_1782	Aside from the three commonly shared attacks, Dialga can slow\r\ndown all fighters and use Roar of Time to damage and launch\r\nany fighters it touches.
tip_title_1783	{[0107|00000100]}Spear Pillar: \x0f\x01\x07Palkia
tip_text_1783	Aside from the three shared attacks, Palkia can cut all fighters'\r\nweights in half, flip the stage upside-down, or mirror the stage. If\r\nthe stage direction changes, fighters' inputs also change directions.
tip_title_1784	{[0107|00000100]}Spear Pillar: \x0f\x01\x07Cresselia
