tip_text_1784	Cresselia attacks directly with sonic waves and boomerangs. Even\r\nif you hide in the cave, they will travel through the ground and\r\nattack you.
tip_title_1785	Dracula's Castle
tip_text_1785	Based on Dracula's Room from the first game in the Castlevania\r\nseries. Various characters from the history of the series will make\r\nappearances as guests.
tip_title_1786	{[0107|00000100]}Dracula's Castle: \x0f\x01\x07Candles
tip_text_1786	Candles are located at various areas of the stage. When you break\r\none, an item will appear.\r\n
tip_title_1787	{[0107|00000100]}Dracula's Castle: \x0f\x01\x07Guest Characters
tip_text_1787	Every so often, special guests like Medusa will appear in the\r\nbackground of the stage, though they won't take part in the battle.\r\nOutside of the series, only Kid Dracula's shadow will appear.
tip_title_1788	New Donk City Hall
tip_text_1788	Based on City Hall from New Donk City in Super Mario Odyssey.\r\nThe stage starts at the building entrance before traveling upward\r\non a lift along the outer wall.
tip_title_1789	{[0107|00000100]}New Donk City Hall: \x0f\x01\x07Band Event
tip_text_1789	A special band event will occur when the music is set to \r\nGround Theme (Band Performance) - Super Mario Bros.\r\nor Jump Up, Super Star!
tip_title_1790	{[0107|00000100]}New Donk City Hall: \x0f\x01\x07Four Man Band
tip_text_1790	When the band event starts, four band members will appear in the\r\nbackground of the stage. When a fighter touches a band member,\r\nthat band member's parts will be added to the song.
tip_title_1791	{[0107|00000100]}New Donk City Hall: \x0f\x01\x07Mayor Pauline
tip_text_1791	Mayor Pauline will appear if the song Jump Up, Super Star! is selected.\r\nBumping into Mayor Pauline and the band members will cause them\r\nto start performing.
tip_title_1792	{[0107|00000100]}New Donk City Hall: \x0f\x01\x07Captain Toad
tip_text_1792	Captain Toad will appear on a certain part of the stage every third\r\ntime the battle goes to that part of the stage, or when music\r\nrelated to Captain Toad plays.
tip_title_1793	New Pork City
tip_text_1793	This stage is based on New Pork City from Mother 3. It's a gigantic\r\nstage—one of the largest in the game!\r\n
tip_title_1794	{[0107|00000100]}New Pork City: \x0f\x01\x07Ultimate Chimera
tip_text_1794	The Ultimate Chimera may sometimes appear and wander around\r\nthe stage. It'll chomp on any fighters it finds. You'll be KO'd if it\r\ngets its jaws on you!
tip_title_1795	{[0107|00000100]}New Pork City: \x0f\x01\x07Destructible Floor
tip_text_1795	Drop down below the ship that swings back and forth to find the only\r\nbreakable floor in the stage. If you break it at the right time, you\r\ncan send the Ultimate Chimera plummeting down.
tip_title_1796	{[0107|00000100]}New Pork City: \x0f\x01\x07Flying Limousine
tip_text_1796	You may see a flying limousine moving around the stage from\r\ntime to time. You can ride on it only when it appears below the\r\nplatforms, but make sure it doesn't carry you off the screen.
tip_title_1797	Great Plateau Tower
tip_text_1797	Based on the Great Plateau Tower from The Legend of Zelda:\r\nBreath of the Wild. In the distance, you can see Death Mountain and\r\nHyrule Castle, which was attacked by Calamity Ganon 100 years prior.
tip_title_1798	{[0107|00000100]}Great Plateau Tower: \x0f\x01\x07Guidance Stone
tip_text_1798	The spire above the guidance stone can be broken. Breaking the spire\r\nreveals a floating platform. After a time, the spire will repair itself.\r\n
tip_title_1799	{[0107|00000100]}Great Plateau Tower: \x0f\x01\x07Old Man
tip_text_1799	Although he doesn't take part in the battle, an old man sometimes\r\nglides by using the Paraglider. He'll take his time passing by while\r\nwatching the fight, and sometimes he'll land in the background.
tip_title_1800	{[0107|00000100]}Princess Peach's Castle: \x0f\x01\x07Banzai Bill
tip_text_1800	The giant Banzai Bill that flies toward the castle will damage you if\r\nyou touch it. The blast when it detonates is even stronger and will\r\nsend you flying if you're caught in it.
tip_title_1801	{[0107|00000100]}Princess Peach's Castle: \x0f\x01\x07Switch
tip_text_1801	Red, blue, and green switches appear at random. If you touch one,\r\nan ! Block will appear that produces an item when it's attacked.\r\n
tip_title_1802	{[0107|00000100]}Princess Peach's Castle: \x0f\x01\x07Floating Platforms
tip_text_1802	The floating platforms located on both sides of the stage rise slowly\r\nwhen boarded by fighters. If you stay on them, they'll rise to a\r\nfixed height.
tip_title_1803	{[0107|00000100]}Big Blue: \x0f\x01\x07Falcon Flyer
tip_text_1803	The large ship at the center of the stage when the fight begins is\r\nknown as the Falcon Flyer. It appears again after some time has\r\npassed. You can grab on to the front and back of the ship.
tip_title_1804	{[0107|00000100]}Big Blue: \x0f\x01\x07Racers
tip_text_1804	The F-Zero racers flying over the course can be used as platforms.\r\nWhen three of them link together, they are long enough to run across.\r\nDon't fall onto the racetrack or you may get hit by a racer!
tip_title_1805	{[0107|00000100]}Big Blue: \x0f\x01\x07Course
tip_text_1805	Big Blue, the inspiration for this track, is a course over water with\r\na loop. If you fall onto the racetrack, you'll be left behind in a\r\nsecond, making it easy to get KO'd.
tip_title_1806	Fourside
tip_text_1806	A stage based on Fourside, the fourth city you visit in EarthBound.\r\n\r\n
tip_title_1807	{[0107|00000100]}Fourside: \x0f\x01\x07UFO
tip_text_1807	A UFO will sometimes appear from the sky above. You can jump up\r\nto it from below and fight on it.\r\n
tip_title_1808	{[0107|00000100]}Fourside: \x0f\x01\x07Crane Platform
tip_text_1808	The steel girder platform being held up by the crane slowly moves\r\nleft and right. You can drop through it, so be careful when there's\r\nnothing below you.
tip_title_1809	{[0107|00000100]}Fourside: \x0f\x01\x07Gaps between Buildings
tip_text_1809	If you fall into the thin, long gap between buildings, it can be hard\r\nto recover. However, fighters such as Mario and Sheik can use\r\nwall jumps to get back up.
tip_title_1810	Dream Land GB
tip_text_1810	This stage resembles a Game Boy loaded up with the first title of\r\nthe Kirby series, Kirby's Dream Land. The battery light even turns\r\noff at the end of the battle!
tip_title_1811	{[0107|00000100]}Dream Land GB: \x0f\x01\x07Situations
tip_text_1811	Starting with Green Greens, all five stages from the original game\r\nmake an appearance. Seven events from the stages are\r\nre-created here.
tip_title_1812	{[0107|00000100]}Dream Land GB: \x0f\x01\x07Scrolling Screen
tip_text_1812	Green Greens, Float Islands, and Bubbly Clouds sometimes have\r\nscrolling sections, so be mindful of the edges of the screen.\r\n
tip_title_1813	{[0107|00000100]}Frigate Orpheon: \x0f\x01\x07180 Degree Rotation
tip_text_1813	When the siren rings, the stage will flip upside down. It'll stop once\r\nit turns 180 degrees. The layout of the stage will be different after\r\nit flips.
tip_title_1814	Prism Tower
tip_text_1814	Based on Prism Tower from Pokémon X & Y. The battle plays out in\r\nthe surroundings of the tower, with time advancing through morning,\r\nnoon, and night.
tip_title_1815	{[0107|00000100]}Prism Tower: \x0f\x01\x07Pokémon
tip_text_1815	Although they won't take part in the battle, Helioptile, Magnemite,\r\nEmolga, Zapdos, and Yveltal will appear. Can you spot them all?\r\n
tip_title_1816	{[0107|00000100]}Brinstar: \x0f\x01\x07Acid Lake
tip_text_1816	The level of the acid lake rises and falls. When at its highest point,\r\nall platforms but the highest ones will be swallowed up.\r\n
tip_title_1817	Brinstar Depths
tip_text_1817	Kraid will attack from the center of the stage, and the platform will\r\nrotate. If Kraid attacks with his right arm, it will rotate clockwise.\r\nIf he attacks with his left arm, then it rotates counter-clockwise.
tip_title_1818	{[0107|00000100]}Pokémon Stadium: \x0f\x01\x07Stage Changes
tip_text_1818	There are four types of stage transformations outside of the normal\r\nstadium form—Fire, Water, Rock, and Grass.\r\n
tip_title_1819	Mario Bros.
tip_text_1819	A stage based on the arcade version of Mario Bros. The turtles are\r\nnamed "Shellcreepers," the crabs "Sidesteppers."\r\n
tip_title_1820	{[0107|00000100]}Mario Bros.: \x0f\x01\x07POW Block
tip_text_1820	Shellcreepers and Sidesteppers can be flipped over by attacking\r\nor headbutting the POW Block from below. Do this three times\r\nto destroy it, but it will come back after a while.
tip_title_1821	{[0107|00000100]}Mario Bros.: \x0f\x01\x07Enemy Characters
tip_text_1821	You can flip over Shellcreepers and Sidesteppers if you attack them\r\nor headbutt the ground below them. When they change colors, their\r\nmovement speed increases.
tip_title_1822	{[0107|00000100]}Mario Bros.: \x0f\x01\x07Flipped-Over Enemies
tip_text_1822	You can throw Shellcreepers and Sidesteppers that have been flipped\r\nover. Hit other fighters with them to send the fighters flying.\r\n
tip_title_1823	{[0107|00000100]}Mario Bros.: \x0f\x01\x07Green Fireballs
tip_text_1823	The fireballs in this stage travel across the screen and launch anyone\r\nthey touch. They can't be blocked but they can be dodged. You can\r\nalso evade them using the left and right looping structure of the stage.
tip_title_1824	Saffron City
tip_text_1824	A stage based on Saffron City from Pokémon Red & Pokémon Blue.\r\nPokémon appear from the doorway of the building at the center of\r\nthe stage.
tip_title_1825	{[0107|00000100]}Saffron City: \x0f\x01\x07Pokémon
tip_text_1825	The Pokémon that appear during battle are Venusaur, Charmander,\r\nPorygon, Electrode, and Chansey. When the doorway glows, it's\r\na sign that one will appear.
tip_title_1826	{[0107|00000100]}Saffron City: \x0f\x01\x07Pokémon Attacks
tip_text_1826	Venusaur uses Razor Leaf, Charmander uses Flamethrower, Porygon\r\nuses Tackle, and there are other attacks as well. When Electrode\r\nappears, it will shake and then explode.
tip_title_1827	{[0107|00000100]}Saffron City: \x0f\x01\x07Gaps between Buildings
tip_text_1827	Fighters like Ness will have trouble recovering after falling between\r\nthe buildings. Fighters like Fox, Pichu, and others who have angled\r\njumps can get back easily.
tip_title_1828	Yoshi's Story
tip_text_1828	This stage is based on Page 1: Beginning from Yoshi's Story. A\r\nPak E. Derm walks around in the background of the center platform.\r\n
tip_title_1829	{[0107|00000100]}Yoshi's Story: \x0f\x01\x07Shy Guy
tip_text_1829	During battle, a Shy Guy holding food will fly across the screen. If you\r\nattack the Shy Guy, it will drop the food, which you can then eat to\r\nheal yourself.
tip_title_1830	{[0107|00000100]}Rainbow Cruise: \x0f\x01\x07Cruise Course
tip_text_1830	Once you finish a full lap, the course moves downward to return to\r\nthe ship. The ↓ arrow indicates when this will happen. The scrolling\r\nspeeds up through the lap, so be careful not to get left behind.
tip_title_1831	Reset Bomb Forest
tip_text_1831	A stage based on the concept of Chapter 11 of Kid Icarus: Uprising.\r\nIn the stage's background you can see Viridi, the goddess of nature.\r\n
tip_title_1832	{[0107|00000100]}Reset Bomb Forest: \x0f\x01\x07Lurchthorns
tip_text_1832	You can't defeat the lurchthorns that drift below the platforms. If you\r\ntouch them, you'll be launched upward...so you may be able to use\r\nthem to your advantage when falling.
tip_title_1833	Summit
tip_text_1833	The peak that you fight on won't change, but the conditions will\r\nchange drastically. You'll be floating on water, tilting diagonally\r\nsliding across snowdrifts, and plummeting.
tip_title_1834	{[0107|00000100]}Summit: \x0f\x01\x07Platforms and Icicles
tip_text_1834	You'll slip if you run on the ice platforms, and icicles drop over the\r\nwidest platform. Be sure to make good use of jumping and dodging\r\nwhen fighting here.
tip_title_1835	{[0107|00000100]}Summit: \x0f\x01\x07Polar Bear
tip_text_1835	The polar bear wanders around in the background, sometimes\r\njumping and causing the stage to sink. This will cause the lowest\r\nlevel to be submerged under the water, so be careful.
tip_title_1836	{[0107|00000100]}Summit: \x0f\x01\x07Fish
tip_text_1836	If you get close to the water's surface, fish will sometimes suddenly\r\nappear. If even just the tail of the fish touches you, you'll take\r\ndamage—and you'll be KO'd if it eats you!
tip_title_1837	{[0107|00000100]}Fountain of Dreams: \x0f\x01\x07Platforms
tip_text_1837	The platforms on the left and right move up and down due to the\r\nfountain. When the fountain stops, the platforms disappear.\r\n
tip_title_1838	{[0107|00000100]}Corneria: \x0f\x01\x07Beams
tip_text_1838	The gun battery on the Great Fox can serve as a platform, but it will\r\ndamage you while the beam is charging. You can destroy it by\r\nattacking it, but it won't come back once it breaks.
tip_title_1839	{[0107|00000100]}Corneria: \x0f\x01\x07Arwing
tip_text_1839	You can jump on the Arwings that fly by. They fire beams, which you\r\ncan use to your advantage if you reflect them. Sometimes Wolfens\r\nfly by, too.
tip_title_1840	{[0107|00000100]}Corneria: \x0f\x01\x07Smash Taunts
tip_text_1840	If you're playing as Fox or Falco, quickly press the down taunt to\r\nsee a Star Fox transmission conversation.\r\n
tip_title_1841	{[0107|00000100]}Venom: \x0f\x01\x07Arwing
tip_text_1841	The Arwing fighters that fly through the stage every so often can be\r\nused as platforms. Also, fighters who are launched while in the cave\r\nsection can fly into the ceiling or the walls.
tip_title_1842	Battlefield Form Stages
tip_text_1842	All stages can be played in a Battlefield form, causing them to have\r\nthe same layout as the Battlefield stage. You can select this form\r\non the Stage Select screen by pressing the X Button.
tip_title_1843	Omega Form Stages
tip_text_1843	All stages can be played in Omega form, changing them to the same\r\nfloating island shape as the Final Destination stage. You can select\r\nthis form on the Stage Select screen by pressing the X Button twice.
tip_title_1844	{[0107|00000100]}Wario: \x0f\x01\x07First Starring Role
tip_text_1844	Wario's first starring role was in Wario Land: Super Mario Land 3\r\nin 1994. Its appeal was Wario's powerful abilities, powering up with\r\ngarlic, and tackling enemies to defeat them.
tip_title_1845	{[0107|00000100]}Mii Swordfighter: \x0f\x01\x07Gale Strike (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1845	With Gale Strike, a wide swing of the sword creates a tornado that\r\nmoves forward. Opponents hit by the tornado are thrown straight\r\nup into the air.
tip_title_1846	{[0107|00000100]}Mii Swordfighter: \x0f\x01\x07Charging Blurring Blade (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1846	Mii Swordfighter attacks with a flurry of fire stabs, then launches\r\nthe opponent diagonally upward. Hold the button longer to charge\r\nthe attack. The longer the charge, the greater the attack power.
tip_title_1848	Piranha Plant's Origins
tip_text_1848	Piranha Plants first appeared in Super Mario Bros., released in 1985\r\nfor the NES. Many of them live in pipes and like to suddenly pop\r\nout at regular intervals.
tip_title_1849	Types of Piranha Plants
tip_text_1849	There are about 60 subspecies of Piranha Plant. Their biologies and\r\npersonalities are unique.\r\n
tip_title_1850	{[0107|00000100]}Piranha Plant:\x0f\x01\x07 In Its Series
tip_text_1850	The first Piranha Plant was green with yellow dots. The red version\r\nwith white spots first appeared in Super Mario Bros. 3.\r\n
tip_title_1851	{[0107|00000100]}Piranha Plant: \x0f\x01\x07Ptooie (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1851	If you tilt the control stick left or right while blowing the spiked ball\r\nupward, you can launch it in that direction.\r\n
tip_title_1852	{[0107|00000100]}Piranha Plant: \x0f\x01\x07Ptooie Height (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1852	Press and hold the special-move button to keep the spiked ball\r\nin the air. The closer it is to Piranha Plant's mouth, the farther\r\nyou can launch it left or right.
tip_title_1853	{[0107|00000100]}Piranha Plant: \x0f\x01\x07Repeated Ptooie (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1853	You can have only one spiked ball out at a time. If you try to use\r\nthis move again before the first spiked ball disappears, you will\r\nbe left vulnerable.
tip_title_1854	{[0107|00000100]}Piranha Plant: \x0f\x01\x07Ptooie Power (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1854	The spiked ball loses power each time it hits the stage or a fighter.\r\nAlso, once it loses enough speed and hits the ground, it won't deal\r\ndamage to anyone.
tip_title_1855	{[0107|00000100]}Piranha Plant: \x0f\x01\x07Charging Poison Breath (Side Special)
tip_text_1855	Press the special-move button to start charging Poison Breath, then\r\npress it again to spit out a poison cloud. The cloud's size, duration,\r\nand damage will increase the longer it's charged.
tip_title_1856	{[0107|00000100]}Piranha Plant: \x0f\x01\x07Storing Poison Breath Charge (Side Special)
tip_text_1856	If you shield, dodge, or jump while charging the poison cloud, you can\r\nstore the charge, move around, and unleash it later.\r\n
tip_title_1857	{[0107|00000100]}Piranha Plant: \x0f\x01\x07Poison Breath Damage (Side Special)
tip_text_1857	The poison cloud can't be destroyed, but it can be countered or\r\nabsorbed. Also, the center of the cloud deals the most damage.\r\n
tip_title_1858	{[0107|00000100]}Piranha Plant: \x0f\x01\x07Poison Breath's Duration (Side Special)
tip_text_1858	The duration of the poison cloud becomes shorter as the number\r\nof fighters increases.\r\n
tip_title_1859	{[0107|00000100]}Piranha Plant: \x0f\x01\x07Piranhacopter (Up Special)
tip_text_1859	Tilt the control stick left or right while rising to move slightly in that\r\ndirection. The spinning leaves will hit and damage anyone they hit.\r\n
tip_title_1860	{[0107|00000100]}Piranha Plant: \x0f\x01\x07Long-Stem Strike Charge (Down Special)
tip_text_1860	Press and hold the special-move button to charge up power.\r\nThe longer you charge, the more distance the attack will have.\r\n
tip_title_1861	{[0107|00000100]}Piranha Plant: \x0f\x01\x07Long-Stem Strike Direction (Down Special)
tip_text_1861	Tilt the control stick while charging to aim the attack. You can tilt\r\nfarther in the air than on the ground.\r\n
tip_title_1862	{[0107|00000100]}Piranha Plant: \x0f\x01\x07Long-Stem Strike Armor (Down Special)
tip_text_1862	Piranha Plant gains super armor while charging this move. You'll lose\r\nthe armor as soon as you stop charging.\r\n
tip_title_1863	{[0107|00000100]}Piranha Plant: \x0f\x01\x07Long-Stem Strike Bite (Down Special)
tip_text_1863	If a fighter is in range when Piranha Plant extends, it will automatically\r\nbite the fighter. If you press the special-move button while Piranha Plant\r\nis extending, you can bite before it fully extends.
tip_title_1864	{[0107|00000100]}Piranha Plant: \x0f\x01\x07Petey Piranha (Final Smash)
tip_text_1864	Petey Piranha can trap up to two fighters in cages and deal a great\r\namount of damage. You can't escape until the Final Smash ends\r\nor Petey Piranha is KO'd.
tip_title_1865	{[0107|00000100]}Piranha Plant: \x0f\x01\x07Petey Piranha's Movement (Final Smash)
tip_text_1865	You can make Petey Piranha move left or right. You can also make\r\nPetey jump.\r\n
tip_title_1866	{[0107|00000100]}Piranha Plant: \x0f\x01\x07Push and Pull (Side Tilt Attack)
tip_text_1866	Press the attack button after unleashing the move to perform an\r\nadditional bite attack. But if you miss the first attack, missing the\r\nsecond attack as well may leave you open to counterattack.
tip_title_1867	{[0107|00000100]}Piranha Plant: \x0f\x01\x07Pull Technique (Side Tilt Attack)
tip_text_1867	The second attack can be delayed to catch opponents off guard.\r\nIf the first attack is blocked, you still may be able to land the\r\nsecond attack.
tip_title_1868	{[0107|00000100]}Piranha Plant: \x0f\x01\x07Prickly Swing (Side Smash Attack)
tip_text_1868	When Piranha Plant unleashes a side smash attack, it turns into a\r\nPrickly Piranha Plant from Super Mario Galaxy 2, complete with\r\nred spikes on its head.
tip_title_1869	{[0107|00000100]}Piranha Plant: \x0f\x01\x07Fire Breath (Back Air Attack)
tip_text_1869	Piranha Plant spits out an explosive flame. As with most explosions,\r\nit has great launch power.\r\n
tip_title_1870	{[0107|00000100]}Piranha Plant: \x0f\x01\x07Flowerpot Meteor (Down Air Attack)
tip_text_1870	Piranha Plant swings the flowerpot (or pipe) downward quickly.\r\nThe move comes out fast and may surprise opponents.\r\nIt has a meteor effect at the beginning.
tip_title_1871	{[0107|00000100]}Piranha Plant: \x0f\x01\x07Attack When Stepped On
tip_text_1871	Piranha Plant will automatically bite if it's crouching and an opponent\r\nsteps on it. It's an involuntary reflex learned from other games\r\nPiranha Plant stars in.
tip_title_1872	{[0107|00000100]}Piranha Plant: \x0f\x01\x07Costumes
tip_text_1872	Piranha Plant's odd-numbered costumes feature flowerpots, and its\r\neven-numbered costumes feature pipes.\r\n
tip_title_1873	Spirit Board: Co-op Spirit Teams
tip_text_1873	If you increase the number of players when selecting a fighter, you\r\ncan play with up to four people. Everyone will use the same spirit\r\nteam.
tip_title_1874	Spirit Board: Co-op Rewards
tip_text_1874	Playing with others can net you more rewards than playing alone.\r\nHowever, if you use a team that's much stronger than your\r\nopponent's, the reward amount won't increase much.
tip_title_1875	Spirit Board: KO's in Co-op
tip_text_1875	If one of your teammates gets KO'd, you'll instantly lose the battle.\r\nDon't let your guard down just because you have a numbers\r\nadvantage.
tip_title_1876	Joker's Origins
tip_text_1876	Joker made his debut in Persona 5, released in 2017. He's a young\r\nman with a strong sense of justice and is the leader of the Phantom\r\nThieves of Hearts, a group who changes the hearts of evildoers.
tip_title_1877	{[0107|00000100]}Joker: \x0f\x01\x07In His Series
tip_text_1877	Joker transferred to Shujin Academy after a certain incident and\r\nthen acquired Persona skills. While in his thief form, he gives off\r\na different vibe than his usual personality.
tip_title_1878	{[0107|00000100]}Joker: \x0f\x01\x07Gun / Gun Special (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1878	Joker quickly fires a gun with his left hand. Press the button repeatedly\r\nor hold it to fire continuously. While Arsene is summoned, the number of\r\nshots fired and the power of the shots increases.
tip_title_1879	{[0107|00000100]}Joker: \x0f\x01\x07Jumping during Gun / Gun Special (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1879	If you press the jump button immediately after firing your gun on the\r\nground, you'll jump into the air and shoot straight down. You can also\r\nuse the stick to move left and right in the air.
tip_title_1880	{[0107|00000100]}Joker: \x0f\x01\x07Dodging during Gun / Gun Special (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1880	While holding the special-move button to fire your gun, quickly\r\nflick the stick to the left or right to make Joker dodge while\r\ncontinuing to fire.
tip_title_1881	{[0107|00000100]}Joker: \x0f\x01\x07Vulnerability While Gun Dodging (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1881	Dodging while shooting makes you invincible for a shorter time than a\r\nnormal dodge, and repeated dodging will slow your reaction time and\r\nleave you even more vulnerable.
tip_title_1882	{[0107|00000100]}Joker: \x0f\x01\x07Gun / Gun Special in the Air (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1882	Once you fire a shot in the air, tilt the stick up and press the button\r\nto fire rapidly. If you tilt the stick down and press the button, you can\r\ncontinue your move by shooting downward.
tip_title_1883	{[0107|00000100]}Joker: \x0f\x01\x07Eiha (Side Special)
tip_text_1883	Fire a bolt that explodes and deals continuous damage. If the bolt hits\r\nan opponent, it will knock the opponent into the air.\r\n
tip_title_1884	{[0107|00000100]}Joker: \x0f\x01\x07Eigaon (Side Special)
tip_text_1884	While Arsene is summoned, Joker will use Eigaon, which is bigger\r\nand faster than Eiha and also has more launch power and higher\r\ncontinuous damage. When it hits the terrain, it explodes.
tip_title_1885	{[0107|00000100]}Joker: \x0f\x01\x07Eiha/Eigaon Damage (Side Special)
tip_text_1885	The continuous damage after the bolt explodes is greater than the\r\ndamage of hitting an opponent with the bolt itself.\r\n
tip_title_1886	{[0107|00000100]}Joker: \x0f\x01\x07Grappling Hook (Up Special)
tip_text_1886	Shoot a grappling hook diagonally upward. If it hits an opponent, they'll\r\nbe pulled closer and thrown. If it hits an edge while you're in midair,\r\nyou'll cling to the edge. If it hits an item, you'll pull it toward you.
tip_title_1887	{[0107|00000100]}Joker: \x0f\x01\x07Wings of Rebellion (Up Special)
tip_text_1887	When Arsene is summoned, you can use Wings of Rebellion to fly\r\nupward a long distance. It has great range, but it can't be used\r\nto attack.
tip_title_1888	{[0107|00000100]}Joker: \x0f\x01\x07Wings of Rebellion and Moving Left and Right (Up Special)
tip_text_1888	If you tilt the stick left or right before rising up, you can slightly\r\nchange the angle of ascent. Tilting the stick while falling will\r\nallow you to move slightly as well.
tip_title_1889	{[0107|00000100]}Joker: \x0f\x01\x07Rebel's Guard (Down Special)
tip_text_1889	Joker will pose once using the move and take a hit from the opponent.\r\nYou will take less damage from the attack, and your Rebellion Gauge\r\nwill fill up greatly.
tip_title_1890	{[0107|00000100]}Joker: \x0f\x01\x07After Rebel's Guard (Down Special)
tip_text_1890	Press and hold the button to extend the duration of the move.\r\nOnce you're hit with an attack, release the button to unleash\r\na force that pushes opponents.
tip_title_1891	{[0107|00000100]}Joker: \x0f\x01\x07Tetrakarn / Makarakarn (Down Special)
tip_text_1891	A move that can be used while Arsene is summoned. You can counter\r\ndirect attacks from opponents with Tetrakarn. Projectiles will be\r\nreflected with Makarakarn.
tip_title_1892	{[0107|00000100]}Joker: \x0f\x01\x07All-Out Attack (Final Smash)
tip_text_1892	Joker dashes forward to attack. If it hits an opponent, the Phantom Thieves\r\nwill perform an All-Out Attack. There are two versions and different\r\nmembers will appear. There are also six different spoken lines.
tip_title_1893	{[0107|00000100]}Joker: \x0f\x01\x07Charging with All-Out Attack (Final Smash)
tip_text_1893	You can hit up to four opponents with the initial dash forward. Even if\r\nit doesn't hit anyone, you can tilt the stick the opposite direction\r\nimmediately after missing to dash the other way.
tip_title_1894	{[0107|00000100]}Joker: \x0f\x01\x07End the Battle with an All-Out Attack (Final Smash)
tip_text_1894	If an opponent is damaged enough by the end of the attack, they'll be\r\ninstantly KO'd. If you end the battle with this KO, you might get to\r\nsee a special cinematic.
tip_title_1895	{[0107|00000100]}Joker: \x0f\x01\x07Down Air Attack
tip_text_1895	While Arsene is summoned, your down air attack gains a\r\nmeteor effect.\r\n
tip_title_1896	{[0107|00000100]}Joker: \x0f\x01\x07Rebellion Gauge
tip_text_1896	If you receive damage or get hit while using Rebel's Guard, the\r\nRebellion Gauge will fill up. Once it's full, Joker will summon Arsene.\r\nYour special moves will change, and your attacks will be stronger.
tip_title_1897	{[0107|00000100]}Joker: \x0f\x01\x07Rebellion Gauge and Arsene
tip_text_1897	While Arsene is present, the Rebellion Gauge will not charge.\r\nThe gauge will deplete as time passes or if Joker takes damage,\r\nand once it's completely empty, Arsene will exit the scene.
tip_title_1898	{[0107|00000100]}Joker: \x0f\x01\x07Rebellion Gauge in Team Battle
tip_text_1898	When your teammates are damaged or KO'd during Team Battle, the\r\nRebellion Gauge will fill a little bit.\r\n
tip_title_1899	{[0107|00000100]}Joker: \x0f\x01\x07Special Cinematics for When Arsene Is Summoned
tip_text_1899	When it's 1 vs. 1 or the opponent is a CPU, there is a cut-in when\r\nArsene appears.\r\n
tip_title_1900	{[0107|00000100]}Mementos: \x0f\x01\x07Train
tip_text_1900	If you land on the train that passes through the bottom of the stage,\r\nyou'll be launched upward. If you get hit by the front of the train,\r\nyou'll be badly damaged and will be launched sideways.
tip_title_1901	{[0107|00000100]}Mementos: \x0f\x01\x07Walls and Train
tip_text_1901	There are two different types of walls that sometimes appear from\r\nthe left and right sides. When the walls appear, the train will not.\r\n
tip_title_1902	{[0107|00000100]}Mementos: \x0f\x01\x07Using the Terrain
tip_text_1902	If you use the angles of the ceiling and walls that appear to your\r\nadvantage, you can bounce opponents off of them for a KO. If you\r\nget launched, be sure to break your fall.
tip_title_1903	{[0107|00000100]}Mementos: \x0f\x01\x07Music-Based Changes
tip_text_1903	If the song played is from Persona 3 or Persona 4, the stage color\r\nand background will change. It will also have an impact on Joker's\r\nRebellion Gauge and the winning sequence.
tip_title_1904	Stage Builder: Colorize Layers
tip_text_1904	When building a stage, you can turn layer colors on to colorize the\r\nlayers, making it easy to see which elements are in which layers.\r\n
tip_title_1905	Stage Builder: View Layer Depth from Above
tip_text_1905	Press the ZL or ZR buttons to get a different perspective that allows\r\nyou to see the contents of each layer. In this view, you can move\r\nobjects between layers with the up and down directional buttons.
tip_title_1906	Stage Builder: Terrain Settings
tip_text_1906	If you tap terrain twice in the editing tool, you can open the terrain\r\nsettings. Experimenting with the settings can lead to interesting stages!\r\n
tip_title_1907	Stage Builder: Grouping
tip_text_1907	If you draw terrain that is stuck together in the same layer, you can\r\nmove it all with gears and rails. If you don't want it grouped together,\r\nmake sure to separate the terrain.
tip_title_1908	Stage Builder: Press and Hold to Group Select
tip_text_1908	Stage elements that are stuck together can be selected all at once by\r\nselecting the editing tool and then pressing and holding on the group\r\nof elements. This won't work if the elements are on different layers.
tip_title_1909	Stage Builder: Terrain Gravity
tip_text_1909	Some terrain can be set to fall freely. Once it falls and disappears\r\nfrom the screen, you can set it to respawn at its original location.\r\n
tip_title_1910	Stage Builder: Grabbing Edges
tip_text_1910	If you make pointy corners on the terrain, fighters will be able to grab\r\nits edges. However, you can change the terrain settings to disable\r\ngrabbable edges.
tip_title_1911	Stage Builder: Smooth Setting
tip_text_1911	If you enable the Smooth Reverse and Smooth Movement settings of\r\ngears and rails, they'll smoothly speed up when starting to move and\r\nslow down when stopping or changing directions.
tip_title_1912	Stage Builder: Change Test Fighter
tip_text_1912	If you would like to test the created stage with different fighters,\r\ngo to Test, and then open the pause menu.\r\n
tip_title_1913	Stage Builder: Warp Zone and Items
tip_text_1913	The Warp Zone can be used not only for fighters but also for some\r\nitems. If you throw an item into one of the portals, it will come out\r\nthe other end while maintaining its speed.
tip_title_1914	Stage Builder: Wind Area
tip_text_1914	The Wind Area's effect can be negated with spirit support skills\r\nsuch as Strong-Wind Immunity.\r\n
tip_title_1915	VR
tip_text_1915	You can play VR in Games & More using the Toy-Con VR Goggles to\r\nstep into the world of Smash!\r\n
tip_title_1916	VR: Playing in VR Mode
tip_text_1916	When playing in VR mode, you can freely look around the stage by\r\nturning your head. If you get close to the fighters and stage, you can\r\nfeel the realistic scale of everything.
tip_title_1917	VR: Viewing Angle While Spectating
tip_text_1917	You can move the camera around while spectating an all-CPU battle.\r\nLook around from different angles, and you might see things you\r\ndidn't know existed!
tip_title_1918	VR: Controlling P1
tip_text_1918	Switch P1 to a player on the fighter-selection screen to battle in VR.\r\n\r\n
tip_title_1919	amiibo: Send on a Journey
tip_text_1919	Send your FP on a journey through the Internet to fight other FPs.\r\nIt will take time for the FP to return, so you may want to send it\r\noff before going to sleep or taking a break.
tip_title_1920	amiibo: Gifts
tip_text_1920	You get more rewards when battling other FPs on the Internet than\r\nyou do from a standard Smash battle. Even if the FP doesn't\r\nencounter an opponent, it will still bring back a small gift.
tip_title_1921	Hero: (P1/P5 Costume) Origins
tip_text_1921	This hero first appeared in DRAGON QUEST XI: Echoes of an Elusive Age,\r\nreleased in 2018 in Europe and North America. He leaves his hometown\r\nto meet with the king before being labeled "The Darkspawn" and hunted.
tip_title_1922	Hero: (P2/P6 Costume) Origins
tip_text_1922	This hero first appeared in DRAGON QUEST III: The Seeds of Salvation,\r\nreleased as Dragon Warrior III in 1992 in North America. The hero carries on\r\nhis father's will and embarks on a journey to defeat the archfiend Baramos.
tip_title_1923	Hero: (P3/P7 Costume) Origins
tip_text_1923	This hero first appeared in DRAGON QUEST IV: Chapters of the Chosen,\r\nreleased in 1992 in North America. A descendant of the Zenithians, the hero\r\nteams up with his friends to save the world after his hometown is destroyed.
tip_title_1924	Hero: (P4/P8 Costume) Origins
tip_text_1924	This hero first appeared in DRAGON QUEST VIII: Journey of the Cursed King,\r\nreleased in 2005 in North America. A royal guardsman, he embarks on a\r\njourney to undo a curse placed upon his king and princess.
tip_title_1925	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Charging Up Specials (Neutral, Up, Side Special)
tip_text_1925	The more they're charged, the more powerful these moves become.\r\nIf you have enough MP, you can charge them up to a maximum of\r\nthree levels.
tip_title_1926	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Frizz/Frizzle/Kafrizz (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1926	Start charging with the special-move button. Press the button again to\r\nunleash a fireball spell. You can store your charge if you shield, dodge,\r\nor jump while charging.
tip_title_1927	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Zap/Zapple/Kazap (Side Special)
tip_text_1927	Press and hold the special-move button to imbue your sword with lightning\r\nmagic. The move will be unleashed when you release the button or when\r\nit reaches maximum charge. The charge cannot be stored.
tip_title_1928	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Kazap (Side Special)
tip_text_1928	Charge it all the way to point the sword skyward and summon lightning.\r\nYou'll then unleash a spin attack that has a wide range. Foes that you\r\nhit with the spin attack will be struck by a lightning bolt.
tip_title_1929	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Woosh/Swoosh/Kaswoosh (Up Special)
tip_text_1929	Use a wind spell to summon a tornado underneath you that will slash\r\nnearby enemies and lift you up. The more it's charged, the higher you\r\nwill rise. If you don't have enough MP, you will hop slightly.
tip_title_1930	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Swoosh and Kaswoosh Characteristics (Up Special)
tip_text_1930	Swoosh allows you to move left or right easily, and Kaswoosh allows\r\nyou to rise higher in the air. Choose which move to use depending on\r\nthe situation.
tip_title_1931	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Canceling Command Selection (Down Special)
tip_text_1931	You can close the command window with the jump or shield buttons.\r\nHowever, you'll need to wait a little while before opening it again.\r\n
tip_title_1932	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Bang/Kaboom (Down Special)
tip_text_1932	A light spell that unleashes a bolt that explodes when it hits an\r\nopponent or after a time. Kaboom draws opponents near before\r\nexploding and causes a bigger explosion than Bang.
tip_title_1933	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Sizz/Sizzle (Down Special)
tip_text_1933	A fire spell that sends out a quick spark. When it hits the landscape\r\nor an opponent, it bursts into flames. Sizzle's shot is bigger than Sizz,\r\nand it is more powerful.
tip_title_1934	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Whack/Thwack (Down Special)
tip_text_1934	These moves have a chance to instantly KO opponents they hit.\r\nThe KO success rate increases as you and your opponent take\r\ndamage. Thwack has a wider range than Whack.
tip_title_1935	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Kamikazee (Down Special)
tip_text_1935	Deal damage to nearby opponents by self-destructing. You will\r\nbe KO'd. Your opponent gets credit for the KO in a 1-on-1 battle.\r\n
tip_title_1936	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Magic Burst (Down Special)
tip_text_1936	Use all your MP to create an explosion with you at the center.\r\nThe power and size of the explosion grows with every point\r\nof MP used.
tip_title_1937	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Snooze (Down Special)
tip_text_1937	Shoot a projectile that puts opponents to sleep. The size of the projectile\r\nincreases the longer it travels. However, the closer the opponent is, the\r\ndeeper they'll sleep.
tip_title_1938	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Heal (Down Special)
tip_text_1938	Heal some of the damage you've taken. If you use it multiple times,\r\nit will not come up as a selectable command again until you get KO'd.\r\n
tip_title_1939	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Oomph (Down Special)
tip_text_1939	Increase your launch power and melee attack power for a while.\r\nHowever, your defense will decrease a little.\r\n
tip_title_1940	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Acceleratle (Down Special)
tip_text_1940	Increase your movement speed and jump for a while. You will also\r\nbecome easier to launch.\r\n
tip_title_1941	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Bounce (Down Special)
tip_text_1941	Automatically reflects opponents' projectiles for a while. The reflected\r\nprojectiles will be powered up after being reflected.\r\n
tip_title_1942	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Kaclang (Down Special)
tip_text_1942	Block attacks by becoming metal for a while. However, you cannot\r\nmove until the status wears off, and you cannot cancel it yourself.\r\n
tip_title_1943	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Zoom (Down Special)
tip_text_1943	Rise straight upward in order to return to the stage. You can't be hit\r\nby opponents while rising, but you can still run into the stage's terrain.\r\n
tip_title_1944	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Hocus Pocus (Down Special)
tip_text_1944	Try your luck and hope for the best. This move may randomly trigger\r\nother commands, or it may change your status or size.\r\n
tip_title_1945	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Flame Slash / Kacrackle Slash (Down Special)
tip_text_1945	Wreathe your sword in flame for Flame Slash or in ice for Kacrackle Slash.\r\nWhen Kacrackle Slash hits, it freezes opponents for a short time.\r\n
tip_title_1946	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Hatchet Man (Down Special)
tip_text_1946	Slash opponents with full force. It takes a bit of time to attack, but if\r\nit hits, it lands a critical hit that deals massive damage.\r\n
tip_title_1947	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Metal Slash (Down Special)
tip_text_1947	Hit an opponent that is metal or has the Kaclang status to instantly\r\nKO them. However, nonmetal opponents will only receive one percent\r\ndamage.
tip_title_1948	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Psyche Up (Down Special)
tip_text_1948	Charge up power to make your next melee attack stronger. The effect\r\nends once you hit an opponent, but it will not end if you miss.\r\n
tip_title_1949	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Gigaslash (Final Smash)
tip_text_1949	Hero makes a wide sweep with his sword. If it hits an opponent,\r\nprotagonists from different generations will lend you their strength\r\nso you can unleash a deadly blow.
tip_title_1950	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Side Tilt Attack
tip_text_1950	Press the attack button a second time to unleash an additional attack.\r\nThe first attack uses the shield to repel incoming attacks.\r\n
tip_title_1951	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Down Air Attack
tip_text_1951	Jab the sword downward. The move has a meteor effect at the beginning\r\nof the move.\r\n
tip_title_1952	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07MP
tip_text_1952	You will miss and become vulnerable if you try to use a special move\r\nwithout enough MP. You'll recover MP as time passes and as you deal\r\ndamage to opponents.
tip_title_1953	{[0107|00000100]}Hero: \x0f\x01\x07Critical Hit
tip_text_1953	Smash attacks have a 1/8 chance to be critical hits. If a critical hit\r\nstrikes an opponent, it'll deal massive damage!\r\n
tip_title_1954	{[0107|00000100]}Yggdrasil's Altar: \x0f\x01\x07The Center Platform
tip_text_1954	The center platform is the rainbow bridge that leads to Yggdrasil,\r\na great, mythical tree. Once the battle starts, it'll float upward.\r\nBe sure to hop on it.
tip_title_1955	{[0107|00000100]}Yggdrasil's Altar: \x0f\x01\x07Tockles
tip_text_1955	Members of the Tockle tribe, said to be the embodiment of time,\r\nsometimes appear in the stage's background. When they appear,\r\nit's a sign a platform will soon appear or disappear.
tip_title_1956	{[0107|00000100]}Yggdrasil's Altar: \x0f\x01\x07Treasure Chest
tip_text_1956	The platforms that appear on the left and right sometimes have a\r\ntreasure chest. You can get items by attacking it, but sometimes it's\r\na mimic pretending to be a treasure chest.
tip_title_1957	{[0107|00000100]}Yggdrasil's Altar: \x0f\x01\x07Mimic
tip_text_1957	Defeating a mimic won't earn you any points, but you may get\r\na good item.\r\n
tip_title_1958	{[0107|00000100]}Yggdrasil's Altar: \x0f\x01\x07Liquid Metal Slime
tip_text_1958	Although extremely rare, a liquid metal slime will sometimes appear.\r\nIt will not join the battle and will run away immediately.\r\n
tip_title_1959	Online Tourneys
tip_text_1959	Find out who reigns supreme in an Internet battle of up to 64 people!\r\nFight your way to the top and become the champion!\r\n
tip_title_1960	Spectate: Cheering On Players
tip_text_1960	Try to predict which player will win before the battle begins.\r\nIf your prediction is correct, you get points. You can then trade\r\nthese points in for spirits, items, and more.
tip_title_1961	Spectate: Surprising Victory Bonus
tip_text_1961	If you correctly predict the winner and the winner had only a small\r\namount of cheers, you'll get a Surprising Victory Bonus. It might be\r\nworthwhile to pay attention to who's being cheered on.
tip_title_1962	Banjo & Kazooie's Origins
tip_text_1962	The first time the duo appeared was in Banjo-Kazooie, released\r\nin 1998. Banjo first appeared in Diddy Kong Racing, which was\r\nreleased in 1997.
tip_title_1963	{[0107|00000100]}Banjo & Kazooie: \x0f\x01\x07In Their Series
tip_text_1963	The two set out on a journey to save Banjo's sister Tooty who was\r\nabducted by Gruntilda. They adventure through many stages that\r\nrequire them to work together to overcome obstacles.
tip_title_1964	{[0107|00000100]}Banjo & Kazooie: \x0f\x01\x07Egg Firing (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1964	Kazooie can fire eggs from her mouth. The eggs will bounce when they\r\nhit the ground and will explode if they hit an opponent.\r\n
tip_title_1965	{[0107|00000100]}Banjo & Kazooie: \x0f\x01\x07Breegull Blaster (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1965	Press and hold the button to make Banjo pick Kazooie up and rapidly\r\nshoot eggs. You can move and jump while firing eggs this way.\r\n
tip_title_1966	{[0107|00000100]}Banjo & Kazooie: \x0f\x01\x07Canceling Breegull Blaster (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1966	Breegull Blaster will end if you try to crouch, shield, or use a different\r\nspecial move. However, the action you used to cancel Breegull Blaster\r\nwon't happen unless you press and hold the inputs.
tip_title_1967	{[0107|00000100]}Banjo & Kazooie: \x0f\x01\x07Shock Spring Jump (Up Special)
tip_text_1967	Use a Shock Spring Pad to jump straight up. After using this ability,\r\nyou can freely move and attack while in the air.\r\n
tip_title_1968	{[0107|00000100]}Banjo & Kazooie: \x0f\x01\x07Shock Spring Jump Charge (Up Special)
tip_text_1968	You can jump higher if you press and hold the button to charge up\r\npower before jumping off of the Shock Spring Pad.\r\n
tip_title_1969	{[0107|00000100]}Banjo & Kazooie: \x0f\x01\x07Attacking with Shock Spring Pad (Up Special)
tip_text_1969	The dropped Shock Spring Pad can hit opponents. The attack power\r\nwon't change even if the move is charged.\r\n
tip_title_1970	{[0107|00000100]}Banjo & Kazooie: \x0f\x01\x07Rear Egg (Down Special)
tip_text_1970	Kazooie will shoot grenade eggs diagonally upward in the direction\r\nshe isn't facing. Make sure to turn around before letting loose.\r\n
tip_title_1971	{[0107|00000100]}Banjo & Kazooie: \x0f\x01\x07Rear Egg's Characteristics (Down Special)
tip_text_1971	Grenade eggs aren't perfect circles and have an odd bounce as a\r\nresult. You can pick one up to throw, but if the timed fuse runs out\r\nwhile you're still holding it, the explosion will damage you!
tip_title_1972	{[0107|00000100]}Banjo & Kazooie: \x0f\x01\x07Only One Rear Egg (Down Special)
tip_text_1972	Only one grenade egg can exist on the stage at any time.\r\nIf you try to use the move again while your grenade egg\r\nexists, you'll be left vulnerable.
tip_title_1973	{[0107|00000100]}Banjo & Kazooie: \x0f\x01\x07Wonderwing (Side Special)
tip_text_1973	Use a Golden Feather to become invincible and charge forward.\r\nThe powerful tackle is useful for returning to the stage, but if\r\nyou use up all the feathers, you can't use the move anymore.
tip_title_1974	{[0107|00000100]}Banjo & Kazooie: \x0f\x01\x07Wonderwing Tackle (Side Special)
tip_text_1974	You won't take damage or get knocked back by attacks while charging\r\nforward. However, being blocked by a shielding opponent will leave\r\nyou vulnerable!
tip_title_1975	{[0107|00000100]}Banjo & Kazooie: \x0f\x01\x07Wonderwing Feather (Side Special)
tip_text_1975	You can use five Golden Feathers in standard battles and one during\r\nSudden Death. Your Golden Feathers will not be replenished until you\r\nare KO'd.
tip_title_1976	{[0107|00000100]}Banjo & Kazooie: \x0f\x01\x07Wonderwing in Stamina Mode (Side Special)
tip_text_1976	In a stamina battle, the number of available Golden Feathers will vary\r\ndepending on the initial stamina amount.\r\n
tip_title_1977	{[0107|00000100]}Banjo & Kazooie: \x0f\x01\x07The Mighty Jinjonator (Final Smash)
tip_text_1977	Summon a statue from the ground. If it hits an opponent, the Mighty\r\nJinjonator will be awakened from the statue and unleash continuous\r\nhigh-speed strikes alongside other Jinjos to launch the opponent.
tip_title_1978	{[0107|00000100]}Banjo & Kazooie: \x0f\x01\x07Twirling Wing Whack (Neutral Air Attack)
tip_text_1978	Kazooie will spread her wings and twirl to attack in all directions.\r\nThis attack will reach farther when used while moving to the side\r\nrather than up or down.
tip_title_1979	{[0107|00000100]}Banjo & Kazooie: \x0f\x01\x07Beak Buster (Down Air Attack)
tip_text_1979	This move has a meteor effect at the beginning. However you will dive\r\nquickly, so be careful of self-destructs.\r\n
tip_title_1980	{[0107|00000100]}Banjo & Kazooie: \x0f\x01\x07Downward Throw
tip_text_1980	Buries a grabbed opponent in the ground. The higher their damage is,\r\nthe longer they will be buried.\r\n
tip_title_1981	{[0107|00000100]}Banjo & Kazooie: \x0f\x01\x07Midair Jump
tip_text_1981	You can perform up to two midair jumps. You can jump after using\r\ntheir up special too, making it easy to recover.\r\n
tip_title_1982	{[0107|00000100]}Banjo & Kazooie: \x0f\x01\x07Kazooie's Characteristics
tip_text_1982	Kazooie won't usually get hit by opponents' attacks. However, she will\r\nget hit while running.\r\n
tip_title_1983	{[0107|00000100]}Banjo & Kazooie: \x0f\x01\x07Talon Trot
tip_text_1983	Kazooie will come out of the backpack and carry Banjo while running.\r\nIn the original game, you could run faster and run up steep hills with\r\nthis ability.
tip_title_1984	{[0107|00000100]}Spiral Mountain: \x0f\x01\x07Rotation
tip_text_1984	The whole stage will rotate after a set time, and the places you can\r\nstand will change. The rotation direction will be shown in the middle\r\nof the stage before it rotates.
tip_title_1985	{[0107|00000100]}Spiral Mountain: \x0f\x01\x07Platforms on the Left and Right
tip_text_1985	Once the whole stage rotates, there will be additional platforms on\r\nthe left and right. The platforms will change depending on the direction\r\nof the stage.
tip_title_1986	{[0107|00000100]}Spiral Mountain: \x0f\x01\x07Downward Slope
tip_text_1986	The location of the slope leading down from the summit changes\r\ndepending on the stage's orientation. The platform at the slope's\r\nbase may also disappear depending on the orientation.
tip_title_1987	{[0107|00000100]}Spiral Mountain: \x0f\x01\x07Bridge
tip_text_1987	If you are on the bridge on the left or right while the stage rotates,\r\nyou will be thrown off. Once the rotation direction is shown, return to\r\nthe center platform. 
tip_title_1988	{[0107|00000100]}Spiral Mountain: \x0f\x01\x07Jinjos
tip_text_1988	Sometimes a Jinjo will fly by in the background. If you see five of them\r\nfly in formation, you are really lucky.\r\n
tip_title_1989	{[0107|00000100]}Spiral Mountain: \x0f\x01\x07Guest Characters
tip_text_1989	Various characters from the original game, like Gruntilda the witch,\r\nMumbo Jumbo the shaman, Bottles the mole, and Banjo's sister Tooty,\r\nwill appear in the stage's background.
tip_title_1990	{[0107|00000100]}Banjo & Kazooie: \x0f\x01\x07Breegull Blaster Power (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1990	The egg's power will decrease if fired continuously. The power will drop\r\nup to two times, but it will start to return to normal power once you\r\nput the Breegull Blaster away.
tip_title_1991	Home-Run Contest
tip_text_1991	There's 10 seconds on the clock! Deal as much damage to Sandbag as\r\nyou can, then wallop it with a side smash from the Home-Run Bat\r\nto send it flying!
tip_title_1992	Home-Run Contest: Time Left
tip_text_1992	Even if the timer hits zero, you've still got time to finish a swing.\r\nDeal as much damage as you can, and launch Sandbag at the\r\nlast possible moment!
tip_title_1993	Home-Run Contest: Tips for a Strong Hit
tip_text_1993	Pay close attention to what part of the Home-Run Bat hits Sandbag.\r\nIf you connect with the very end of the bat, you'll send Sandbag\r\nflying farther!
tip_title_1994	Home-Run Contest: Rewards
tip_text_1994	Sometimes there are rewards along Sandbag's path after it lands.\r\nThe farther Sandbag travels, the better the rewards may be!\r\n
tip_title_1995	Terry's Origins
tip_text_1995	Terry first appeared in 1991 in the FATAL FURY: King of Fighters arcade\r\ngame. The game was unique for its quirky characters and its two-lane\r\nfighting system!
tip_title_1996	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07In His Series
tip_text_1996	To defeat Geese Howard and avenge his adoptive father, Jeff Bogard,\r\nTerry mastered martial arts. He joins and wins the ultimate martial arts\r\ntournament, The King of Fighters, to get near Geese.
tip_title_1997	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Special-Move Strength
tip_text_1997	How long the special-move button is held down will affect its strength.\r\nAttacks will reach farther and be more powerful the longer the button\r\nis held, but you'll also be open to attacks while you're charging up.
tip_title_1998	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Power Wave (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1998	Hit the ground with a fist to send a shock wave out ahead\r\nof you. The longer you hold down the special-move button,\r\nthe farther the move will go and the faster it'll travel!
tip_title_1999	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Airborne Wave (Neutral Special)
tip_text_1999	Terry's neutral special isn't just for ground attacks. Use this ability\r\nwhile in the air or near an edge and the fire will continue forward.\r\nIt has a short range, but it's great for keeping someone from returning.
tip_title_2000	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Power Wave Hang Time (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2000	The first time Terry's neutral special is used while airborne will cause\r\nTerry to stop descending for a moment. This is a good way to throw\r\noff an opponent who was expecting you to fall normally!
tip_title_2001	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Two Types of Side Specials
tip_text_2001	Terry has two different side specials at his disposal. You can trigger\r\nthem by either tilting the stick forward or backward and then pushing\r\nthe special-move button. Both moves make Terry charge forward.
tip_title_2002	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Burning Knuckle (Forward Tilt Special)
tip_text_2002	Terry will raise his hands then charge forward, fist extended. This move\r\nis most powerful right when he starts to charge. Be careful, though;\r\nTerry is vulnerable at the start and end of the attack!
tip_title_2003	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Burning Knuckle (Forward Tilt Special / Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2003	Quickly use command input ↓→ + attack button while facing right\r\nto increase the power of the attack. This command input will also\r\nmake the extended arm invincible at the beginning of the move.
tip_title_2004	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Crack Shoot (Backward Tilt Special)
tip_text_2004	Perform a flying somersault forward, dropping the heel for a powerful\r\nblow. The tip of the foot is the strongest point, and the arch of the\r\nattack makes it a good counter to aerial attacks.
tip_title_2005	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Reversed Crack Shoot (Backward Tilt Special)
tip_text_2005	While airborne, tilt the stick away from the direction Terry is facing\r\nfor a bit and he'll perform his Crack Shoot in that direction instead.\r\nUsing the command input while airborne will still attack forward!
tip_title_2006	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Crack Shoot (Backward Tilt Special / Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2006	Quickly use the command input ↓← + attack button while facing\r\nright to deal more damage and increase the move's launch power.\r\n
tip_title_2007	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Rising Tackle (Up Special)
tip_text_2007	Raise up into the air with a combo of spinning arms and legs, damaging\r\nenemies above you. You can slightly control the direction of the attack\r\nby tilting the stick left or right as you ascend.
tip_title_2008	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Rising Tackle Traits (Up Special)
tip_text_2008	You will be invincible from the waist down at the beginning of the\r\nmove, so it's easy to overcome attacks from above. However, you\r\nwill be left vulnerable after the attack ends.
tip_title_2009	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Rising Tackle (Up Special / Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2009	Hold ↓ for a moment, then input ↑ + attack button to increase\r\nthe power of the attack and how high up you'll travel. Also, your\r\nwhole body will be invincible at the start of the move.
tip_title_2010	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Power Dunk (Down Special)
tip_text_2010	Hit the opponent into the air with your knee, then slam downward with\r\na powerful punch. Land the first blow and it will become a combo.\r\nThis continued attack can leave you vulnerable in the air, however.
tip_title_2011	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Power Dunk (Down Special / Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2011	Quickly use the command input →↓ + attack button while facing right\r\nto increase the power of this move. Additionally, using this command\r\ninput will make your whole body invincible when you first jump.
tip_title_2012	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Power Dunk's Meteor Effect (Down Special / Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2012	Unleashing this move using the command input will cause the end of\r\nthe downward punch to have a meteor effect but only if the attack\r\nbutton is held. Otherwise the punch will not have a meteor effect.
tip_title_2013	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Super Special Moves
tip_text_2013	You can unleash a Super Special Move in a pinch using a command\r\ninput. You must have 100% or more accumulated damage, or your\r\nstamina must be at 1/3 or less in Stamina mode.
tip_title_2014	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Using Super Special Moves
tip_text_2014	When you see Go near your accumulated damage, that means you\r\ncan use Super Special Moves! You won't be able to use them in the\r\nair, though, so be careful!
tip_title_2015	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Reversed Super Special Moves
tip_text_2015	Input the command with right and left reversed to unleash the move\r\nbehind you instead!\r\n
tip_title_2016	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07The Start of Super Special Moves
tip_text_2016	These moves have super armor at the beginning. They are also\r\nable to withstand and overwhelm neutral attacks.\r\n
tip_title_2017	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Power Geyser (Super Special Move)
tip_text_2017	You can unleash this move (after taking significant damage) by quickly\r\nusing the command input ↓←→ + attack button while facing right.\r\nThe base of the attack deals more damage than its higher points.
tip_title_2018	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Buster Wolf (Super Special Move)
tip_text_2018	You can use this move only after taking significant damage. Quickly use\r\nthe command input ↓→↓→ + attack button while facing right. Terry\r\nwill charge forward, fist extended, dealing tons of damage if he connects.
tip_title_2019	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Easy Commands for Super Special Moves
tip_text_2019	You can use Super Special Moves with shorter inputs. Power Geyser\r\nis ↓←↓→ + attack button while facing right. Buster Wolf is ↓→↓→\r\n+ attack button.
tip_title_2020	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Triple Wolf (Final Smash)
tip_text_2020	This powerful three-part move starts with Triple Geyser, continues with\r\nPower Dunk, and ends with Buster Wolf. Triple Geyser will launch\r\nopponents, then Terry will unleash his combo on the first person he hits.
tip_title_2021	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Triple Wolf's Pull (Final Smash)
tip_text_2021	The initial three pillars of energy will hit multiple opponents and deal\r\ntons of damage. You can launch only one opponent with the final blow,\r\nbut the three pillars of energy are great for a hectic battle.
tip_title_2023	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Combo into a Special
tip_text_2023	Avoid becoming vulnerable by using a special move the moment you\r\nhit an opponent with attacks like neutral attacks or tilt attacks. You\r\ncan carry out some amazing combos!
tip_title_2024	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Neutral Attack into a Combo
tip_text_2024	The second stage of the neutral attack is actually two separate hits!\r\nYou can execute a special move at the end of the second hit for\r\neven more damage!
tip_title_2025	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Up Throw
tip_text_2025	The launch power is weaker compared to other throws. However, you\r\nare less vulnerable after the throw, and it's easier to follow up with\r\nadditional attacks.
tip_title_2026	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Dodge Attack
tip_text_2026	If you press the attack button while dodging in place, you can use the\r\nDodge Attack! It works like Terry's up tilt attack; you'll be invincible\r\nfrom the waist up, making it easier to fight against airborne foes!
tip_title_2027	{[0107|00000100]}Terry: \x0f\x01\x07Face Off 1-on-1
tip_text_2027	In 1-on-1 fights, you will face the opponent automatically. Be aware of\r\nthis when using your command-input moves!\r\n
tip_title_2028	{[0107|00000100]}King of Fighters Stadium: \x0f\x01\x07Guest Characters
tip_text_2028	The characters in the background may be familiar to fans! Characters\r\nassociated with the music that has been selected tend to show up\r\nmore frequently too.
tip_title_2029	{[0107|00000100]}King of Fighters Stadium: \x0f\x01\x07Invisible Wall
tip_text_2029	There are invisible walls to the right and left of the stage. Fighters\r\nlaunched at high speed risk breaking through the wall and being KO'd!\r\n
tip_title_2030	{[0107|00000100]}King of Fighters Stadium: \x0f\x01\x07Hitting the Wall
tip_text_2030	The invisible walls on the left and right will become visibly damaged on\r\nimpact as the risk of breaking increases. This is very noticeable in 1-on-1\r\nbattles; movement may slow on hitting the wall if it's close to shattering!
tip_title_2031	{[0107|00000100]}King of Fighters Stadium: \x0f\x01\x07Projectiles and Walls
tip_text_2031	Projectiles and items will pass through the invisible walls on the left\r\nand right of the stage. Luma and Pikmin won't, though.\r\n
tip_title_2032	Byleth's Origins
tip_text_2032	Byleth first appeared in the Fire Emblem: Three Houses game,\r\nreleased in 2019. Byleth became a professor at the Officers\r\nAcademy and led one of three classes.
tip_title_2033	{[0107|00000100]}Byleth: \x0f\x01\x07In Their Series
tip_text_2033	Byleth lived as a mercenary but became a professor after rescuing\r\nstudents of the Officers Academy. Byleth would go on to teach at the \r\nschool, fighting alongside and commanding the students in battle.
tip_title_2034	{[0107|00000100]}Byleth: \x0f\x01\x07Four Weapons
tip_text_2034	Each move uses a sword, axe, lance, or bow that appears in the\r\noriginal game. The axe, lance, and bow are the Heroes' Relics of\r\nthe three house leaders, and the sword is Byleth's Hero's Relic.
tip_title_2035	{[0107|00000100]}Byleth: \x0f\x01\x07Failnaught (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2035	Press the special-move button to draw the bow and prepare a\r\npowerful attack. It takes time to unleash, but the arrow moves fast\r\nand travels far!
tip_title_2036	{[0107|00000100]}Byleth: \x0f\x01\x07Failnaught Charged (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2036	Hold down the button and charge to unleash a beam of light straight\r\nacross. The attack will usually hit immediately and is extremely\r\npowerful against opponents directly in the line of fire.
tip_title_2037	{[0107|00000100]}Byleth: \x0f\x01\x07Canceling Failnaught (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2037	It's possible to dodge in place or shield when you first begin to draw\r\nthe bow, but the move will reset if you do so. Once the charge begins\r\nafter holding down the button, you won't be able to dodge or shield.
tip_title_2038	{[0107|00000100]}Byleth: \x0f\x01\x07Turning with Failnaught (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2038	While drawing the bow, you can turn and face the opposite way by\r\ntilting in that direction. This won't interrupt the attack, but it can only\r\nbe done at the beginning of the move.
tip_title_2039	{[0107|00000100]}Byleth: \x0f\x01\x07Areadbhar (Side Special)
tip_text_2039	Swing this legendary lance in front of you, using its long reach to\r\ncover the area ahead and upward. The bladed part of the weapon\r\nis the most powerful part.
tip_title_2040	{[0107|00000100]}Byleth: \x0f\x01\x07Flicking the Stick with Areadbhar (Side Special)
tip_text_2040	If you flick the stick and input your attack, you will swing up while\r\ncharging forward. Pay close attention to how far you are from your\r\nopponent, and use this technique to surprise them!
tip_title_2041	{[0107|00000100]}Byleth: \x0f\x01\x07Using Areadbhar in the Air (Side Special)
tip_text_2041	When using this move in the air, the attack strikes in a wide arc\r\nfrom below upward. Flicking the stick will allow you to move forward\r\na little too!
tip_title_2042	{[0107|00000100]}Byleth: \x0f\x01\x07Sword of the Creator (Up Special)
tip_text_2042	Extend the sword upward and diagonally. If this attack hits an\r\nopponent, the blade will quickly shorten and bring you close to\r\nthe enemy. After the jump, you can move about freely in the air.
tip_title_2043	{[0107|00000100]}Byleth: \x0f\x01\x07Sword of the Creator and Walls (Up Special)
tip_text_2043	If the blade's tip hits a wall, the sword will shorten and pull you\r\ntoward the wall. It's possible to then jump off the wall and follow\r\nup with another jump or an attack!
tip_title_2044	{[0107|00000100]}Byleth: \x0f\x01\x07Sword of the Creator and Edges (Up Special)
tip_text_2044	If you use this move near an edge and it connects, the sword's blade\r\nwill bury into the edge and you'll dangle freely. Tilt the stick or press\r\na button and the sword will shorten, pulling you toward the edge.
tip_title_2045	{[0107|00000100]}Byleth: \x0f\x01\x07Aymr (Down Special)
tip_text_2045	Charge up the axe, then swing down with incredible force. It takes a\r\nwhile to prepare this attack, so using it can leave you vulnerable, but\r\nenemies on the receiving end of this can suffer serious damage.
tip_title_2046	{[0107|00000100]}Byleth: \x0f\x01\x07Turn and Attack with Aymr (Down Special)
tip_text_2046	If you draw the axe and then input the opposite direction from the\r\nway you're facing, you will turn and unleash this attack in the indicated\r\ndirection instead.
tip_title_2047	{[0107|00000100]}Byleth: \x0f\x01\x07Aymr's Super Armor (Down Special)
tip_text_2047	If this attack is charged while standing on the ground, you'll have\r\nsuper armor until you swing the axe.\r\n
tip_title_2048	{[0107|00000100]}Byleth: \x0f\x01\x07Progenitor God Ruptured Heaven (Final Smash)
tip_text_2048	Swing the sword, striking in a wide arc in front of you. This attack can\r\nhit up to three opponents. Combine Sothis's strength with the Sword\r\nof the Creator to unleash a powerful attack.
tip_title_2049	{[0107|00000100]}Byleth: \x0f\x01\x07Side Smash Attack
tip_text_2049	Extend the lance for a long-range, forward-facing attack! The tip of the\r\nlance is the strongest part, and you can adjust the attack's angle up or\r\ndown. This attack is at its best when angled upward.
tip_title_2050	{[0107|00000100]}Byleth: \x0f\x01\x07Up Smash Attack
tip_text_2050	Extend the sword and swing it around and up in a wide area.\r\nThis attack lasts longer than some foes may expect, so it's\r\neasy to catch unprepared opponents off guard.
tip_title_2051	{[0107|00000100]}Byleth: \x0f\x01\x07Down Smash Attack 
tip_text_2051	You can swing the axe forward and backward, dealing significant\r\ndamage to anyone it hits. Be careful, though; the damage and launch\r\npower of this attack is high, but the move can leave you vulnerable.
tip_title_2053	{[0107|00000100]}Byleth: \x0f\x01\x07Down Air Attack
tip_text_2053	Swing the axe downward. Try to hit your opponent with the tip of the\r\naxe just as it reaches the lowest point. If you can pull it off, the blow\r\nwill have a meteor effect.
tip_title_2054	{[0107|00000100]}Byleth: \x0f\x01\x07Attacks Using the Lance
tip_text_2054	Side specials, side smash attacks, forward air attacks, and back air\r\nattacks all make use of the lance. Remember that the tip of the\r\nblade is the most powerful point, and the lance has a long reach.
tip_title_2055	{[0107|00000100]}Byleth: \x0f\x01\x07Attacks Using the Axe
tip_text_2055	Down specials, down smash attacks, and down air attacks all use\r\nthe axe. The axe is slow and can leave you vulnerable, but that lack\r\nof speed is made up for with the devastating power of its attacks.
tip_title_2056	{[0107|00000100]}Garreg Mach Monastery: \x0f\x01\x07Four Areas
tip_text_2056	After a certain amount of time, the platform will rise up into the air and\r\nthe environment will change. The stage rotates through the marketplace,\r\nthe reception hall, the bridge, and the cathedral, in that order.
tip_title_2057	{[0107|00000100]}Garreg Mach Monastery: \x0f\x01\x07The Shops in the Marketplace
tip_text_2057	The shops on the left and right of the marketplace will break if you\r\nattack them or are knocked into them. Once broken, they won't be\r\nrestored until you rotate through the rest of the environments.
tip_title_2058	{[0107|00000100]}Garreg Mach Monastery: \x0f\x01\x07The Reception Hall's Chandeliers
tip_text_2058	It's possible to get on top of two of the chandeliers hanging from the\r\nceiling. Hitting them can cause them to fall, and anyone caught beneath\r\nwill get launched upward.
tip_title_2059	{[0107|00000100]}Garreg Mach Monastery: \x0f\x01\x07Guest Characters
tip_text_2059	Students and members of the Church of Seiros will appear during battle!\r\nSpot Black Eagles in the reception hall, Blue Lions in the marketplace,\r\nGolden Deer at the bridge, and Church of Seiros members in the cathedral.
tip_title_2060	{[0107|00000100]}Byleth: \x0f\x01\x07Sword of the Creator and Footstooling Opponents (Up Special)
tip_text_2060	If the opponent's accumulated damage is 50% or more, the footstool\r\npart of this attack will have a meteor effect. Also, the farther the sword\r\nis extended, the more power it will have when footstooling someone.
tip_title_2061	Min Min's Origins
tip_text_2061	Min Min first appeared in the game ARMS in 2017. She's a well-known\r\nworker at the Mintendo Noodle House, which serves delicious ramen.\r\nShe actually entered the Grand Prix to advertise her shop!
tip_title_2062	{[0107|00000100]}Min Min: \x0f\x01\x07In Her Series
tip_text_2062	Min Min is petite with skinny arms, but when she charges up, her left\r\nARM turns into a dragon, empowering her punches. She also likes to\r\nemploy kicks in the air, deflecting an opponent's ARM.
tip_title_2063	{[0107|00000100]}Min Min: \x0f\x01\x07Punch
tip_text_2063	Use the attack button to unleash a punch with the left ARM, and use the\r\nspecial-move button to punch with the right ARM. Flick the stick with\r\neither move to turn it into a smash attack, increasing range and power.
tip_title_2064	{[0107|00000100]}Min Min: \x0f\x01\x07Punching Power
tip_text_2064	The punch unleashed by flicking the stick is at its strongest just before\r\nthe ARM is fully extended. The attack is weaker at the beginning of the\r\npunch and when the ARM reaches its maximum range.
tip_title_2065	{[0107|00000100]}Min Min: \x0f\x01\x07The ARM's Charged Smash
tip_text_2065	Holding down the attack or special-move button and flicking the stick\r\nwill charge up power for a charged smash attack. This will also change\r\nthe move that is used.
tip_title_2066	{[0107|00000100]}Min Min: \x0f\x01\x07Shifting ARM Arc
tip_text_2066	If you're on the ground and you tilt up or down just before unleashing\r\na punch to the left or right, you can move the ARMS in an arc. The way\r\nthe ARM bends depends on the type of ARM.
tip_title_2067	{[0107|00000100]}Min Min: \x0f\x01\x07Punching and...
tip_text_2067	Even with an ARM extended, you can still move around and jump.\r\nDuring smash attacks, you can attack with the other ARM, too!\r\n
tip_title_2068	{[0107|00000100]}Min Min: \x0f\x01\x07Attack Forward and Backward
tip_text_2068	It's possible for Min Min to attack in both directions! While attacking\r\nin one direction with one ARM extended, move the stick in the opposite\r\ndirection and press the button for the other ARM to send it that way!
tip_title_2069	{[0107|00000100]}Min Min: \x0f\x01\x07When the ARM Bounces Back
tip_text_2069	Your ARMS will bounce back if they hit a wall or the floor. They'll also\r\nbounce back if an opponent shields the attack, which will leave\r\nyou vulnerable to a counterattack!
tip_title_2070	{[0107|00000100]}Min Min: \x0f\x01\x07Changing into a Dragon
tip_text_2070	The left ARM will gain power and change into a dragon when you throw\r\nan opponent or when your Final Smash is ready. Shortly after throwing\r\nan opponent, or if Min Min cannot move, the ARM will return to normal.
tip_title_2071	{[0107|00000100]}Min Min: \x0f\x01\x07Three ARMS in One
tip_text_2071	The right ARM has three variations: Ramram is very bendy, making it\r\neasier to hit opponents. Megawatt is slow but powerful. The Dragon\r\ncan extend out and shoot lasers!
tip_title_2072	{[0107|00000100]}Min Min: \x0f\x01\x07Dragon
tip_text_2072	The Dragon is an ARM that is shaped like a dragon. It can be\r\nequipped on both arms. If you press the attack button when\r\nthe ARM is fully extended in a smash attack, it fires a laser!
tip_title_2073	{[0107|00000100]}Min Min: \x0f\x01\x07Megawatt
tip_text_2073	The Megawatt is a heavy ARM that is a lot like an iron ball. When\r\ncharged, it becomes engulfed in electricity. It doesn't arc easily\r\nor extend quickly, but it's super powerful. Perfect for a final blow.
tip_title_2074	{[0107|00000100]}Min Min: \x0f\x01\x07Ramram
tip_text_2074	The Ramram is a light ARM that will arc in flight. It's not powerful,\r\nbut it extends quickly and is bendy, keeping enemies on their toes.\r\nIt can extend through walls or the ground while you are airborne.
tip_title_2076	{[0107|00000100]}Min Min: \x0f\x01\x07ARMS Jump (Up Special)
tip_text_2076	When neither ARM is extended and you're on the ground, this move will\r\nsend you flying upward. You'll be invincible the moment you jump, and\r\ncharging the move will extend the height and invincibility time!
tip_title_2077	{[0107|00000100]}Min Min: \x0f\x01\x07Maneuvering the ARMS Jump (Up Special)
tip_text_2077	If you tilt the stick to the left or right before you jump, you can leap\r\ndiagonally. You can also move to the left or right while falling.\r\n
tip_title_2078	{[0107|00000100]}Min Min: \x0f\x01\x07Using ARM Hook (Up Special)
tip_text_2078	Use this move in the air to extend an ARM diagonally upward. If it\r\nhits an edge, you'll be able to dangle from the edge instead of falling.\r\nTilt up on the stick or press a button to pull yourself up.
tip_title_2079	{[0107|00000100]}Min Min: \x0f\x01\x07ARM Change (Down Special)
tip_text_2079	The right ARM can be swapped between Ramram, Megawatt, and\r\nDragon. You won't be able to swap ARMS out while attacking or\r\nif you are currently unable to move.
tip_title_2080	{[0107|00000100]}Min Min: \x0f\x01\x07ARMS Rush (Final Smash)
tip_text_2080	The left ARM will transform into a dragon to unleash an attack.\r\nOnly one opponent will get caught up in the rush of punches that various\r\nARMS fighters will swoop in to deliver, sending that fighter flying.
tip_title_2081	{[0107|00000100]}Min Min: \x0f\x01\x07Kung Fu Combo and Flurry Attack
tip_text_2081	Hit the attack or special-move button quickly on the ground to unleash\r\na three-kick attack. Hit the button multiple times during the combo\r\nto turn it into a flurry attack!
tip_title_2082	{[0107|00000100]}Min Min: \x0f\x01\x07Reflecting Projectiles (Up Smash Attack)
tip_text_2082	Min Min's up smash is a kick capable of reflecting projectile attacks.\r\nReflected projectiles will increase in speed and power, however.\r\n
tip_title_2083	{[0107|00000100]}Min Min: \x0f\x01\x07Neutral Air Attack
tip_text_2083	Min Min's neutral air attack swings an ARM out at opponents.\r\nThe speed and power of the attack will change depending on\r\nwhich ARM is currently equipped.
tip_title_2084	{[0107|00000100]}Spring Stadium: \x0f\x01\x07Jumping Platform Lights
tip_text_2084	When the surface of a jumping platform is flashing, that means it is\r\nswitching on or off. If the surface is green, that's the perfect time\r\nto use it!
tip_title_2085	{[0107|00000100]}Spring Stadium: \x0f\x01\x07Jumping Platform
tip_text_2085	When the jumping platforms on the left, right, and center are on,\r\nyou can reach some amazing heights. Tap the jump button quickly\r\nto short hop without using the platform.
tip_title_2086	{[0107|00000100]}Spring Stadium:\x0f\x01\x07 Attacking from Jumping Platforms
tip_text_2086	The big jump you can perform from a jumping platform will make\r\nyou invincible when you take off. Get into the mix and deal damage\r\nto nearby opponents!
tip_title_2087	{[0107|00000100]}Spring Stadium:\x0f\x01\x07 Air Attacks with Jumping Platforms
tip_text_2087	You can deal damage to opponents you hit when making a big jump\r\nusing the jumping platform. You can hit opponents easier in the air\r\nsince you'll be invincible at the start of the jump.
tip_title_2088	{[0107|00000100]}Spring Stadium:\x0f\x01\x07 Jumping Platforms on the Bottom
tip_text_2088	Jumping platforms can sometimes appear to the left and/or right\r\nof the bottom of the stage. Use them well and you may get a\r\nchance to recover from an unfortunate fall.
tip_title_2089	{[0107|00000100]}Spring Stadium:\x0f\x01\x07 Jumping Platforms and Items
tip_text_2089	Some items may bounce on the jumping platform when it is active.\r\nWatch out for sudden airborne items!\r\n
tip_title_2090	{[0107|00000100]}Spring Stadium:\x0f\x01\x07 ARMS Drones
tip_text_2090	Occasionally ARMS Drones carrying items will fly overhead.\r\nHit an ARMS Drone with an attack to knock the item free.\r\n
tip_title_2091	{[0107|00000100]}Spring Stadium:\x0f\x01\x07 Arch
tip_text_2091	If you hit an opponent against the arch on the upper part of the\r\nstage, they will bounce back down. Break your fall at the right\r\ntiming if you get launched.
tip_title_2092	{[0107|00000100]}Spring Stadium:\x0f\x01\x07 Guest Characters
tip_text_2092	The same crowd that showed up for the ARMS fighters in the original\r\ngame has turned out for these battles. In fact, look closely and you\r\nmay see appropriately themed T-shirts!
tip_title_2093	Small Battlefield
tip_text_2093	With only two platforms, this stage is perfect for intense one-on-one\r\nbattles. The space between the platforms is slightly smaller compared\r\nto the normal Battlefield stage.
tip_title_2094	Smash: The Music of the Battlefields and Final Destination
tip_text_2094	Every song is available to listen to while you fight it out on the Battlefield,\r\nSmall Battlefield, Big Battlefield, and Final Destination stages!\r\n
tip_title_2095	{[0107|00000100]}Steve and Alex: \x0f\x01\x07In Their Series
tip_text_2095	Steve and Alex are two of the many incarnations of the player when\r\nthey venture into the Minecraft world. Explore dungeons, create\r\nbuildings, or trade with villagers—the adventure is in your hands!
tip_title_2096	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Zombies from the Series
tip_text_2096	The P7 appearance is the Zombie, known to appear from the darkness\r\nand attack people. Fortunately, the Zombies in Minecraft catch fire\r\nwhen they touch sunlight, burning away after a bit.
tip_title_2097	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Enderman from the Series
tip_text_2097	The P8 appearance is the Enderman, one of the residents of the End.\r\nThey like to teleport about, quietly carrying blocks. However, if you lock\r\neyes with one, it will turn into a strong enemy and attack you!
tip_title_2098	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Tools and Moves
tip_text_2098	You'll make use of a sword, axe, shovel, or pickaxe, depending on\r\nwhich move you use. Each tool will break after some use, which\r\nwill reduce the power of any attack that uses that tool.
tip_title_2099	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Materials and Moves
tip_text_2099	Materials are necessary for the moves Steve brings to the battle. If you\r\ndon't have the needed materials, the move will be weaker than normal\r\nor even fail outright! Keep track of the materials you have on hand.
tip_title_2100	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Mine (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2100	Hold the button down, and you can dig for materials below you or in\r\nnearby walls. The speed that you mine and what materials you uncover\r\nchanges depending on where you are mining.
tip_title_2101	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Mineable Materials (Neutral Special)
