tip_text_2101	In order of easiest to hardest to obtain, you can mine dirt, wood,\r\nstone, iron, redstone, gold, and diamond. Depending on the ground\r\nin the stage, you might dig up ice, sand, or wool instead of dirt.
tip_title_2102	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07High-Quality Mineable Materials (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2102	Iron, gold, redstone, and diamonds can be obtained from any kind\r\nof surface.\r\n
tip_title_2103	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Mining and the Material Gauge (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2103	Some of the materials you collect will be shown as a gauge near your\r\ndamage. However, gold and diamond will be displayed separately, and\r\nredstone won't be displayed at all.
tip_title_2104	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Quality of Mined Material (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2104	The harder the walls and floors are, the better the quality of the\r\nmaterials you'll mine. However, it will also take longer to dig up\r\nthose materials.
tip_title_2105	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Mining Limits (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2105	There is a limit on how much of each material you can carry, and the\r\nrarer the material, the less of it you can hold. Any material you dig up\r\nbeyond the limit will be discarded.
tip_title_2106	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Mining Tools (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2106	You use different tools depending on the type of wall or ground you're\r\ndigging into. These tools help you mine faster, and when one breaks,\r\nit'll slow down how quickly you can mine.
tip_title_2107	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Mining, Tools, and Quality (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2107	There are five levels of quality for the various tools: diamond, gold,\r\niron, stone, and wood. Generally, a higher-quality material is more\r\ndurable and allows you to mine faster, though gold has its own properties.
tip_title_2108	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07While Mining (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2108	While mining, you can jump or move forward or backward, but you\r\nwon't be able to attack. If you move forward or backward, you'll keep\r\non mining, but jumping will cancel the action.
tip_title_2109	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Mining on Battlefield-Form Stages (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2109	All of the Battlefield-form and Ω-form stages have the same amounts\r\nof the various materials available for mining.\r\n
tip_title_2110	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Craft (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2110	While in front of the crafting table, pressing the special-move button\r\nwill use the materials you have to create, upgrade, or repair tools.\r\n
tip_title_2111	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Crafting Tools (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2111	Use the crafting table when you have a broken tool, and you'll craft the\r\nhighest-quality tool with the materials available automatically. If this is\r\nan improvement on your other tools, they'll all be upgraded too!
tip_title_2112	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Using Craft to Upgrade (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2112	If you have the materials to make a higher-quality tool, use Craft\r\nto create the upgraded tool. In fact, all tools will upgrade at the\r\nsame time.
tip_title_2113	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Using Craft to Repair (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2113	You can repair damaged tools by using the same materials that they\r\nwere crafted with. This is much quicker than crafting a new tool after\r\none breaks.
tip_title_2114	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Canceling Craft (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2114	The move can be canceled by jumping, shielding, dodging, or pressing\r\nthe attack button. You won't lose material if you cancel Craft this way.\r\n
tip_title_2115	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Crafting with Gold (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2115	Gold tools break easier than ones made from any other material,\r\nbut they are also the quickest to mine with and the quickest for\r\nunleashing moves.
tip_title_2116	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Crafting with Diamond (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2116	Diamond tools are very powerful, but it takes longer to craft them\r\nthan it does to craft tools using the other materials.\r\n
tip_title_2117	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Using Create Block (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2117	If you press the special-move button in the air, you'll use your materials\r\nto create and place a block at your feet. Holding down the button and\r\nmoving or jumping will continuously place blocks.
tip_title_2118	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Materials and Create Block (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2118	You create blocks from the materials you've mined, starting with dirt,\r\nthen wood, then stone, and finally iron. The different materials all have\r\ndifferent durabilities.
tip_title_2119	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Block Limits (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2119	There is a limit on how many blocks you can place at one time.\r\nOnce you've reached the limit, each new block you create will\r\ncause the oldest block you placed to go away.
tip_title_2120	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Block Rules (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2120	You cannot place blocks near the edge of the screen. If a block you\r\ncreated starts flashing, this means it is close to that limit.\r\n
tip_title_2121	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Overlapping Blocks (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2121	If you use this move in a spot where you've already placed a block,\r\nthe old block will be destroyed and you can place a new one.\r\n
tip_title_2122	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Destroying Blocks (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2122	As time passes, blocks placed with Create Block will eventually break.\r\nBeing hit by attacks, stood on by fighters, or hit from below will cause\r\nthe blocks to break faster.
tip_title_2123	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Mining Blocks (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2123	It is possible to mine blocks you've placed, but this will only break\r\nthe block and not yield any materials.\r\n
tip_title_2124	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Creating Blocks while Mining (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2124	If you are mining and jump, you'll instead jump and place a block at\r\nyour feet.\r\n
tip_title_2125	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Minecart (Side Special)
tip_text_2125	Place rails and charge forward while riding in an iron minecart. If you\r\njump, you'll leap out of the minecart, but it will continue forward.\r\nThe first opponent caught in its path will be carried away.
tip_title_2126	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Stuck in the Minecart (Side Special)
tip_text_2126	The more damage a fighter has taken, the longer they'll be carried\r\nalong in the minecart. Trapped fighters can move the control stick\r\nback and forth to help escape the minecart faster.
tip_title_2127	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Using Minecart Repeatedly (Side Special)
tip_text_2127	You can use the minecart repeatedly, but doing so will reduce the\r\namount of time a fighter is trapped in it.\r\n
tip_title_2128	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Minecart on a Hill (Side Special)
tip_text_2128	If the minecart tries to go uphill, it will slow down, stop, and even\r\nroll backward. However, if the minecart is going downhill, it will\r\nactually speed up!
tip_title_2129	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Minecart and Powered Rails (Side Special)
tip_text_2129	If you've collected gold and redstone, you can place powered rails.\r\nThis will increase the speed of the minecart and also allow it to go\r\nup hills!
tip_title_2130	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Charge with Minecart and Powered Rail (Side Special)
tip_text_2130	Use the special-move button while riding the minecart to place\r\npowered rails and speed up. Don't forget that this only works if\r\nyou've mined up redstone and gold.
tip_title_2131	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Reboarding the Minecart (Side Special)
tip_text_2131	It's possible to get back in the minecart after you've jumped out,\r\nbut you can do this only twice. Keep track of how many times\r\nyou've jumped out!
tip_title_2132	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Minecart Controls (Side Special)
tip_text_2132	Push left or right on the control stick to send the minecart rolling in\r\nthat direction, placing rails along the way. Once you run out of\r\nmaterials and fall off the rails, the minecart will come to a stop.
tip_title_2133	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Materials for Rails (Side Special)
tip_text_2133	In order to place rails, you'll need to collect the required materials.\r\nEasy-to-obtain materials, like dirt, will be used first. After that,\r\nyou'll use wood, stone, and then iron.
tip_title_2134	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Destroying the Minecart (Side Special)
tip_text_2134	The minecart won't last forever! After taking a certain amount of\r\ndamage, the minecart will break. If Steve was the one who broke it,\r\nhe'll be able to collect iron.
tip_title_2135	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Elytra (Up Special)
tip_text_2135	Elytra will allow you to glide sideways. Tilt the stick up and down\r\nwhile gliding to adjust the angle and trajectory of the glide.\r\n
tip_title_2136	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Elytra and Firework Rocket (Up Special)
tip_text_2136	At the beginning of the move, the firework rocket ignites to increase\r\nyour speed. You can damage any opponents you hit while the speed\r\nincrease is active.
tip_title_2137	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Cancel Elytra (Up Special)
tip_text_2137	You can cancel Elytra midflight by dodging or attacking while gliding.\r\nYou'll fall downward after doing so, but you'll be able to move left or\r\nright a little as you fall.
tip_title_2138	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Elytra's Time Limit (Up Special)
tip_text_2138	After a certain period of time, the elytra will automatically fall off, and\r\nyou'll fall downward. Be careful when this happens, as you'll be vulnerable\r\nto attacks as you fall.
tip_title_2139	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Crashing with Elytra (Up Special)
tip_text_2139	While using the fireworks rocket, you won't crash into terrain and go\r\ninto a free fall. However, once the rocket is out of fuel, hitting a ceiling\r\nor wall will send you falling, so be careful.
tip_title_2140	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07TNT (Down Special)
tip_text_2140	This move uses a lot of materials to create and place a powerful TNT\r\nblock and a pressure plate. The block will explode after some time, if\r\nthe block takes some damage, or if someone steps on the pressure plate.
tip_title_2141	{[0107|00000100]}Steve:\x0f\x01\x07 TNT Materials (Down Special)
tip_text_2141	The easier to obtain materials will be used first when making the\r\nTNT block. While the power doesn't change depending on the\r\nmaterials, the block can be made with fewer rare materials.
tip_title_2142	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Remote TNT Detonation (Down Special)
tip_text_2142	When on the ground, if you continue to hold the special-move button\r\nyou can walk and place a redstone circuit. Release the button to create\r\na pressure plate, which you can attack or step on to set off the TNT.
tip_title_2143	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Several TNT Blocks (Down Special)
tip_text_2143	If you place your own TNT block next to another player's TNT block,\r\nstepping on the pressure plate will set off both blocks.\r\n
tip_title_2144	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07TNT Explosion (Down Special)
tip_text_2144	TNT doesn't see a difference between friend and foe. Stand too close,\r\nand the explosion from your own TNT will still hurt you! Be sure to\r\nplace your pressure plate at a safe distance.
tip_title_2145	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07TNT's Power (Down Special)
tip_text_2145	Using a pressure plate to set off a TNT block will increase the\r\namount of damage the explosion does compared to waiting a\r\nwhile or damaging the block.
tip_title_2146	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07House of Boom (Final Smash)
tip_text_2146	Create a large piston to launch multiple opponents to the side.\r\nOne unlucky foe will get trapped in a dark room—filled with enemies\r\nand explosives—which quickly explodes.
tip_title_2147	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Neutral Attack / Side Tilt Attack
tip_text_2147	You can hold down the attack button to continuously swing the sword.\r\nYou can also move while continuing to attack!\r\n
tip_title_2148	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Flint and Steel (Down Tilt Attack)
tip_text_2148	If you use this move near the edge, the fire you create will fall down,\r\ndamaging opponents below or making it difficult for someone to get\r\nback to the stage.
tip_title_2149	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Pickaxe Attacks (Forward Air Attack / Back Air Attack)
tip_text_2149	Your forward and back air attacks will make use of the pickaxe,\r\nand there is a small opportunity to cause a meteor effect while\r\nswinging the pickaxe in the forward air attack.
tip_title_2150	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Air Attacks with a Sword
tip_text_2150	Swing a sword in the air by jumping while pressing the attack button.\r\nUsing neutral attack while jumping will leave you less vulnerable to\r\nenemy attacks.
tip_title_2151	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Anvil (Down Air Attack)
tip_text_2151	Create an iron anvil and drop it to attack below you. The anvil will\r\nvanish after a short time, but you can stand on top of it until it does.\r\n
tip_title_2152	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Fishing Rod (Grab Attack)
tip_text_2152	This move cannot be used in the air, but if you hook an opponent on\r\nthe ground, you'll capture them in a fence.\r\n
tip_title_2153	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Downward Throw
tip_text_2153	The downward throw will slam an opponent into the ground, and if\r\nyou have iron, this will set your opponent up perfectly for the anvil\r\nthat gets dropped on them.
tip_title_2154	{[0107|00000100]}Minecraft World: \x0f\x01\x07Biome
tip_text_2154	The battle will take place in one of six locations: the plains, birch forest,\r\nsavanna, taiga, snowy tundra, or stone shore. Each location has block-\r\nshaped terrain that will break apart if it takes damage.
tip_title_2155	{[0107|00000100]}Minecraft World: \x0f\x01\x07Selecting Biomes
tip_text_2155	Hold these inputs and press the A Button to select a biome: L Button for\r\nthe plains, L and R Buttons for the birch forest, or the L Button and\r\n↑→↓← for the savanna, taiga, snowy tundra, or stone shore, respectively.
tip_title_2156	{[0107|00000100]}Minecraft World: \x0f\x01\x07Mineable Material
tip_text_2156	Each biome has the same distribution of mineable materials, meaning\r\nthe same location on a platform will yield the same materials, no matter\r\nwhich biome you're fighting on.
tip_title_2157	{[0107|00000100]}Minecraft World: \x0f\x01\x07Breaking the Terrain
tip_text_2157	The blocks the stage is made out of will crack and be destroyed if they\r\nare headbutted from below or attacked. The broken landscape will not\r\nbe restored during the battle either!
tip_title_2158	{[0107|00000100]}Minecraft World: \x0f\x01\x07Guest Characters
tip_text_2158	Sheep, chickens, villagers, and others will appear in the background\r\nof the stage. At night, the villagers will return to their homes. In their\r\nplace, zombies and skeletons will appear!
tip_title_2159	{[0107|00000100]}Steve: \x0f\x01\x07Moving the Crafting Table (Neutral Special) 
tip_text_2159	Press the special-move button while shielding to use some materials\r\nand reposition your crafting table nearby. Moving the crafting table\r\nwill use material in the following order: wood, stone, then iron.
tip_title_2160	Sephiroth's Origins
tip_text_2160	Sephiroth made his debut in FINAL FANTASY VII, released in 1997.\r\nHe is a SOLDIER of the Shinra Electric Power Company, has\r\nphenomenal physical strength, and wields the long Masamune blade.
tip_title_2161	{[0107|00000100]}Sephiroth: \x0f\x01\x07In His Series
tip_text_2161	Sephiroth was thought of as a hero, due to being the best SOLDIER,\r\nand many young people aspired to emulate him. Following a certain\r\nincident, however, he decided to stand against Cloud as an enemy.
tip_title_2162	{[0107|00000100]}Sephiroth: \x0f\x01\x07Flare/Megaflare/Gigaflare (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2162	Hold down the button to charge—up to three levels—and release to\r\nlaunch a fireball that eventually explodes. Charging for longer will\r\nreduce the range of the attack but increase the size of the explosion.
tip_title_2163	{[0107|00000100]}Sephiroth: \x0f\x01\x07Flare (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2163	Press and release the button to shoot a large fireball in front of you,\r\nbut be careful of enemy attacks while the move charges. The projectile\r\nyou launch moves slowly but has great range and power.
tip_title_2164	{[0107|00000100]}Sephiroth: \x0f\x01\x07Gigaflare (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2164	This version of the move has very short range, and charging it leaves you\r\nopen to enemy attacks. However, the explosion is very large and the\r\ncloser an enemy is to the center of the blast, the more damaging it is.
tip_title_2165	{[0107|00000100]}Sephiroth: \x0f\x01\x07Canceling the Charge (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2165	You can cancel the charge by jumping, shielding, or dodging.\r\nHowever, you will lose any charge if you do so.\r\n
tip_title_2166	{[0107|00000100]}Sephiroth: \x0f\x01\x07Shadow Flare (Side Special)
tip_text_2166	Launch a small, quick blast of energy. If the energy hits an opponent,\r\nit will surround them until it eventually comes together and explodes.\r\n
tip_title_2167	{[0107|00000100]}Sephiroth: \x0f\x01\x07Multiple Shadow Flares (Side Special)
tip_text_2167	You can hit an opponent with up to five blasts from this attack.\r\nDo this with a combination of charging up the shot and hitting the\r\nopponent multiple times.
tip_title_2168	{[0107|00000100]}Sephiroth: \x0f\x01\x07Avoiding Shadow Flare (Side Special)
tip_text_2168	With good timing, it is possible for a fighter to avoid the damage\r\nfrom Shadow Flare. This is done by shielding or dodging the moment\r\nthe energy comes together and explodes.
tip_title_2169	{[0107|00000100]}Sephiroth: \x0f\x01\x07Reduced Shadow Flare (Side Special)
tip_text_2169	The amount of energy that circles fighters will decrease when a\r\nthird fighter is hit by this attack. Also, it will decrease if the attack\r\nis reflected or absorbed.
tip_title_2170	{[0107|00000100]}Sephiroth: \x0f\x01\x07Blade Dash (Up Special)
tip_text_2170	Choose a direction at the start of the move, then slash at high speed\r\nin that direction. This can also be useful in getting back to the stage\r\nif you've been launched!
tip_title_2171	{[0107|00000100]}Sephiroth: \x0f\x01\x07Octaslash (Up Special)
tip_text_2171	Hold down the button and unleash Octaslash, which triggers eight\r\nrapid sword slashes in a row. This move is very powerful but will\r\nleave you open to enemy attacks at the end.
tip_title_2172	{[0107|00000100]}Sephiroth: \x0f\x01\x07Scintilla (Down Special)
tip_text_2172	Create a barrier in front of you, which will transform into Scintilla.\r\nWhile active, the barrier will block direct attacks or projectiles that\r\nstrike it.
tip_title_2173	{[0107|00000100]}Sephiroth: \x0f\x01\x07Scintilla Characteristics (Down Special)
tip_text_2173	Unlike other counters, the barrier of light you create will become\r\nScintilla even if no one hits it. However, Scintilla can be absorbed\r\nor reflected by your opponents!
tip_title_2174	{[0107|00000100]}Sephiroth: \x0f\x01\x07Scintilla's Power (Down Special)
tip_text_2174	The barrier of light immediately becomes Scintilla if it is attacked.\r\nScintilla is more powerful if the barrier absorbs a lot of damage, but\r\nthere is a limit—if the damage is too great, the barrier will break.
tip_title_2175	{[0107|00000100]}Sephiroth: \x0f\x01\x07Supernova (Final Smash)
tip_text_2175	Slash a wide area in front of you, hitting up to three opponents.\r\nThe slash is followed up with a powerful supernova explosion that\r\ndeals significant damage and sometimes inflicts status effects.
tip_title_2176	{[0107|00000100]}Sephiroth: \x0f\x01\x07Effects of Supernova (Final Smash)
tip_text_2176	Foes hit by Supernova may be affected by one of the following status\r\neffects: dizzy, sleep, reversed controls, slow, or a flower bloom. Anyone\r\nhit while off the stage won't be dizzy, asleep, or have reversed controls.
tip_title_2177	{[0107|00000100]}Sephiroth: \x0f\x01\x07Winged Form
tip_text_2177	When you are at a disadvantage, such as having more damage than your\r\nopponent, a wing can grow from your back. If this happens, your power\r\nand movement speed will increase and you can jump twice in midair.
tip_title_2178	{[0107|00000100]}Sephiroth: \x0f\x01\x07Winged Form Conditions
tip_text_2178	The greater the disadvantage you're at, such as in damage, score,\r\nor stock, the easier it will be for the wing to grow. Likewise, it will\r\nbe more difficult to grow the wing when you're at an advantage.
tip_title_2179	{[0107|00000100]}Sephiroth: \x0f\x01\x07Characteristics of Slashing/Stabbing
tip_text_2179	The middle part of the blade is the strongest when it comes to slashing\r\nattacks. For stabbing attacks, the tip of the blade is the strongest.\r\nThis is especially true at the moment you stick the blade out.
tip_title_2180	{[0107|00000100]}Sephiroth: \x0f\x01\x07Side Tilt Attack
tip_text_2180	Swing your blade in a far-reaching attack. You can choose for the\r\nmove to swing upward or downward by inputting up or down at the\r\nstart of the attack.
tip_title_2181	{[0107|00000100]}Sephiroth: \x0f\x01\x07Up Tilt Attack
tip_text_2181	Stab upward with the tip of the blade. This move has long range, but\r\nit is difficult to hit enemies who aren't directly above you. However,\r\nthe upward stab can catch opponents in front of you.
tip_title_2182	{[0107|00000100]}Sephiroth: \x0f\x01\x07Down Smash Attack
tip_text_2182	Stick the blade out diagonally and downward. If it strikes the ground\r\nand a cloud of dust rises, you'll deal increased damage. The dust cloud\r\nwill also weaken enemy shields, making it strong against defensive foes.
tip_title_2183	{[0107|00000100]}Sephiroth: \x0f\x01\x07Forward Air Attack
tip_text_2183	Stab forward with the sword. Use this attack to keep your opponents\r\nat bay for a while.\r\n
tip_title_2184	{[0107|00000100]}Sephiroth: \x0f\x01\x07Forward Air Attack and Walls
tip_text_2184	If this attack stabs into a wall, you can hang out there for a little while.\r\nIt's also possible to jump in this situation!\r\n
tip_title_2185	{[0107|00000100]}Sephiroth: \x0f\x01\x07Down Air Attack
tip_text_2185	Stab the blade directly downward, and unleash Hell's Gate.\r\nThis move has a meteor effect at the beginning of the attack.\r\n
tip_title_2187	{[0107|00000100]}Cloud: \x0f\x01\x07Omnislash Ver. 5 (Final Smash)
tip_text_2187	The even color variations will launch an opponent into the air and then\r\nslash them with a barrage of hits before striking with one final blow.\r\nDamage dealt and time taken by the other color variations is identical.
tip_title_2188	Northern Cave
tip_text_2188	Modeled after the Northern Cave from FINAL FANTASY VII. This is a\r\nsimple stage with two platforms, perfect for intense 1-on-1 battles.\r\n
tip_title_2189	{[0107|00000100]}Northern Cave: \x0f\x01\x07Changing Background
tip_text_2189	The stage will descend through the cave all the way to the Planet's Core,\r\nthen it will return to the surface. Meteor will be falling when the stage\r\nemerges, re-creating the setting of the epic battle for the Lifestream.
tip_title_2190	{[0107|00000100]}Northern Cave: \x0f\x01\x07The Planet's Core
tip_text_2190	When the stage moves down into the cave, the battle will enter the\r\nPlanet's Core, where the Lifestream can be seen. The platform here\r\nis where Cloud's party fought Jenova SYNTHESIS in the original game.
tip_title_2191	{[0107|00000100]}Northern Cave: \x0f\x01\x07Holy
tip_text_2191	The battle between Sephiroth and Cloud in the original game takes place\r\nin the deepest part of the Planet's Core. The Holy magic that protects\r\nthe world from Meteor shines from where it is trapped in the rock.
tip_title_2192	{[0107|00000100]}Northern Cave: \x0f\x01\x07The Highwind
tip_text_2192	If you look closely, the shape of the Highwind is different between\r\nwhen you enter the cave and when you leave it. Specifically, the\r\nHighwind will have big wings when you're leaving.
tip_title_2193	Pyra/Mythra's Origins
tip_text_2193	Pyra and Mythra made their debut in Xenoblade Chronicles 2,\r\nreleased in 2017. They are known as Blades, living weapons,\r\nand are specifically of a type called Aegis.
tip_title_2194	Pyra/Mythra: In Their Series
tip_text_2194	Pyra and Mythra are the same Blade, but they have their own identities,\r\neach with a different look and personality. Mythra is the original persona,\r\nbut for her own reasons, she sealed herself up and created Pyra.
tip_title_2195	Pyra/Mythra: Rex
tip_text_2195	Rex is the protagonist of Xenoblade Chronicles 2. He is a Driver who\r\nforged a bond with Pyra and Mythra. In this title he appears in Mythra\r\nand Pyra's Final Smash and joins them on the victory screen.
tip_title_2196	Pyra/Mythra: Their Own Traits
tip_text_2196	Pyra has more power between the two. Her side smash has especially\r\nhigh launch power. Mythra is much faster, though, and if you time your\r\ndodges well, you can execute effective counterattacks against your foes.
tip_title_2197	Pyra/Mythra: Swap to Pyra / Swap to Mythra (Down Special)
tip_text_2197	You can swap between Pyra or Mythra at any time during the battle.\r\nYou'll be briefly invincible as you swap, but afterward you'll be\r\nvulnerable to enemy attacks.
tip_title_2198	Pyra: Flame Nova (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2198	Cause the sword to revolve around you, launching nearby opponents.\r\nCharge up the attack by holding down the button, increasing the power\r\nof the sword and how many times it swings. The charge can't be stored.
tip_title_2199	Pyra: Flame Nova and Moving (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2199	While the sword is revolving, tilt the stick left or right to move slightly\r\nforward or backward without canceling the sword's movement.\r\n
tip_title_2200	Pyra: Blazing End (Side Special)
tip_text_2200	Throw the sword forward, slashing in that direction. The sword will\r\nspin briefly at its destination and then return to you. You're able to freely\r\nmove when this happens, but you can't attack until the sword returns.
tip_title_2201	Pyra: Blazing End and Flicking the Stick (Side Special)
tip_text_2201	Flick the control stick to extend the distance the sword flies. This will\r\nincrease the time it takes for the sword to return to you, so be careful\r\nnot to be without your sword when you need it most.
tip_title_2202	Pyra: Beginning of Blazing End (Side Special)
tip_text_2202	The initial attack will swing right in front of you in an upward motion.\r\nIf it hits an opponent, it will launch them and make it easy for the sword\r\nto hit them. Flick the stick to increase the damage and launch power!
tip_title_2203	Pyra: Blazing End near a Wall (Side Special)
tip_text_2203	If you use this move too close to a wall, the sword will hit the wall\r\nand return to you without spinning.\r\n
tip_title_2204	Pyra: Prominence Revolt (Up Special)
tip_text_2204	Leap high into the air and stab downward as you fall. You'll have a\r\nmeteor effect while falling, and when you land you'll create a large\r\npillar of fire in front of you.
tip_title_2205	Pyra: Moving during Prominence Revolt (Up Special)
tip_text_2205	Tilt the stick left or right during the jump to move a bit forward\r\nor backward.\r\n
tip_title_2206	Pyra: Burning Sword (Final Smash)
tip_text_2206	Rex can hit multiple opponents with a huge pillar of fire, launching\r\nthem away. This Final Smash deals less damage than Mythra's, but it\r\nhas higher launch power and can more easily KO opponents.
tip_title_2207	Pyra: Flare Smash (Side Smash)
tip_text_2207	Pyra's side smash deals serious damage and has high launch power.\r\nThe power of this attack is unique to Pyra, so go on the offense and try\r\nto land an early KO with this attack!
tip_title_2208	Mythra: Lightning Buster (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2208	Attack first with a diagonal blow, then follow up with three wide-range\r\nslashes. Charge up the attack to slash four times as well as to increase\r\nthe range and power. However, this charge cannot be stored.
tip_title_2209	Mythra: Invincibility during Lightning Buster (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2209	You'll be invincible during the initial diagonal slash of this move.\r\nIf you time it right, you can counterattack unopposed.\r\n
tip_title_2210	Mythra: Turning during Lightning Buster (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2210	If you tilt the stick behind you before unleashing the first swing, you can\r\nturn and attack in that direction. Just watch out for anyone trying to hit\r\nyou when your back is turned!
tip_title_2211	Mythra: Lightning Buster and Enemies behind You (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2211	If there is an opponent directly behind you when you perform the\r\nfirst slash, the follow-up spinning slashes are able to hit them\r\nand launch them forward.
tip_title_2212	Mythra: Photon Edge (Side Special)
tip_text_2212	Charge forward and jump around, quickly slashing five times. You can\r\nstrike in a very wide range with this attack, but you're still vulnerable\r\nto enemy projectiles, so be careful.
tip_title_2213	Mythra: Photon Edge and Stage Edges (Side Special)
tip_text_2213	The forward charge of this move is useful if you're trying to return to\r\nthe stage. However, if you use it while standing on an edge, you can\r\naccidentally hurl yourself off the stage. Whoops!
tip_title_2214	Mythra: Ray of Punishment (Up Special)
tip_text_2214	Slash upward and jump into the air. After the jump, fire a shot of\r\nlight diagonally downward. If this shot hits an opponent or the\r\nground, it will explode.
tip_title_2215	Mythra: Chroma Dust (Up Special)
tip_text_2215	If you press the special-move button after the jump but before the\r\nsingle shot, you'll fire a scatter shot. It has a wide range and launches\r\nfoes sideways—perfect for defending the sides of the stage.
tip_title_2216	Mythra: Chroma Dust in the Original Game (Up Special)
tip_text_2216	Originally in Xenoblade Chronicles 2: Torna - The Golden Country,\r\nthis move was a powerful special ability you could use in a pinch.\r\n
tip_title_2217	Mythra: Sacred Arrow (Final Smash)
tip_text_2217	Rain down arrows from above at the opponent Rex strikes.\r\nThis Final Smash has less launch power than Pyra's, but it\r\ndeals high continuous damage in a wide area.
tip_title_2218	Mythra: Foresight
tip_text_2218	If an opponent lands an attack right before you dodge, you'll take\r\nless damage and apply a slowing effect to them. Use your faster\r\nmovement to launch a counterattack!
tip_title_2219	Pyra/Mythra: Neutral Attack
tip_text_2219	The third strike of the neutral attack will differ between Pyra and Mythra.\r\nPyra will have greater launch power, while Mythra will launch opponents\r\nupward instead, setting them up for follow-up attacks.
tip_title_2220	Pyra/Mythra: Up Smash Attack
tip_text_2220	Hit an opponent in front of you to launch them upward. The attack hits\r\nin a wide area above but leaves you vulnerable otherwise. Pyra can\r\nlaunch foes with one hit, while Mythra needs a few to send them flying.
tip_title_2221	Pyra/Mythra: Down Smash Attack
tip_text_2221	Strike both forward and backward with your sword and your leg.\r\nThe sword blow will deal more damage than the kick. This attack covers\r\na wide area in the front and back but leaves you vulnerable above.
tip_title_2222	Pyra/Mythra: Neutral Air Attack
tip_text_2222	Pyra will launch opponents with impressive force, while Mythra will\r\ncontinuously attack and make it easy to follow up. Both attacks hit a\r\nwide area but will leave you vulnerable upon landing.
tip_title_2223	Pyra/Mythra: Down Air Attack
tip_text_2223	When Pyra strikes opponents below her, she'll cause a meteor effect.\r\nMythra won't trigger a meteor effect, but she is also less vulnerable\r\nwhen using this move.
tip_title_2224	Cloud Sea of Alrest
tip_text_2224	Travel through the Cloud Sea while riding on Azurda, a Titan and\r\nguardian of Rex. As you fly you'll see different Titans, as well as\r\nthe World Tree itself, in the background.
tip_title_2225	{[0107|00000100]}Cloud Sea of Alrest: \x0f\x01\x07Azurda's Posture
tip_text_2225	Battles on this stage are fought on Azurda, and he will occasionally\r\nmove his head or change his posture. When he looks back,\r\nthe platform will get shorter, so watch out.
tip_title_2226	{[0107|00000100]}Cloud Sea of Alrest: \x0f\x01\x07Azurda's Commentary
tip_text_2226	Azurda will observe the battle and sometimes offer commentary.\r\nHe'll also be sure to let you know when the battle is nearly over.\r\n
tip_title_2227	{[0107|00000100]}Cloud Sea of Alrest: \x0f\x01\x07Titans and Locations
tip_text_2227	The countries built on the Titans will appear in the background. These\r\ninclude Argentum, Gormott, Uraya, Mor Ardain, Tantal, and Indol.\r\nAzurda will share these names with you when he turns around.
tip_title_2228	{[0107|00000100]}Cloud Sea of Alrest: \x0f\x01\x07Guest Characters
tip_text_2228	Characters you meet during the events of the original game will appear\r\non Azurda's back. The Drivers and Blades will come out as pairs.\r\n
tip_title_2229	Kazuya's Origin
tip_text_2229	Kazuya made his debut in the 1994 arcade game Tekken. This was a\r\nfighting game that used 3D polygons, which was a rare thing back then.\r\nThe game was known for its unique characters.
tip_title_2230	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07In His Series
tip_text_2230	Kazuya is one of the main characters in the Tekken series. He's fought\r\nagainst his own son, Jin Kazama, and his own father, Heihachi Mishima.\r\nThanks to the Devil Gene, he is able to transform into a devil.
tip_title_2231	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Devil Blaster (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2231	When on the ground, unleash a powerful beam ahead of you.\r\nIn the air, the beam will angle downward. This attack has long range\r\nand can hit up to three fighters, but it loses power with each hit.
tip_title_2232	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Aiming the Devil Blaster (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2232	You can angle the beam up or down by inputting up or down with\r\nthe control stick right before the attack starts. Shots angled downward\r\nmay hit shorter opponents, but the power will be reduced.
tip_title_2233	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Devil Fist (Side Special)
tip_text_2233	The leading fist of this attack will pass through the opponent it hits.\r\nIf they're hit at the start of the attack, they'll be rendered immobile\r\nand be wide open for a follow-up attack!
tip_title_2234	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Devil Fist in the Air (Side Special)
tip_text_2234	The charge of this attack travels a shorter distance in the air than it\r\ndoes on the ground. You'll stop at edges when on the ground, though,\r\nbut not if you're airborne. Be careful not to throw yourself off the stage!
tip_title_2235	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Devil Fist Invincibility and Vulnerability (Side Special)
tip_text_2235	When used on the ground, you'll have a brief moment of invincibility\r\nat the start of the move. You'll be vulnerable afterward though, so use\r\nthis move when a hit is a sure thing!
tip_title_2236	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Devil Wings (Up Special)
tip_text_2236	You can shift a little to the left or right by pressing left or right\r\non the control stick as you rise. Also, you can attack opponents\r\nwith the claws on the wings!
tip_title_2237	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07After Using Devil Wings (Up Special)
tip_text_2237	After a little time passes, you can use most other moves after using\r\nthis one. The only exception is the side special—you'll have to land\r\nbefore you can use that.
tip_title_2238	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Heaven's Door (Down Special)
tip_text_2238	Deal serious damage to your opponent by grabbing them and then\r\nslamming them to the ground. You can ignore shields, but if you\r\nmiss, you'll be wide open!
tip_title_2239	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Heaven's Door's Super Armor (Down Special)
tip_text_2239	This move will give you super armor right at the start. You can try and\r\nsurprise an attacking opponent by starting this move at the same time,\r\nbut watch out—the move triggers slowly.
tip_title_2240	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Accumulated Damage and Heaven's Door (Down Special)
tip_text_2240	When you're in the air after grabbing someone with this move,\r\nyou can shift them left or right. The more damage they've taken,\r\nthe more you'll be able to shift around!
tip_title_2241	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Enemies Near Heaven's Door (Down Special)
tip_text_2241	If there are opponents near where you slam someone down,\r\nyou can also launch them with the impact.\r\n
tip_title_2242	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Final Blaster (Final Smash)
tip_text_2242	Unleash a far-reaching beam from your forehead. If that beam hits a foe,\r\nmore beams from your wings and chest will fire together. These beams\r\nwill cover a wide range in front of you, possibly hitting more opponents.
tip_title_2243	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Rage
tip_text_2243	If your damage is at 100% or more, or if you've got 1/4 or less of\r\nyour stamina remaining in Stamina mode, you will Rage, increasing\r\nyour power.
tip_title_2244	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07The Signs of Rage
tip_text_2244	While affected by Rage, a red aura will surround you. Additionally, the\r\nfighter name near the accumulated damage number will flash red.\r\n
tip_title_2245	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Rage Drive
tip_text_2245	While in a Rage and on the ground, press →↓ + either hold down the\r\nattack or special-move buttons, perform a down special, or grab, and\r\nyou'll unleash this move. Use command input for the strongest version.
tip_title_2246	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Features of Rage Drive
tip_text_2246	This move is very powerful and has few downsides—in fact, you can\r\ndisregard an opponent's shield! However, if you miss, you'll quickly\r\ndrop out of Rage. Use it well!
tip_title_2247	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Ending Rage
tip_text_2247	Your Rage will end when you hit an opponent with Rage Drive. Rage may\r\nalso end if you miss with Rage Drive or take damage too many times.\r\nOnce it ends, you'll have to get KO'd and come back to Rage again.
tip_title_2248	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Glorious Demon God Fist (Side Smash Attack)
tip_text_2248	A solid hit from this move can be the single most damaging ability\r\nKazuya has. It leaves you exposed, but it can send foes flying far\r\nto the side. It's perfect for multiple-foe battles!
tip_title_2249	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Lion Slayer (Down Smash Attack)
tip_text_2249	The hand thrown downward will have a meteor effect. If it hits\r\nsomeone on the ground, it'll bounce them upward, making it\r\neasy to continue a combo.
tip_title_2250	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Features of His Smash Attacks
tip_text_2250	All of Kazuya's smash attacks have super armor at the beginning\r\nof the move. His side and down smash attacks are great at weakening\r\nan opponent's shields, too.
tip_title_2251	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Command-Input Moves
tip_text_2251	While on the ground, combine directional inputs and the attack button,\r\nfor example ↓ + attack button or →→ + attack button, in order to use\r\ncommand-input moves. These moves are stronger than the normal ones.
tip_title_2252	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x0710 Hit Combo (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2252	Repeatedly press the attack button quickly, or hold it down, to\r\npull off a combo of up to 10 hits. The last attack will ignore an\r\nopponent's shield.
tip_title_2253	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Flash Punch Combo (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2253	After using two neutral attacks, wait just a moment before the third\r\nneutral attack in order to pull off this move. The attack power for this\r\nmove is high and useful in dealing some quick damage.
tip_title_2254	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Left Splits Kick (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2254	When facing right, you can quickly input →→ + attack button to\r\nuse this move. It has great power and won't leave you vulnerable\r\nto attacks. It can also reflect projectiles!
tip_title_2255	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Twin Pistons (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2255	Unleash an uppercut with ↑ + attack button, and then press the attack\r\nbutton again to use Twin Pistons. Your upper half will be invincible\r\nduring the move, so it's a powerful counter for attacks from the air.
tip_title_2256	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Using Twin Pistons (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2256	If you stop at the first move, you will launch opponents upward,\r\nmaking them easier to hit with a follow-up attack. If you continue\r\ninto the second move, you can launch opponents even higher.
tip_title_2257	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Roundhouse to Triple Spin Kicks (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2257	Input  + attack button four times while facing right to use the move.\r\nIf the first attack hits, you'll keep hitting for serious damage. You'll hop\r\nslightly at the start, avoiding low attacks and going for a counter.
tip_title_2258	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Oni Front Kick (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2258	Use → + attack button for this move. Since this move launches foes\r\nsideways, try to use it near the edge. It's an easy KO against foes\r\nthat have trouble getting back to the stage.
tip_title_2259	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Tsunami Kick (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2259	While facing right, lift an opponent off the ground with  + attack button,\r\nthen launch them upward by pressing the attack button again. The first\r\nattack sets up a combo, the second weakens shields.
tip_title_2260	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Nejiri Uraken (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2260	You can use the move with ↓ + attack button. Toward the end of\r\nthe move, you will be invincible while using the Uraken. If you press\r\nthe shield button before using the Uraken, you can cancel the move.
tip_title_2261	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Stature Smash (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2261	When facing right, this move is triggered by pressing    + attack button.\r\nThe reach is short, but the move leaves you less vulnerable. If it hits,\r\nyou'll have a perfect opportunity for a follow-up attack.
tip_title_2262	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Flash Tornado (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2262	When facing right, this move is triggered by pressing ← + attack button.\r\nThe top half of your body will be invincible, and you can attack\r\ndiagonally upward. Use this against enemies coming from above.
tip_title_2263	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Jump Side Kick (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2263	You can use this move by pressing  + attack button while at a distance\r\nfrom the opponents. It's hard for opponents to grab you while jumping,\r\nso this move is great against opponents planning to intercept you.
tip_title_2264	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Jump Side Kick Invincibility (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2264	The lower half of your body is invincible at the start of this move.\r\nThe leg that extends to kick will briefly be invincible, making this\r\na great attack against opponents when attacking from above.
tip_title_2265	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Tombstone Crusher (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2265	When facing right, this move is triggered by crouching and pressing\r\n + attack button. You'll be invincible for a while, and the attack launches\r\nfoes in a low direction, so try and intercept airborne opponents.
tip_title_2266	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Crouch Jab (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2266	When facing right, this move is triggered by crouching and pressing\r\n↓ + attack button. It's a quick move and is easy to follow with\r\nOni Front Kick, Wind God Fist, or Spinning Demon to Left Hook.
tip_title_2267	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Crouch Spin Kick (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2267	When facing right, this move is triggered by crouching and pressing\r\n  + attack button. You will attack from a low position, making it\r\neasier to dodge opponents that are aiming high.
tip_title_2268	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Demon God Fist (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2268	You can use this move while moving from a crouch to standing by\r\npressing the attack button. A hit will stun the opponent, but after\r\nthe attack, you'll be left vulnerable. Don't miss!
tip_title_2269	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Gates of Hell (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2269	When facing right, this move is triggered by pressing ↓ + grab.\r\nThe reach of this attack is quite long. It's a tricky input, but pulling it\r\noff will launch an opponent way off to the side—perfect for KOs.
tip_title_2270	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Crouch Dash (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2270	When facing right, this special dash is triggered by pressing →↓.\r\nYou're invincible right when you start moving, and your upper half is\r\ninvincible until you stand. Use it to avoid attacks and quickly get in close.
tip_title_2271	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Movement after Crouch Dash (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2271	Use Crouch Dash and then Spinning Demon to Left Hook or Wind God\r\nFist to keep opponents at bay. If the opponent likes to shield, use\r\nHeaven's Door or Gates of Hell to grab them.
tip_title_2272	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Wind God Fist (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2272	When facing right, this move is triggered by pressing →↓ + attack button.\r\nYou can quickly get into range with Crouch Dash. It's very powerful and\r\nmakes it easy to follow up and combo after the hit.
tip_title_2273	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Electric Wind God Fist (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2273	When facing right, this move is triggered by pressing  and the\r\nattack button at the same time while using Wind God Fist. The attack\r\nis stronger and has longer invincibility. It will stun opponents if it hits.
tip_title_2274	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Electric Wind God Fist and Shields (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2274	Unlike the Wind God Fist, the Electric Wind God Fist will\r\npush away opponents that shield, giving you some distance.\r\n
tip_title_2275	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Dragon Uppercut (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2275	When facing right, this move is triggered by pressing →↓ + holding the\r\nattack button. Your whole body is invincible at the start, and your upper\r\nhalf will be invincible while you uppercut. This is a slow, powerful move.
tip_title_2276	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Spinning Demon to Left Hook (Command-Input Move)
tip_text_2276	When facing right, this move is triggered by pressing →↓ + special-\r\nmove button. When you start moving, you'll briefly be invincible. Use this\r\nto launch opponents, especially if you're saving your Rage Drive.
tip_title_2277	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Leaping Sidekick
tip_text_2277	You can trigger this move by pressing the attack button while dashing.\r\nYou can move forward while avoiding low attacks, but your back\r\nis completely exposed.
tip_title_2278	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Face Off 1-on-1
tip_text_2278	In 1-on-1 fights, you will automatically face toward your opponent.\r\nKeep that in mind when you're looking to use command-input moves!\r\n
tip_title_2279	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Tough Body
tip_text_2279	While you have low damage, the weak attacks of opponents will\r\nnot cause you to flinch. This makes it much easier to unleash combos.\r\n
tip_title_2280	{[0107|00000100]}Kazuya: \x0f\x01\x07Moves Good for Follow-Up Attacks
tip_text_2280	Follow up on vulnerable opponents using moves like Stature\r\nSmash ( + attack button), Lion Slayer (down smash attack),\r\nor Roundhouse to Triple Spin Kicks ( + attack button four times).
tip_title_2281	{[0107|00000100]}Mishima Dojo: \x0f\x01\x07Destroying the Walls and Ceiling
tip_text_2281	The walls and ceiling will break from attacks or the impacts of fighters.\r\nThese spots can save you from being KO'd, but they won't help\r\nonce they break. Broken spots will be restored after some time.
tip_title_2282	{[0107|00000100]}Mishima Dojo: \x0f\x01\x07Below the Destroyed Ceiling
tip_text_2282	If the ceiling gets destroyed, debris will be on the ground beneath it.\r\nIf you see the debris, do your best not to get launched upward!\r\n
tip_title_2283	{[0107|00000100]}Mishima Dojo: \x0f\x01\x07Through the Walls and Ceiling
tip_text_2283	Even if the walls or ceiling aren't broken, a strong enough impact\r\ncould still send you flying right through them. Be careful if your\r\ndamage is high!
tip_title_2284	{[0107|00000100]}Mishima Dojo: \x0f\x01\x07Heihachi 
tip_text_2284	Heihachi Mishima will appear in the background of the stage. He'll sit\r\nwith his back toward you at first, but he'll stand when a wall or ceiling\r\ngets destroyed. If a fighter gets KO'd, he'll raise his fist in their direction.
tip_title_2285	Sora's Origins
tip_text_2285	Sora made his debut in KINGDOM HEARTS, released in 2002.\r\nAfter his homeland was consumed by darkness, Sora set off on\r\nan adventure to find Riku and Kairi, his childhood friends.
tip_title_2286	{[0107|00000100]}Sora: \x0f\x01\x07In His Series
tip_text_2286	An energetic boy from Destiny Islands. He was chosen by the\r\nKeyblade and travels through many worlds, going on adventures\r\nrelated to the heart.
tip_title_2287	{[0107|00000100]}Sora: \x0f\x01\x07Move Features
tip_text_2287	The Keyblade swings slowly, but the attacks can deal damage\r\nover a longer stretch of time, so it's easy to outhit others. However,\r\nyou are very vulnerable before and after attacks as a result.
tip_title_2288	{[0107|00000100]}Sora: \x0f\x01\x07Magic (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2288	Each time you use your neutral special, it will cycle between three\r\ntypes: Firaga, Thundaga, and Blizzaga. Firaga can be shot multiple times,\r\nThundaga has high damage power, and Blizzaga can freeze opponents.
tip_title_2289	{[0107|00000100]}Sora: \x0f\x01\x07Firaga (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2289	Press the button repeatedly to fire multiple shots. Thanks to its long\r\nrange, this move is the best of the magic attacks for keeping\r\nyour opponents at a distance.
tip_title_2290	{[0107|00000100]}Sora: \x0f\x01\x07Thundaga (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2290	Call down lighting in a wide range in front of you, sending anyone who\r\ngets hit flying upward. This move leaves you vulnerable before and after\r\nyou use it, but hitting three times will deal some serious damage.
tip_title_2291	{[0107|00000100]}Sora: \x0f\x01\x07Thundaga in the Air (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2291	Use this move while you're in the air and lightning will come down\r\ncloser together and from higher up. This does change the range of\r\nthe move, though, so keep that in mind.
tip_title_2292	{[0107|00000100]}Sora: \x0f\x01\x07Blizzaga (Neutral Special)
tip_text_2292	These chilly shots will scatter and fly through the air. Opponents who\r\nare hit several times will freeze, and those who have taken a lot of\r\ndamage will freeze for longer. Get close to make it really easy to hit!
tip_title_2293	{[0107|00000100]}Sora: \x0f\x01\x07Sonic Blade Additional Inputs (Side Special)
tip_text_2293	Tilt the control stick while charging forward to charge in that\r\ndirection. You can affect the direction you charge up to two times.\r\n
tip_title_2294	{[0107|00000100]}Sora: \x0f\x01\x07Charge Opponents With Sonic Blade (Side Special)
tip_text_2294	If you press the special-move button when opponents are nearby, you\r\nwill automatically charge toward the nearest foe. The attack is slightly\r\nstronger when charging using this method instead of the control stick.
tip_title_2295	{[0107|00000100]}Sora: \x0f\x01\x07Sonic Blade Charge Speed (Side Special)
tip_text_2295	Each time you charge, you'll lose a bit of speed. You'll also lose speed\r\nif you hit an opponent or they shield against your attack, so don't go\r\ncharging into danger without a plan.
tip_title_2296	{[0107|00000100]}Sora: \x0f\x01\x07Sonic Blade and Edges (Side Special)
tip_text_2296	If you are offstage and use the special-move button to perform\r\nyour last charge, you'll head toward the edge to try and recover.\r\n
tip_title_2297	{[0107|00000100]}Sora: \x0f\x01\x07Shifting During Aerial Sweep (Up Special)
tip_text_2297	As you rise up, you can shift left or right by inputting left or right on\r\nthe control stick. Also, you can use Sonic Blade at the end of the move\r\nto evade foes or recover.
tip_title_2298	{[0107|00000100]}Sora: \x0f\x01\x07Counterattack (Down Special)
tip_text_2298	Deflect an opponent's direct attack and briefly stagger them,\r\nas well as negate the damage of projectiles! The stronger an\r\nattack, the more powerful the counter!
tip_title_2299	{[0107|00000100]}Sora: \x0f\x01\x07Countering Behind You (Down Special)
tip_text_2299	You can counter attacks that come from behind, but the area that will\r\ntrigger the move is smaller, so it's harder to do than against attacks\r\nfrom the front.
tip_title_2300	{[0107|00000100]}Sora: \x0f\x01\x07Sealing the Keyhole (Final Smash)
tip_text_2300	A Keyhole will appear in front and damage up to three nearby\r\nopponents. Any opponent with more than 100% damage will be\r\ninstantly KO'd at the end of the move.
tip_title_2301	{[0107|00000100]}Sora: \x0f\x01\x07Caught in Sealing the Keyhole (Final Smash)
tip_text_2301	The first beam you unleash will launch opponents toward the Keyhole.\r\nThere's no limit to how many foes can be hit by this beam, but only\r\nthe first three will get caught up in the attack that follows.
tip_title_2302	{[0107|00000100]}Sora: \x0f\x01\x07Combo Attacks
tip_text_2302	Some of Sora's attacks can lead into combos of up to three hits. The\r\nneutral attack, side tilt attack, neutral air attack, and forward air attack\r\ncan all be combos by holding down or repeatedly pressing the button.
tip_title_2303	{[0107|00000100]}Sora: \x0f\x01\x07Side Tilt Attack's Combo
tip_text_2303	On its own, the side tilt attack will have increased launch power.\r\nWhen used as part of a combo, it can do increased damage.\r\nJudge how best to use it in different situations.
tip_title_2304	{[0107|00000100]}Sora: \x0f\x01\x07Neutral Attack Combo and Tilt Attack Combo
tip_text_2304	Starting a combo with the neutral attack won't deal much damage,\r\nbut it is quick. Starting with a side tilt attack will deal more damage,\r\nbut it takes longer.
tip_title_2305	{[0107|00000100]}Sora: \x0f\x01\x07Combos in the Air
tip_text_2305	Combos with the neutral air attack are easier to do without any left\r\nor right input. Combos with the forward air attack are easier to land\r\nby continuously tilting the control stick toward the opponent.
tip_title_2306	{[0107|00000100]}Sora: \x0f\x01\x07Using Combos in the Air
tip_text_2306	It's easier to land the first hit of an airborne combo using the\r\nneutral air attack, but combos from forward air attacks are\r\na great way to lock down an opponent on the left or right.
tip_title_2307	{[0107|00000100]}Sora: \x0f\x01\x07Combos after a Down Tilt Attack
tip_text_2307	If you hit an enemy with the down tilt attack, they'll be launched\r\nslightly upward. This sets them up nicely for an up special move,\r\nor you could use an up tilt attack to start a combo.
tip_title_2308	{[0107|00000100]}Sora: \x0f\x01\x07Dash Attack 
tip_text_2308	This dash attack has a lot of reach and stays out for quite a while.\r\nUse it to close the distance with an opponent and bring the fight\r\nto them!
tip_title_2309	{[0107|00000100]}Sora: \x0f\x01\x07Up Smash Attack
tip_text_2309	This up smash attack has great launch power, making it easy to KO\r\nfoes upward. The start of the move also hits in front, so opponents\r\nthere might just get caught in the attack too!
tip_title_2310	{[0107|00000100]}Sora: \x0f\x01\x07Down Smash Attack
tip_text_2310	You have a brief period of intangibility at the start of this move.\r\nIt's particularly strong against opponents who are using ledge attacks,\r\nor against opponents who are shielding.
tip_title_2311	{[0107|00000100]}Sora: \x0f\x01\x07Down Air Attack
tip_text_2311	Attack in all directions as you fall directly downward, but be careful\r\nusing this when you're offstage; you might be able to save yourself\r\nwith an up special or side special, but it'll be tough!
tip_title_2312	{[0107|00000100]}Sora: \x0f\x01\x07Final Blow in Stamina Battles
tip_text_2312	If you reduce the last opponent's health to zero in a Stamina Battle,\r\nsomething special will happen, similar to what happened in\r\nthe original game!
tip_title_2313	Hollow Bastion
tip_text_2313	Do battle as you travel through many locations of Hollow Bastion\r\nfrom the original game. Go through the Rising Falls, Castle Gates,\r\nLift Stop, Great Crest, and look down on the castle from above.
tip_title_2314	{[0107|00000100]}Hollow Bastion: \x0f\x01\x07Dive to the Heart
tip_text_2314	When the battle is almost over, the background will change to a\r\ndark, special area with stained glass. The platforms will change to\r\na stained-glass style as well.
tip_title_2315	{[0107|00000100]}Hollow Bastion: \x0f\x01\x07Dive to the Heart's Stained Glass
tip_text_2315	There are seven types of stained glass designs. However, Sora's\r\nstained glass will only show up when he is not fighting in the battle.\r\n
